story:
Acerca de mí

Soy Diana Tovar, cantante e investigadora de Cartagena, radicada en Bogotá (Colombia). Desde 2010 desarrollo mi proyecto como solista. Esta propuesta musical aborda la riqueza de las músicas colombianas con nuevos sonidos, lenguajes rítmicos y mezclas a través de la canción.

La música es una oportunidad de expresión infinita llena de posibilidades. Mi voz y mi canto son un lugar de encuentro conmigo misma, y es sencillamente mágico compartirla con todos ustedes. Canto desde los doce años, y desde el año 2010 me lancé a la aventura de liderar un proyecto de música independiente como cantante, compositora y directora. Provengo de un lugar mágico del Caribe: Cartagena. Allí crecí cerca al mar y las músicas afroantillanas, la salsa y la champeta, entre otras, hasta hacer mi vida en la fría y también cálida Bogotá, que me ha acogido generosamente, lugar donde se conjugan músicas, ritmos e influencias diversas. 

A lo largo de estos años he venido madurando un sonido propio lleno de universos sonoros y ricos en melodías y letras. Complemento mi actividad artística con actividades de tipo cultural, social y de género con mi trabajo y mi interés como investigadora con comunidades afectadas por el conflicto y con mujeres víctimas de violencia de género. Todo esto hace parte de mi inspiración para componer y este álbum, compuesto por diez canciones, es la suma de estos años de experiencias musicales. Esta campaña es importante para mí porque me permitirá materializar este proyecto.  Estoy emocionada de poder compartir con ustedes la felicidad de sacar a la luz este trabajo.

El álbum Canciones de mar y río

Esta campaña de financiación colectiva tiene como objeto costear los gastos de mezcla, master, impresión, arte y promoción del disco para su edición, publicación y lanzamiento.

Canciones de mar y río es mi primer álbum y cuenta con 10 canciones escritas por mí. En él participaron grandes músicos de la escena de la músicas populares colombianas y el jazz. El álbum fue grabado entre julio y agosto del 2016, con el productor Oscar Alford. Las fotografías para el arte del álbum fueron tomadas en diciembre de 2016 por el fotógrafo francés Louis Nespoulous, y la dirección de arte de las fotografías fue realizada por Diego Santamaría. En lo que va del año hemos trabajado en las piezas audiovisuales y la estrategia de promoción, y la preparación de la campaña para sacar adelante este proyecto.

En 2016 financié por mi propia cuenta la grabación de la música, y el material audiovisual para poder promocionar mi trabajo, así como las fotografías para prensa, portada del álbum y librillo en el que irán las letras de las canciones.

Hasta el momento no tengo ningún sello discográfico ni apoyo de ningún patrocinador.

El álbum fue grabado en bloque en los estudios de Audiovisión por el ingeniero Stefano Pizzaia. Hicimos grabaciones adicionales (coros, voces y semillas) en los estudios Epia con el ingeniero Rafael Santamaría. Tiene la participación especial de la gran Lucía Pulido en la canción "Amanecer". 

Listado de las canciones

Quiero compartirles los nombres de las canciones que hacen parte de este trabajo:

1.   Paciencia

2.   Agua de Rosas 

3.   Besos de Junio

4.   Juana Lucía

5.   Durumba

6.   Caminito

7.   Luna que te coge

8.   Nostalgia del Ñame

9.   Estoy 

10. Amanecer (Colaboración con Lucía Pulido).

 

Créditos

1.   Paciencia. Música: Diana Tovar. Letra: Diana Tovar. Arreglo: Diana Tovar.

2.   Agua de Rosas. Música: Diana Tovar. Letra: Diana Tovar. Arreglos: Julián Gómez y Jhon Socha.

3.   Besos de Junio. Música: Diana Tovar. Letra: Diana Tovar. Arreglos: Santiago Sandoval.

4.   Juana Lucía. Música: Diana Tovar. Letra: Diana Tovar. Arreglos: Diana Tovar.

5.   Durumba. Música: Diana Tovar y Alfonso Cabanzo. Letra: Diana Tovar. Arreglos: Julián Gómez.

6.   Caminito. Música: Diana Tovar. Letra: Diana Tovar. Arreglos: Julián Gómez, Santiago Sandoval y Diana Tovar.

7.   Luna que te coge. Música: Diana Tovar. Letra: Diana Tovar. Arreglos: Diana Tovar, Jhon Socha.

8.   Amanecer. Música: Diana Tovar. Letra: Diana Tovar. Arreglos: Santiago Sandoval.

9.   Nostalgia del Ñame. Música: Diana Tovar. Letra: Diana Tovar. Arreglos: Diana Tovar, Jhon Socha y Franklim Montaño.

10. Estoy: Música: Diana Tovar. Letra: Diana Tovar.  Arreglos: Diana Tovar y Sebastián Villanueva.

Todas las canciones compuestas por Diana Tovar (Letras y Música) excepto Durumba compuesta por Diana Tovar (Letra y Música) y Alfonso Cabanzo (Música).

Nos lanzamos al agua con las canciones de mar y río

A través de esta campaña tengo la meta de recaudar 21 millones de pesos, alrededor de US7.000, suma que he calculado me ayudaría a financiar la mezcla, el master, el arte, la impresión y la promoción del álbum. 

Tengo recompensas exclusivas que te llamarán la atención y te inspirarán a sumarte a este sueño que poco a poco se materializa. Las recompensas van desde clases de canto, el álbum en preventa en físico y en digital, clases de cocina caribe (mote de queso y arroz con coco), móviles de Durumba (delfín) para grandes y pequeños, libro de poetas afrocartageneras, delantales y guantes para cocinar y súper shows acústicos.

Cualquier aporte que pueda recibir va a ayudar a acercarme a la meta de este proyecto. 

En este disco confluyen músicos emblemáticos de la escena de las músicas colombianas y el jazz en Colombia, se ha hecho con motivación y mucho amor colectivo. 

Si no me puedes ayudar de manera económica, compartir mi campaña en tus redes sociales puede hacer la diferencia a la hora de alcanzar mi meta.

story:
Short Summary

Sabroso is a Portland, Oregon based Latin Funk band formed by brothers Ricardo and Pablo Ojeda formerly of the band Rubberneck. From an early age, brothers Ricardo and Pablo have had a love for music and have always wanted to get their music out to as many people as possible. Most bands could easily set up a few mics and record an album on a laptop but Sabroso wants a quality product. We are passionate about our music and want it to come across exactly how we intend it. Recording in a real studio is not cheap but will guarantee we turn out the best product possible. We want to be proud of what we produce but more importantly we want our fans to have an amazing, high quality album of new music.

 

What We Need & What You Get

In order to complete our latest project we will need funds for studio time, an engineer, mixing, mastering, and finally printing of the CDs.

For each generous contribution there will be perks such as the new CD once it has been completed, your name added to the liner notes, free tickets to upcoming shows, and more.

If we are unable to reach our goal it may delay the release of our album but we will still use every penny to pay for this album. Every little bit helps! 

The Impact

Without your contribution it will be very difficult for us to complete this project. We really want this album to be special, not only for us but for our fans as well. 

Risks & Challenges

The major risk and challenge facing us is time. We want to get this album into people's hands as soon as possible. Without outside funding it could delay the project. We will finish the album regardless of what happens. Nothing can stop our drive to put out good music.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are unable to contribute please consider sharing this campaign with anyone that might be able to help. We always welcome help in any form, monetary or not.

story:
Your contributions will fund the following: 

  • Mixing
  • Mastering 
  • CD Manufacturing 
  • Vinyl Pressing 
  • Marketing & Promotion
  • 8% Indiegogo and Processing Fees

The Impact

Your contributions will enable us to focus on the music and to keep the momentum without having to worry about the financial burden of the costs involved.

We are parents of 3 children and have to work normal jobs in order to support our family.  Scheduling alone to complete this is challenging enough . Between work days and business of home life, scheduling alone as we finish our album is challenging enough. With your support, we can focus on creating something unique in order to start a movement of Hope in Love, something that is so desperately needed in our world right now. Come be a part of that movement.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are not able to support our campaign with monetarily donations, you can still help us greatly by re-posting future updates, as well as sharing this page directly with the Indiegogo share tools. I’ll be updating frequently across all social media platforms with progress on the campaign as well as footage that has been captured along the way.

 Any help spreading the word is greatly appreciated.

 

 

For updates, follow us.

http://www.facebook.com/starrband

http://www.starrband.com

https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCEtdeWoXBJfJs24caL9zLuA

http://www.twitter.com/starrband

story:
Hello friend.

Please give us money so we can give you a record.  We have beautifully-designed cover/label art, carefully vinyl-mastered audio, and a critically acclaimed masterpiece of an album.

Give us extra money and you also get an original David Liebe Hart drawing, made to your specific instructions.  If you want to send a photo of yourself or whatever subject matter, David will draw it.

Give us more money and we will also send you an exclusive T-shirt featuring the cover art.
story_txt:
Hello friend.
Please give us money so we can give you a record.  We have beautifully-designed cover/label art, carefully vinyl-mastered audio, and a critically acclaimed masterpiece of an album.
Give us extra money and you also get an original David Liebe Hart drawing, made to your specific instructions.  If you want to send a photo of yourself or whatever subject matter, David will draw it.
Give us more money and we will also send you an exclusive T-shirt featuring the cover art.

story:
Avec ce Premier Album je pourrai enfin ancrer mon envie de partager la musique qui vibre en moi.

Pour ces compos l'eau est une de mes inspirations majeures! Mixer  le son de la Harpe/Voix avec celui de la rivière me parle depuis longtemps. 

Croire en ses rêves ça  en vaut la peine !

Après avoir joué dans la Sud de la France (églises, ermitages, Châteaux, monuments historiques du pays cathare), j'aimerais pouvoir jouer aussi dans  d'autres régions ou pays.

Pour cela avoir un CD comme support de promotion est nécessaire et idéal

 

La somme de 1800€ m'aiderait à payer:

-le mastering de l'album (200€)

- le gravage du Cd et l'impression de  la Pochette (500€)

-Les photos et travaux d'infographie de la Pochette (200€)

-Les frais du financement participatif (200€)

-et tout ce qui est déclaration officielles : -SDRM (500€)  et -SASEM (175€)

 

Comme contre partie , j'avais pensé à  l'envoi du CD à tous ceux qui y auront participé à hauteur de 15€ pour la France et 20€ pour l'étranger;  Pour un montant égal ou supérieur à 50€ je vous propose en plus du CD des cours de harpe et/ou une entrée gratuite pour un concert.
 

Je remercie pour l'agréable collaboration avec sihanama et David ona

je remercie Sara pour son crédit photo sur l'eau,

Merci de m'aider que ce soit financièrement ou en partageant un maximum sur vos réseaux

story:
Music provides a voice to the heard and unheard. Growing up I was very shy and quiet. My journey through music has been interesting and provided a voice for me. I started out singing in the church as a young girl, as a kid I would see the videos of other artist or hear them on the radio singing, would love it, but didn’t think it would apply to me. Coming from a small city in Virginia I thought becoming a singer was unreachable, so I settled in my thoughts of just singing in church and believed I was giving back and doing what I was supposed to do.

Growing up in a real strict upbringing, as I grew up and started working, I would sneak to talent competitions and actually would win (shhh..don’t tell my dad)…lol. This will be his first time seeing this…lol.(He is very supportive of my singing career btw). I was surrounded by the pressures of living up to, in a lot of cases, assumptions of what I thought I should be doing or what was accepted and took a different path in the computer industry and started living, what I believed, the life I was supposed to live. I would audition for competitions every now and then, and still sing in the church thinking I was doing what I was supposed to do.

One day while singing at a church in California, a 16-year-old young man, spoke with his grandmother about me how he was touched, she then took his word and invited me to sing at her conferences for what now has been 10 years. Shortly after being invited my thinking and outlook started shifting and I started asking myself hard questions and doors began to open immediately for me and started walking in them. Every day as an artist and vocalist I keep growing and know that there is no limit, and everything is reachable and work to get out of my comfort zones.

I am blessed with an amazing daughter who sees her mom taking the steps to follow a calling and who is developing in her gift as songwriter, singer, scriptwriter, fashion stylist and who knows what else. I tell her there is no limit. My daughter is one of the crucial reasons that I pursue with tenacity and determination to be an example and setup a legacy for generations to come.

I have been blessed to perform in front of thousands of people and have opened for Billboard winner and 13x Grammy nominee Musiq Soulchild and have also toured internationally Grammy Winner Earl Thomas! I am excited to wbe working with some of the greatest songwriters, musicians and producer of our time.  My producer is 2x Grammy Winner, Kamau Kenyatta, who received two Grammy’s with the great Gregory Porter and was nominated for two others.  He has also worked with the legendary Aretha Franklin, New Kids on the Block, Patti Austin, SWV, Silk to only name of few. Kamau’s resume is extensive and I am so excited to work with him and be able to create a masterpiece with him.

How You Can Help

  1. Pre-production: 
    • This crucial pre-production portion, done by all the best in field, is where Kamau and I spend time creating and refining our musical ideas. This is where we will pre-establish the song's creative premise. This decreases the time and money spent in expensive studios. The goal is to go into the major recording phase of production with the uncomplicated and most promising concepts having been already established.
  2. Recording: 
    • To make this album something we all can be proud of some of the best musicians, and engineers will be hired.
  3. Mixing & Mastering:
    • Mixing is where we will address any recording issues, add creativity, and do everything to make this project “complete” and cohesive.
    • Mastering is where will test to make sure each song sounds great in isolation, competing in volume, clarity, and warmth with other songs on the market, and sounds great as a package with the other songs in the album.  Mastering provides a unifying feel in frequency response and volume across an entire record.
  4. CD pressing and promotion:
    • This includes an expert photographer for the album, graphic designer, cd duplication, and marketing

Please share this campaign and tell your friends. We are excited about this upcoming journey and grateful to experience this with you!

With So Much Love,

Cerissa

One day while singing at a church in California, a 16-year-old young man, spoke with his grandmother about me how he was touched, she then took his word and invited me to sing at her conferences for what now has been 10 years. Shortly after being invited my thinking and outlook started shifting and I started asking myself hard questions and doors began to open immediately for me and started walking in them. Every day as an artist and vocalist I keep growing and know that there is no limit, and everything is reachable and work to get out of my comfort zones.
I am blessed with an amazing daughter who sees her mom taking the steps to follow a calling and who is developing in her gift as songwriter, singer, scriptwriter, fashion stylist and who knows what else. I tell her there is no limit. My daughter is one of the crucial reasons that I pursue with tenacity and determination to be an example and setup a legacy for generations to come.
I have been blessed to perform in front of thousands of people and have opened for Billboard winner and 13x Grammy nominee Musiq Soulchild and have also toured internationally Grammy Winner Earl Thomas! I am excited to wbe working with some of the greatest songwriters, musicians and producer of our time.  My producer is 2x Grammy Winner, Kamau Kenyatta, who received two Grammy’s with the great Gregory Porter and was nominated for two others.  He has also worked with the legendary Aretha Franklin, New Kids on the Block, Patti Austin, SWV, Silk to only name of few. Kamau’s resume is extensive and I am so excited to work with him and be able to create a masterpiece with him.

How You Can Help


Pre-production: This crucial pre-production portion, done by all the best in field, is where Kamau and I spend time creating and refining our musical ideas. This is where we will pre-establish the song's creative premise. This decreases the time and money spent in expensive studios. The goal is to go into the major recording phase of production with the uncomplicated and most promising concepts having been already established.


Recording: To make this album something we all can be proud of some of the best musicians, and engineers will be hired.


Mixing & Mastering:
Mixing is where we will address any recording issues, add creativity, and do everything to make this project “complete” and cohesive.
Mastering is where will test to make sure each song sounds great in isolation, competing in volume, clarity, and warmth with other songs on the market, and sounds great as a package with the other songs in the album.  Mastering provides a unifying feel in frequency response and volume across an entire record.



CD pressing and promotion:This includes an expert photographer for the album, graphic designer, cd duplication, and marketing


Please share this campaign and tell your friends. We are excited about this upcoming journey and grateful to experience this with you!
With So Much Love,
Cerissa

story:
Hi there good people! My name is TolumiDE (pronounced toe-lu me-day) I’m a singer-songwriter from Nigeria, born in Canada and currently based in the Maryland - Washington, D.C. area. Yes, I am truly an international artist (ha-ha) and I can’t wait to share this project with you!

I’m working on a two part project for my new music. The 1st will be a 6 song EP Album titled Mama Sunshine and the 2nd a Full-length Album #SuyaSoul. Mama Sunshine album will give listeners a more intimate setting with me. I share joys, memoirs and adventures of being a female in the 21st century, while staying transparent and open with the tough situations that life throws our way. The full-length album will include additional songs I've written and I will be working with talented industry professionals, musicians and producers.

I believe this upcoming project has the ability to connect with anyone that listens. I tell love stories through my music, not just love for your significant other, but all levels and areas of love. Love for the world, friendship, children, God and for life as a whole. I strive to create music that combines heart and soul messages that's relatable and keeps us grounded and appreciating life.  So, please continue to read and follow my journey.

 

I’ve always loved to sing, dance, and entertain. It all stared at a really young age and my parents have many memorable stories to share. My entrepreneur mum designed stylish outfits from her clothing store to wear for featured performance and my artist architect engineer dad would take me to performances while encouraging me to me to be the best I could possibly be with my art. Music naturally became a part of my life. While in Nigeria I sang at church, in primary and secondary school, with friends and on occasion had some singing and dancing routines with my four siblings. When I moved to Canada to study Fine Arts at York University I also sang in an all-female reggae band. That was my first introduction to formally performing in the music industry.

In the final year of my undergrad studies, my mum died of cancer. I remember all I could think of when I got the call she had passed away, was how I had planned to call her the day before and I never got around to do so. I had to come to terms with what mattered most, wasn’t what she may or may not have said if I had called her the day before, but what she brought to my life during our time together. When I reflected on her strength and resilience through her battle with cancer and her smiles and ability to maintain her glow through tough moments, it made me think of the power of Sunshine.  It always comes out to brighten up the day and give a sense of hope, love and feeling.

 

After graduation, I spent some time as a broadcast graphic designer, I decided to embark on a journey into music as a solo independent Artist. I thought a lot about “Where do I start, what themes to share, what genres to target, what people would want to listen to my lyrics.” My ultimate goal became to focus on sharing and inspiring with 3 main ingredients - Love, Living and Laughter. With hopes that my music will shine rays of sunshine to all listeners. 

And so here I am today, with two albums, multiple singles, music videos, awards, nominations, national recognition and international performance experience all of which have been funded independently. It will be a great honor and joy to have you join me in creating my first fan-funded music album!

 

Making Good quality music costs money. The budget I am seeking to raise for my campaign reflects my high aspirations. I strive to achieve the highest possible professional standards that will deliver good quality results, both within the industry and audiences worldwide. Your contribution will be used for the production cost of studio sessions, producer and musician fees, mixing, and mastering the music, album CD manufacturing and promotions to include, web, print and video. I have some funds saved from working as a full-time Broadcast Graphic Designer, but could use some more to truly create a project worthy of holding a “Masterpiece” title you will truly enjoy. The EP album will be released in December 2017 and the Full Album "Suya Soul" should be complete by  2018.

Also, in memory of my mother and celebration all mothers who radiate with super sunshine "Mama Sunshine", I have chosen to support IamWANDA - a non-profit organization established by Tambra Raye Stevenson which stands for women and girls advancing in nutrition dietetics and agriculture. I’m inspired by Tambra’s passion for education and advocacy for healthy living with good nutrition. I believe health is wealth and if we get back to the basis of feeding ourselves with good natural nutrients we surely can reduce and eliminate several diseases and illnesses plaguing our community. Her project is especially dear to my heart because my mother studied dietetics and agriculture and I’m certain that she would equally have as much passion to support this wonderful cause. Visit IamWANDA.org for more info.

 

 

The Perks! 

For many of us, music is a part of our lifestyle. We listen to it in the car, gym, at work, at parties, at weddings, on radio, online --list is endless! I believe in the power of music to entertain, enlighten, encourage, and engage, and I would love your support towards creating good quality music that I’m hoping will become part of your music playlists.

With your contribution to funding for this project, you get good music and get to select one of the many perks I’m offering ranging digital music downloads, digital lyric booklet, signed physical album CD with your name in the Thank-you credits, personalized cover or original song and even a live performance option for your special event! I also have a special perk that offers 50% to support the IamWANDA non-profit campaign for women and girls. Please be sure to look at the entire list!

 I  promise to show my love and provide you with some laughter by singing thank you’s and sharing behind the scenes videos of the music making and my general living lifestyle which includes cooking some of my favourite African dishes, who knows, I may also test my luck on “Top Chef”. (JOKING!).  Each week I will do something new to help you get to know me better and know more about my passion for this campaign. I may also run a few contests, just for fun. We’ll see. :-)

 

Last Call to Action

If you’re still sitting on the fence wondering if you really want to support this project, I encourage to listen and take a look at what I’ve been able to do independently. Below are links to music from my first album “My Love” and a few music videos. Be sure to visit my website for more – www.TolumiDEMusic.com

 

Sharing is Caring! - You Are a Powerful Entity

Also, if you currently unable to donate or can only donate a small amount, you can still have big impact. Word of mouth is your greatest gift. YOU are tastemakers to your network and social media outlets.  Share the campaign with your Family and Friend is if you part of the social media world certainly share on Facebook, Instagram, Twitter, Pinterest, Tumblr and any other i left out. You are welcome to give me a shout out @TolumiDE or simply Tag me #TolumiDE in a selfie of you rocking out to one of my songs. My fan base is growing daily, and it is because of amazing people, generous with their time, like you!  PLEASE ALSO USE THE INDIGOGO SHARE TOOLS!

I truly THANK YOU for taking the time to check out my Indiegogo. I truly appreciate your time and all support I receive!

Follow TolumiDE:

Facebook.com/TolumiDEonline

Youtube.com/TolumiDE

Instagram: @TolumiDE

Twitter: @TolumiDE

www.tolumidemusic.com

 

Best Wishes

TolumiDE

 

TolumiDE

TolumiDE (pronounced toe-lu  me-day) is an award-winning Nigerian R&B Afro-Pop World Inspiration and Soul Singer-Songwriter. Currently a Washington- DC resident, the Toronto born York University graduate and alum singer for four-time Canadian Reggae Music Award nominated group ‘Women Ah Run Tings' shares her “LiveLoveLaugh” life as a blogger at tolumide.com and servers her community as a member of the non-profit AfropolitanYouth.org and an Entertainment Director for FestAfrica, the largest African Festival in Maryland.  Read FULL bio at www.tolumidemusic.com

story:
"Don't leave the women behind!"

The festival was founded by Kelle Jolly, a jazz singer and media personality from Knoxville, TN. But the work is done and supported by many. We are preparing for our third year of the festival. It started as a way to bring women musicians in Knoxville together and to introduce Knoxville audiences to rising jazz artists from around the region. The 3-day festival includes an opening concert at the Knoxville Museum of Art, an evening concert that includes local to national women performers and a concert venue and a closing concert on Sunday. 

Donations help pay for expenses that include, but are not limited to, artist fees, venue rental fees, insurance, publicity, and administrative fees.

Some of the perks include t-shirts that show everyone that you care, passes to Saturday and Sunday shows, shout-outs on social media and you may get an original song!

Even if we don't meet our goal, our festival must go on. Join us in Knoxville  March 16-18, 2018 to support women in jazz. Even if you are not able to share at this time, we appreciate you sharing our campaign with family and friends. Stay in touch with us to share stories of women in jazz from your community.

story:
Nerede kalmıştık?

Bu satırları okuyanlar arasında Tantana Records'ın önceki yayınlarını ve #Feedback serisini takip edenler olsa gerek. The Ringo Jets, Eskiz, Cosmic Wings, Help! The Captain Threw Up ve Palmiyeler'in LP'leri yayınlarken bir nevi abonelik sistemi kurmuş, plak severleri bu genç projeler ile bir araya getirmeyi, "yeni sesler" için "sürdürülebilir" bir yayın serisi yaratmayı hedeflemiştik.  Fena da yol almadık hani.

Peşinden Taner Öngür ustadan "o telefon" geldi. Bize yeni projesinden, albümünden bahsetti, aramıza katılabileceğini söyledi. Dünyalar bizim oldu. Projeye hız verince koca yaz nasıl geçti biz de anlamadık.

İlk kez duyanlar için hızlı özet: Anadolu Pop’un anıt grubu Moğollar’ın kurucu efsanelerinden Taner Öngür’ün, 1920’ler ile 1970’ler arası taş plaklarda, kıyıda köşede kalmış İstanbul şarkılarını surf rock esintileriyle yeniden yorumladığı albümü “Elektrik Gramofon”u duyduk, bayıldık.

Siz de duyun, siz de bayılın diye Eylül ayı başında yayınladık.

 

İlk baskı 250 kopya LP 48 saat içinde tükendi.

İlgi bekliyorduk elbet ancak bu kadarını tahmin etmemiştik.

Gelen onlarca "nasıl biter?", "neden 250 kopya bastınız", "bize de mi yok", "hiç mi yok" sorularına  kayıtsız kalamadık. Merak ettik hızlıca bir anket yaptık: tekrar baskı LP mi yapalım, yoksa özel bir 45'lik mi, diye sorduk. LP isteyenler çoğunlukta çıktı, ama 45'lik soranlar da az değildi. 

Hal böyle olunca bir 250 LP daha basmak üzere kolları sıvadık bile. Aklımızda 45'likler de var... E nasıl yapalım edelim derken, ilk baskıya olan ilgi ve özellikle Istanbul dışından gelen mesajları da göz önüne alarak "bu kez bir ön sipariş yöntemi izleyelim" dedik. Hak geçmesin.

Maksat #Feedback serisi ile başladığımız yola, Taner ustanın teşviki ile devam etmek.

Ki ufukta onlarca proje var.

Buradan ön sipariş verecek olanlara türlü sürprizlerimiz de olacak elbet. Ama nihai amaç bundan sonraki projeler için de bir ağ oluşturmak.
 

Desteğiniz ve "Abonelik" fikri niçin önemli?

Keyifi değeri bir yana malum plak Türkiye şartları için maliyetli bir format. Oysa ki her gün onlarca  enfes grup kuruluyor, yeni isimler çıkıyor, yeni projeler kaydediliyor. Bütün bunların "internet" kanalıyla keşfetmek mümkün; ancak aynı internetin uçsuz bucaksız evreninde maceraya terk edilmeleri ise haksızlık. Plak bu manada ayrıca anlamlı ve değerli.  

#Feedback'in önceki paketlerinde "sıradaki" LP yayınının sınırlı sayıdaki renkli baskısını, yanında küçük hediyeler içeren bir paket halinde "abonelere" gönderiyorduk. Aynı yöntemi devam ettirmek mümkün; "sıradaki albüm"ün ileride koleksiyon değeri olacak sınırlı sayıdaki kopyalarını buradan ön siparişe sunacağız. 

 

Feedback #6: TANER ÖNGÜR "Elektrik Gramofon"

Bu kampanya ile plakları büyük ilgi gören "Elektrik Gramofon"un ikinci baskısını ve/veya 45'lik sevenler için özel üretilecek bir box-set ön siparişini başlatıyoruz. 

İkinci baskı LP için talep bariz olduğu için öncelik orada... yine 250 adet, (ilk baskıdan ayırt edilebilmesi için) buradaki örnekte gördüğünüz şekilde, gri plak, siyah göbek şeklinde; 251'den 500'e kadar numaralandırılmış olacaklar. LP üretimi başladı bile!

45'lik box-set için ise karar sizin! 10 parçadan oluşan albümü 5 ayrı 45'lik şeklinde bir araya getirmek hoş olmaz mı? Buna kampanyada oluşacak ön siparişe göre karar vereceğiz ancak burada da niyet 250'şer kopya üretmek ve bu beş 45'likten derlenecek 150 özel numaralandırılmış kutu hazırlamak. Kampanyadaki hedefi yakalayabilirsek, siparişleri hemen vereceğiz. Hedef yakalanamaz ise 45'lik siparişi verenlere ödemelerini iade edeceğiz.

Ya sonra ?

Şimdiden haberdar etmiş olalım; Tantana Records kataloğunda 2017/18 sezonu içinde Gözyaşı Çetesi, Destroy Earth, The Ringo Jets, Palmiyeler, Help! The Captain Threw Up ve Taner Öngür'den (daha da sürprizli) yeni albümler bekleyiniz. Hatta bir kaç isim daha eklenmesi de mümkün; çünkü hayat güzel sürprizlerle ayrı bir güzel.

İşbu kampanya başarı işe sonuçlanırsa, Ingiegogo'nun "in demand" özelliğini de devreye sokarak size buradan yine farklı ve özel paketler teklif edebileceğiz.

Ne diyordu meşhur şarkı: "it's a long way to the top (if you want to rock'n roll)"

Bize bu yolda desteğini esirgemeyen herkese peşinen teşekkürler.
story_txt:

Desteğiniz ve "Abonelik" fikri niçin önemli?
Keyifi değeri bir yana malum plak Türkiye şartları için maliyetli bir format. Oysa ki her gün onlarca  enfes grup kuruluyor, yeni isimler çıkıyor, yeni projeler kaydediliyor. Bütün bunların "internet" kanalıyla keşfetmek mümkün; ancak aynı internetin uçsuz bucaksız evreninde maceraya terk edilmeleri ise haksızlık. Plak bu manada ayrıca anlamlı ve değerli.  

#Feedback'in önceki paketlerinde "sıradaki" LP yayınının sınırlı sayıdaki renkli baskısını, yanında küçük hediyeler içeren bir paket halinde "abonelere" gönderiyorduk. Aynı yöntemi devam ettirmek mümkün; "sıradaki albüm"ün ileride koleksiyon değeri olacak sınırlı sayıdaki kopyalarını buradan ön siparişe sunacağız. 
 

Feedback #6: TANER ÖNGÜR "Elektrik Gramofon"
Bu kampanya ile plakları büyük ilgi gören "Elektrik Gramofon"un ikinci baskısını ve/veya 45'lik sevenler için özel üretilecek bir box-set ön siparişini başlatıyoruz. 
İkinci baskı LP için talep bariz olduğu için öncelik orada... yine 250 adet, (ilk baskıdan ayırt edilebilmesi için) buradaki örnekte gördüğünüz şekilde, gri plak, siyah göbek şeklinde; 251'den 500'e kadar numaralandırılmış olacaklar. LP üretimi başladı bile!
45'lik box-set için ise karar sizin! 10 parçadan oluşan albümü 5 ayrı 45'lik şeklinde bir araya getirmek hoş olmaz mı? Buna kampanyada oluşacak ön siparişe göre karar vereceğiz ancak burada da niyet 250'şer kopya üretmek ve bu beş 45'likten derlenecek 150 özel numaralandırılmış kutu hazırlamak. Kampanyadaki hedefi yakalayabilirsek, siparişleri hemen vereceğiz. Hedef yakalanamaz ise 45'lik siparişi verenlere ödemelerini iade edeceğiz.
Ya sonra ?
Şimdiden haberdar etmiş olalım; Tantana Records kataloğunda 2017/18 sezonu içinde Gözyaşı Çetesi, Destroy Earth, The Ringo Jets, Palmiyeler, Help! The Captain Threw Up ve Taner Öngür'den (daha da sürprizli) yeni albümler bekleyiniz. Hatta bir kaç isim daha eklenmesi de mümkün; çünkü hayat güzel sürprizlerle ayrı bir güzel.
İşbu kampanya başarı işe sonuçlanırsa, Ingiegogo'nun "in demand" özelliğini de devreye sokarak size buradan yine farklı ve özel paketler teklif edebileceğiz.
Ne diyordu meşhur şarkı: "it's a long way to the top (if you want to rock'n roll)"
Bize bu yolda desteğini esirgemeyen herkese peşinen teşekkürler.

story:
"Everything's Fine!"

The Vocaholics have undergone a lot of changes since we recorded our last album, VocaholX, in 2015. We want to celebrate those changes by recording our fourth album, Everything’s Fine! This album will represent where the Vocs are today and where we see ourselves going in the future. We couldn’t be more thrilled to be embarking on the journey of making an album again, and we’re so excited to share this labor of love with our family, friends and fans.

We are dependent on your donations to make this album a reality! Any and all donations push us closer to achieving our goal!

Everything’s Fine! Fundraiser Details:

We need $5,000 to cover the recording, mixing, mastering, licensing, and production of our fourth album, Everything’s Fine. Here's more information on the fundraising process:

  • You have until late November of 2017 to donate to our fundraiser!
  • We're recording Everything’s Fine! with Voices Only Productions, a Los Angeles based a cappella recording company with a strong history of producing some of the best a cappella albums in the US (including VocaholX!). We're committed to putting out the highest quality product possible, and your donations will help us do just that.
  • We've set certain donation levels to receive Vocaholics perks, so check those out and see what you can get with your donation to Everything’s Fine!

Your Donation's Impact:

Your donations are the only thing that can help us to make this album a reality! We want to release a product that we are proud of that will inspire joy to its listeners, and we take that very seriously. Here's more information on how your funds will be utilized:

  • We successfully used IndieGogo to fund our 2013 and 2015 albums Vocaholics Anonymous and VocaholX, which you can still listen to on iTunes, Spotify, and Tidal!
  • 100% of your donation will go towards Everything’s Fine!
  • The funds from this IndieGogo campaign will be used to cover the recording/mastering fees of Voices Only Productions, license the songs on Everything’s Fine! through A Cappella Records, and have the physical CDs created for April of 2018.
  • We 100% guarantee that all donors will receive the correct perk that accompanies their donation.

Other Ways You Can Help:

We totally understand that you might not be able to contribute, but you can still help us spread the word! We appreciate any and all support.

Please consider posting our IndieGogo link to your social media profiles! From Facebook to Twitter to your family Email chain, we would love if you could help make some noise about our campaign. Any form of assistance is highly appreciated, and every contribution will truly help us create the next entry in our musical catalogue.

The Vocaholics thank you for your support, and we look forward to sharing the final product with you!

story:
Short Summary of Us

We are Mordy and Yosef - with the Rogers Park Band. We've been around a few years now and have played over 100 concerts together since we started. Some of the concerts had 500-1000 people and fancy lights, while some concerts were for an old Jewish-Russian immigrant couple that we sang "Tumbalalaika" for and cried together with. No matter how large or small, every single concert we play has our whole heart.

Chassidic niggunim are the deepest that music can take us. Our masters teach that when we sing a song, the Rebbe which authored the song is actually standing with us while we sing it.

When we release this album, it will be in a style that is easy to love and listen to, and will make these Yiddish songs and niggunim accessible to all people - young and old. Your contribution will make it happen.

What We Need & What You Get

This album recording will cost a  total of $14,000. Recording the songs and paying the musicians involved costs $10,000. Designing a beautiful album, printing physical copies to distribute, and marketing it so more people will hear the music will cost us approximately $4,000

Tell people about your unique perks. Get them excited!

Every dollar raised goes directly to bringing this music to the world.

-----

Authentic Yiddish and Chassidic music that has an appeal to a modern audience has been hard to come by. We are filling this void. Making your music lovable for you.

We have already put out a debut album which was a  tremendous success. Together, we can continue to make this real.

We have already released 2 songs off of the upcoming album along with music videos. As we move along, we will be releasing more music and even greater content.

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you only give a little, SHARE this page with your friends. If you can't give right now, it is very likely that one of friends on Facebook, Instagram etc.. can and wants to. Let them know this is going on!

Stay in touch.

www.rogersparkband.com

or

www.fb.com/rogersparkband

story:
Short Summary

Lester is nothing short of a legend.

After performing with the Jamaican Military Band and Val Bennett, Lester began his career as a studio musician in the Jamaican music scene. It was in this venue that he met the other founding members of The Skatalites, his longest running project.

The Skatalites are now a household name in Jamaican music, after putting out 16 studio albums of their own, and accompanying many other famous artists.

Unfortunately, Lester does not receive any royalties for his work with the Skatalites. Without any funding from his previous work, he is calling on his fans to help him bring his new record to life.

Lester has received the honor of an Order of Distinction in 1998 for his contribution to Jamaican music. He would love for his next honor to be your donation to the future of his music.

Help Lester and the production team create a new, amazing record that you'll listen to over and over again.

What We Need & What You Get

For this production we'll need over $20,000.

We need to:

  • Pay the session musicians who will breathe life into Lester's music.
  • Pay the production team that will ensure the album reaches its maximum potential.
  • Press the album!
  • Promote the album!
  • Pay for travel expenses for Lester and the rest of the team to make this record a reality.
We have some amazing personnel helping Lester make his album a reality, including:
  • Joe Ferry, a longtime producer and collaborator with Lester and The Skatalites. He will be both playing on and producing the record. Joe's mulitiple Grammy award winning production style will give the music the production value it deserves.
  • Nathan Breedlove, formerly of the Skatalites and renowned jazz trumpeter, bringing his unique musical style to the album. Nathan is a Grammy nominated musician.
  • Rich Carlstedt, a member of the Israelites for 25 years, will be playing guitar on this record. After playing with Derrick Morgan, the Skatalites, Justin Hines, and Lord Tanamo, he's signed on to bring his rhythmic pulse and smooth licks to Lester's new sound.
  • Buddy Jay Kieffer, John England Fisher, Terence Paschal, Curtis Irie, and Joe Mineo will help complete the musical and production team, and help make this a record to remember.

The Impact

It's not hard to see how much of an impact Lester has had on the Jamaican music scene. Besides his Order of Distinction for his contribution to Jamaican music, Lester has played with artists such as Bob Marley and Johnny Dizzy Moore.

Lester was also a part of the New York City Jazz scene in the 1970s, and left a lasting impression on America early on in his career.

Lester has so much more beautiful music to give the world, and he can't do it without your help. Please consider donating, and bringing an amazing record to life.

Risks & Challenges

If we don't raise the full amount in this campaign, we won't be able to turn this album into the masterpiece it should be. We won't be able to fund the many parts of the operation, nor the personnel involved with making a successful record.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you don't have the means to contribute, there's still so much you can do to help.

  • Help us get the word out! Share on Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, and anything else you can possibly think of! Share often, and share everywhere.
  • Remind your reggae loving friends that they can help bring a brand new album from a reggae legend to life by donating to our campaign.
  • Enjoy the album when it's finally here!

Thank you so much for considering donating. You are helping to realize a dream.

story:
The American Folk Song Sing-along

Since we started this concert series, we have had requests for CDs so people can take the experience home and sing-along with others.  Everywhere we have taken this show the house has been full and people have had a great time. Featuring some of the great folk music of Leadbelly, Pete Seeger, Odetta, Woody Guthrie and traditional songs from throughout  history, Fr. Ron & Friends are working to bring back a great American tradition.  We are recording two live performances to bring the energy of the concerts to a CD.  The first performance will be recorded at 612 Kitchen & Cocktails in Kirkwood, Mo. Feb. 26.  This will feature the St. Louis Friends.  The New Orleans Friends will be recorded at Buffa's in New Orleans, March 5.

What We Need & What You Get

Your support will help cover our costs of recording, mastering, editing and the initial pressing.  We need $4200 to go along with our current bank to see this project through.

  • Your contribution will be paired with our personal investments to produce 1000 copies of this CD
  • If you can help us, we are glad to provide a few special perks!
  • A contribution of $10 will get you a signed poster
  • A contribution of $20 will get you a signed CD
  • A contribution of $35 will get you two signed CDs, and a discount on future copies of the CD.
  • A contribution of $75 will get you the two sign CDs and a small book of Fr. Ron recipes. 
  • A contribution of $150 or more from the New Orleans or St. Louis area will give you 2 CDs, and the opportunity to host a private concert in your home (1-hour)by at least 2 members of the band.
  • A contribution of more than $200 will give you the opprotunity to have a 90 minute concert in your home or at your special event.
  • Check out all the perks we have to offer!
  • Of course, anything you can give will be greatly appreciated!

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about this campaign.
  • Please use the use the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
About Hamish

I am singer/songwriter, 17 years of age from the city of Newcastle, NSW. 

I began playing guitar in 2012. After practicing my instrument for 2 years I grew a passion for songwriting. I started to write my own material in March of 2014. I soon found that writing music became a part of my day to day activities, the more I wrote, the more I loved it. 

In July of 2015 I took up vocal lessons at the National Music Academy. Quickly I began to improve my singing whilst writing more material. In August I decided it was time to step out onto the public scene and start performing. My first ever solo performance was held at the Deco Cafe in Newcastle (previously known as Agosti Cafe). 

Since August, my passion for performing and confidence has grown immensely. I have played at various venues and occasions across Newcastle such as the Hunt & Gather Markets, Hamilton Clock-Tower Markets, Mattara Festival, Lake Macquarie Carols by Candlelight, King Bill Restaurant and many more. I look forward to travelling to more distant locations in the coming year

I wish to continue performing, singing and writing into the foreseeable future. What I have personally achieved is just the beginning. 

I thank everyone for the support, and will continue to write music I love and to make the most out of every performance and opportunity. 

Hamish

The Goal

Hey there! 

This kickstarter project in which I am starting is to help raise funds to record, mix and master my debut EP. I have been writing quite a lot over the last couple of years. I'm now at a point where I feel confident in the music I make, and enjoy playing it for everyone to hear. 

The EP will feature 4 original tracks. All the songs have been written over a 2 year period. I value each track, and they all have been significant in my writing development and my personal growth. If you intend to purchase the CD, I hope you thoroughly enjoy it, and can connect with it in your own special way

I've had so much support since I stepped onto the public domain. From friends and family, to strangers who have shown an interest whilst I've been busking or playing a show. I am so grateful to everyone, for all the love shown towards me. It is just amazing. 

In starting up this kickstarter project, I wish that you share my enthusiasm and excitement for the record I want to create. Every little bit counts. I truly appreciate every donation. Feel free to give what you can. Remember to check out what rewards you can receive through donating

Once again, thank you all for your support, I will never forget it. 

Best wishes, 

Hamish x

story:
Short Summary

I'm a musician from Montreal and I've been playing music in various bands (most notably Honheehonhee and Lakes of Canada) since I was 10 and my neighbour and I wrote our first masterpieces in my parent's unfinished basement.  After years of writing songs, singing in choirs and playing any instrument I could get my hands on,  I eventually continued my musical education at Concordia University where I graduated with a major in liberal arts and a minor in music.

This is my first attempt at a solo album.  It's called Notes From a Bedroom.  I recorded it in my bedroom on cassette tapes.  It's just me singing with an acoustic guitar and a bit of harmonica.  It's raw and honest.  I've been dreaming about it and working on it for years, busking in the Montreal metro to pay for it and now I want to share it with the world.  

I have lots of exciting ideas about how to do this, like a launch at the Queen Elizabeth Hotel in the same room John Lennon and Yoko Ono did their Bed-In for peace.  This is the site of the most famous bedroom recording ever made.  It just happens to be in Montreal and I'm going to rent the room and invite Yoko Ono and anyone else who happened to be in the room for the recording of "Give Peace a Chance".

Your contributions will help me with every aspect of getting this album out. Everything from, mixing and mastering in a proper studio to pressing cds to making music videos to touring in people's bedrooms (something I don't think has ever been done before) and documenting it (including the launch at the Queen Elizabeth Hotel), to straight up publicity costs. 

What We Need & What You Get

I'm looking for $15,000.  Here's why:
Mixing 2 days: $1,600
Mastering 1 day: $1,000
Music video: $1,000 or more
Renting a room at the Queen Elizabeth Hotel for launch with Yoko Ono: $800
CD Pressing with upc code and digital distribution: $1,248 
P2 visa and musician guild fees (to tour in the US): $825
Visas for film crew: $445
Bedroom Tour expenses (gas and room and board): $1,500-$2,000
Bedroom tour documentary (camera equipment and post-production costs): $2,500-$20,000 or more
Publicist: $1000-$5000 or more
Total: $11,918-$33,918 
Both totals are not including tax.  Basically, $15,000 is an estimate on the low side of how much it will cost to do all the things I'd like, if my talented film-making friends do a whole lot of work for free with the bare minimum of equipment and I eat nothing but peanut butter and pasta on tour.  If I raise less than that I just won't do some of these things (or I'll eat less on tour).  If I raise more, I'll put it towards paying my friends and more publicity and making the tour documentary and everything else even better.  If all my dreams come true I'll even be able to make vinyl!
But I'm not asking you to just give me money.  I have lots of perks to offer you. Depending on how much you donate you can get:
a copy of Notes From a Bedroom--the album you're helping me make and share.
a copy of the Bedroom tour documentary--this is one of the things I'm most excited about.  To keep in the style of the recordings and songs I'm going to be touring in people's bedrooms.  I don't think this has ever been done before (at least I've never heard of it) and my talented film making friends are going to come along and catch it all on camera!  You'll get a sneak peak of so many shows pushing the boundaries of intimacy with small audiences in people's bedrooms!
a copy of a page straight from one of my notebooks--this is where it all started. In trying to write the songs for this album I filled a whole bunch of notebooks with all kinds of things.  Sometimes they were lyric ideas, sometimes they were just interesting or ridiculous or dark or intense thoughts I wanted to remember so I scribbled them down.   Sometimes they were private thoughts I never thought I'd share...
or even a private show in your bedroom for you and anyone you'd like to invite!--this is what it's all about.  The reason I recorded these songs was to share them with people, to connect, and there's no better way to connect through music than in person through live performance.

The Impact

Notes From a Bedroom is an album about connection.  I'm a firm believer that the only way people can truly connect is if they're honest with each other.  I tried to delve into the depths of my mind, the private places I almost never share with people.  Sometimes the thoughts are dark; sometimes they're bursting with the joy and beauty of being alive.  I tried to be as honest as I could about my experiences and the thoughts that go with them in the hopes that a listener will be able to say, "Yeah, I know that feeling!" or "What the F@&# is he talking about?!" Whatever your reaction is, I want to know.  

Beyond the writing I tried to keep the recordings honest too.  Everything was recorded at once.  All the tracks are me with an acoustic guitar (and some harmonica) singing and playing at the same time.  I did my best to play the songs well.  There are some mistakes; I wanted there to be.  In a world of perfectly polished digital music, Notes From a Bedroom is something real.  And the mood and feelings and sounds are all as close as I could come to what's in my head. 

And now that the songs and recordings are done, I want to share them with the world.  I'm going to tour in people's bedrooms.  I've toured across the country many times before but I've never been as excited as I am about this! The shows will go from intimate and intense to laid back and fun.  I think they'll bring about memorable moments for both me and the audiences (as small as they may be). Your contributions will help me share this music with the world and see if there's anyone out there that has the same thoughts and feelings as I do, to know whether or not I'm alone.

Risks & Challenges

There are many challenges I'll be facing as this project moves forward.  Recording an album is sort of funny.  You work for years and years practicing your instrument and writing songs and playing shows until you have something you think is really great and you record it.  Then you have to do a whole bunch of things that are related to music but they're not music.

I'm trying to organize a Montreal launch show at the Queen Elizabeth hotel in the same room John Lennon and Yoko Ono did their Bed-In for peace and I'm trying to invite Yoko Ono (if anyone out there knows Yoko, please let me know).  This was the site of the most famous bedroom recording ever ("Give Peace a Chance") and it happens to be in my hometown! Obviously there are some variables that are out of my control in this plan but I'm giving it a shot and if it doesn't pan out I have some other ideas.  

I'm trying to book an entire tour in people's bedrooms.  Not only have I never done this, I don't think it's ever been done! But I'm doing it and so far people have been pretty open and interested and helpful and excited about the idea (Thank you all so much)! 

I'm trying to make a documentary of this bedroom tour.  This is something I have almost no experience in but my extremely talented friends Matthew Raudsepp and Alex McCooeye are helping me and I have the utmost confidence in them (check out their web series "The Plateaus").

Basically it comes down to determination.  I want to get this music out into the world and it's going to happen one way or another.  I've got a lot of back up plans and no matter what I'll find a way to put your contribution towards sharing this music.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you simply can't afford to contribute but you're interested in the project and you'd like to help, the best thing you can do is spread the word.  There's no counting  how helpful this could end up being.  Share this campaign on facebook and twitter and instagram and anywhere you can think of.  Go up to strangers on the street! Shout it from the rooftops! Sing it from your bedroom window!
story_txt:
Short Summary
I'm a musician from Montreal and I've been playing music in various bands (most notably Honheehonhee and Lakes of Canada) since I was 10 and my neighbour and I wrote our first masterpieces in my parent's unfinished basement.  After years of writing songs, singing in choirs and playing any instrument I could get my hands on,  I eventually continued my musical education at Concordia University where I graduated with a major in liberal arts and a minor in music.
This is my first attempt at a solo album.  It's called Notes From a Bedroom.  I recorded it in my bedroom on cassette tapes.  It's just me singing with an acoustic guitar and a bit of harmonica.  It's raw and honest.  I've been dreaming about it and working on it for years, busking in the Montreal metro to pay for it and now I want to share it with the world.  
I have lots of exciting ideas about how to do this, like a launch at the Queen Elizabeth Hotel in the same room John Lennon and Yoko Ono did their Bed-In for peace.  This is the site of the most famous bedroom recording ever made.  It just happens to be in Montreal and I'm going to rent the room and invite Yoko Ono and anyone else who happened to be in the room for the recording of "Give Peace a Chance".
Your contributions will help me with every aspect of getting this album out. Everything from, mixing and mastering in a proper studio to pressing cds to making music videos to touring in people's bedrooms (something I don't think has ever been done before) and documenting it (including the launch at the Queen Elizabeth Hotel), to straight up publicity costs.    What We Need & What You Get


I'm looking for $15,000.  Here's why:
Mixing 2 days: $1,600
Mastering 1 day: $1,000
Music video: $1,000 or more
Renting a room at the Queen Elizabeth Hotel for launch with Yoko Ono: $800
CD Pressing with upc code and digital distribution: $1,248 
P2 visa and musician guild fees (to tour in the US): $825
Visas for film crew: $445
Bedroom Tour expenses (gas and room and board): $1,500-$2,000
Bedroom tour documentary (camera equipment and post-production costs): $2,500-$20,000 or more
Publicist: $1000-$5000 or more

Total: $11,918-$33,918 
Both totals are not including tax.  Basically, $15,000 is an estimate on the low side of how much it will cost to do all the things I'd like, if my talented film-making friends do a whole lot of work for free with the bare minimum of equipment and I eat nothing but peanut butter and pasta on tour.  If I raise less than that I just won't do some of these things (or I'll eat less on tour).  If I raise more, I'll put it towards paying my friends and more publicity and making the tour documentary and everything else even better.  If all my dreams come true I'll even be able to make vinyl!
But I'm not asking you to just give me money.  I have lots of perks to offer you. Depending on how much you donate you can get:

a copy of Notes From a Bedroom--the album you're helping me make and share.

a copy of the Bedroom tour documentary--this is one of the things I'm most excited about.  To keep in the style of the recordings and songs I'm going to be touring in people's bedrooms.  I don't think this has ever been done before (at least I've never heard of it) and my talented film making friends are going to come along and catch it all on camera!  You'll get a sneak peak of so many shows pushing the boundaries of intimacy with small audiences in people's bedrooms!

story:
The Journey

One of my greatest passions in life is to know the voice of God and respond to Him. Having served in many different roles in worship-driven settings, the question I've heard most often is, "How do I connect with God on a deeper level?" My goal in this recording project is to respond to that question, and my prayer is that you will go on this journey with me. These are songs that have come from times of testing and trusting in my life - songs that declare that He is ALWAYS faithful, regardless of what life may look like in the moments we face from day to day.  

Those who know me best will tell you that I typically dislike doing things alone, and this is definitely no different! So here's where you come in...

The Need (ONLY 60 DAYS TO RAISE FUNDS!)

Here are a few details to let you know where your money is going and what you can expect:

  • $6500 will cover studio costs, musicians, production, mixing and mastering, etc. (I have a whole crew ready to go, and we will get the ball rolling once funding is complete)
  • I want to make sure you receive something for contributing to this project, so I will be listing some fun perks and giveaways along the way! 
  • I will be posting updates on social media (including a few special live updates on periscope!), to keep you informed of our progress throughout the whole process.

The Bottom Line

Finally, after all is said and done, my ultimate prayer is for God to be revealed, and His presence released, and if even one of these songs is used to accomplish that I will count this a total success! Thank you for your support!

story:
The Album:

Folks, I have been sitting on these original song gems for too long. I've been doing other things, like recording albums with Graham Patzner (The Gospel Flats), making a baby, and writing more songs.  It's time that these songs be set free to do their work in the world, whatever that may be.  When I right a song, I am a channel that receives it and a mind that polishes it. I often don't know what the song is about or what it is "for" until much later. I do know that I don't continue to work on a song unless I sense that it is offering something new, and something helpful. The only way for these songs to do their job is to record them in a really beautiful way, so that nothing distracts from the message and the medicine in this music.   It would be selfish of me to hold onto these songs, or record them in a way that is less than optimal. You can help me get these songs to your own ears and to so many others' by contributing toward my Full Length album campaign.

The Songs:

These songs are their own entities, and my relationship with them is such that they are now shouting at me to get them released, so I'm not going to argue with them any more.  Many of you are already familiar with some of these songs, and there are plenty of unheard compositions as well.  These are country and folk songs about family, apple trees, home, lovers, birth & death, co-dependence, ceremony, and the end of the world. You know, just the basics. Some that you might know already are:

The Songbird's Spell,

The Whole Buffalo,

An Experiment in Unconditional Love,

Johnny,

The Spider and the Sheriff,

Rachel,

Mother Sickness,

Gumption, 

Good Ol'Fashioned Cheatin' Song

and many more.

I have at least 34 songs that I'd like to record, and only about 10 of those will make it onto the official album. The rest will be elegantly and simply recorded live onto a lengthy B-sides collection that will also be available. 

What I am asking for:

I'm asking for $15,000, which is the minimum amount I need to do this album justice. I've seen enough musician friends ask for less than they need, and they end up going into debt later just to ship out their campaign perks. So although it is frightening as hell to ask for this much money, I must be honest about what this project will actually entail.  Your contributions will be utilized with utmost care, and I don't take your offerings lightly. I am not only an artist, but also an experienced bookkeeper and businesswoman, so you can rest assured that I'll using each penny in a good way.  Here are some of the ways your contributions will be spent:

1. Studio time + Engineering at Bird and Egg Studio in Richmond, CA

2. Hiring local musicians to accompany me, photographers to document it, filmmakers to make a video for a single, artists to do album art and layout.

3. Mixing and Mastering (I'll keep you in the loop about where!)

3. Beautifully crafted CDs, Vinyl, and download cards (and other merchandise yet to be decided)

4. A Publicity campaign to promote the album release, so that it can get all the mileage that is possible.


Risks

It is always a gamble when an artist ventures to offer something new.  Many of you will be selecting the Vinyl perk for your contribution. Since I'm using a flexible funding platform (I receive the money even if I don't make the entire goal), there is a chance that I won't have the funds to press the vinyl right away.  I will do my very best to make the entire goal so that this doesn't happen, but I'll take good care of you and your investment even if we don't make it all the way to $15,000 by offering you other perks along with your delayed vinyl pressing. 


Other Ways You Can Help

If you are unable to contribute now, but you want to help, please share this page with everyone you know on every platform you have access to! THANK YOU!!!

story:
The Story

For several years now I've been conceptualizing an EP that I hoped to be my first music project. Last October I was hanging out with some youth I was getting know from a local neighborhood in Charlottesville, VA. My roommate and I hold a bible study in my house with many of them, and they are very dear to our hearts. One of them was listening to some rap music and I asked him who it was by, and what it was about. He told me the artist's name and shared how the content was a story about a character living a life involving prison time, selling drugs, and other self-destructive practices. That’s when I came to the realization…”What am I doing?!” What am I doing with this God-given gift, when I have the opportunity to share gospel-centered, life-affirming, make you wanna two-step and bob your head HipHop?

Fast forward…It is a year later and I have been inspired to finish writing and recording Foreigners and not sit on this gift any longer. Since then I’ve gotten to share the songs with the kids, and many others, and I’ve already seen it be a blessing, challenge, and encouragement to those who have heard it. The kids love it! The gap between start and finish has been far too long. It's time that I got this thing done.

The more that I listen to this genre that I enjoy so much, the more I feel a longing for music that will point my face to Christ and the purpose that He has me here for. Foreigners is a seven song Hip-Hop project inspired by the walk of faith in Christ, in a land that is not your Home. It's formed from a faith and a sure hope in a kingdom that is yet to come. This is huge for me and I would love for you to join me in creating this hopeful HipHop experience.

My goal for this project is to raise $4000 in 30 days. And to release foreigners in early January. 

What I Need & What You Get

Here's what $4000 covers:

ONE: 
Studio time:
Finish recording the project (I've recorded 2 of 7 songs)
Mixing and Mastering

TWO: 
Travel Expenses:
Traveling from VA to NC to work with friends and creatives on the album.
Touring for the EP, and shows
Let's bring the music to your town!

THREE: 
Merch:
The production of CD's, CD cases
And all the Merch related to the music

FOUR:
Marketing:
Making a music video
Website and domain hosting
Advertising

Here's what you get:

$10—Personal thank you for you contribution to the project! + An early download of the free EP + Early access to listening session of 2 recorded songs

$25—All of the previous tier package + 2 Signed Physical copies of CD + Early access to listening session of 2 recorded songs

$50—All of the previous tier package + VIP ticket to show of your choice + Surprise Merch gift bag

$100—Sharing is Caring: All of the previous tier packages + 3 extra signed copies of the EP + Download of original rough recordings and lyrics

$250—All of the previous tier package + A character sketch portrait of you  digitally illustrated by Nate in his style

$500—All of the previous tier package + A family portrait of you and your loved ones digitally illustrated by Nate in his style

$750—All of the previous tier package + A free private show with Nate Emmanuel and other talented friends

$1000—All of the previous tier package + A voucher for 2 free shows featuring Nate Emmanuel as one of the artists

Ultimately...

The greatest part of your contribution is that it allows me to take a few weeks off from freelance so that I can focus on finishing the album, marketing it to listeners, and finding shows. And it helps me to afford an experience that I can’t support on my own right now. I plan to do music more full-time, and this is a leap of faith in that direction. If you’re down for the ride, and want to hear Hip-Hop crafted to help the foreigners journey toward their eternal destination, then support the project.

Risks & Challenges

This is going to be a new process for me. It’s going to have it’s ups, downs, and challenges. But I don’t think I have these gifts for no reason. It’s time to use them. And I appreciate that you all are willing to support me in this effort.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't support financially, you can support socially. Follow me in Facebook, Instagram, and Twitter. Share the campaign and my online posts to get the word out to others who may want to hear the music, or support the cause.

Thank you friends! God bless you.

Nate

All of the previous tier package + A voucher for 2 free shows featuring Nate Emmanuel

story:
'The Progress Into Simplicity'

Hello family and friends! I'm getting back into the studio (Fluke Studios) to create a new EP called "The Progress Into Simplicity." This EP (extended play) will be a little different. I have been exploring new sounds, instruments, and concepts, and I'm excited to hear them on their feet!

What We Need & What You Get

Every cent will be going towards the production, distribution, and promotion of this EP. It takes a small army to make music happen.  Be a part of that small army!

All funds will go toward:
-Studio Time (Fluke Studios)
-Editing (Fluke Studios)
-Mixing (Fluke Studios)
-Mastering
-Album Art by Justin Aaron (album artist for 'People Pumping Pedals' and 'Otter Hill')
-Physical Copies
-Merchandise (T-shirts, stickers, etc.)
-Shipping 
-Promotion 
All of this will be sent to you according to the perks listed! Its like you are placing a pre-order for the EP, merchandise, and tickets to shows.
If all funds are not met, I will do my very best to fulfill the rest of the production. The process may take a little longer, but no matter what, you will be receiving new Liz Chidester tunes!

Why give?

When I first thought about crowd funding for a personal project, I thought "there are so many other projects and causes worthy of donation. Why should people want to donate to mine?" I felt uncomfortable, and I put off the thought. But then I realized that creating music is something I'm passionate about, something that connects me to other human beings, something that makes a lot of peoples lives richer and more dynamic. I want for people to be a part of my creating in any way that they have means, whether that be helping me fund, or attending a concert, or being a co-writer, musician, artist. Money is a difficult subject because money is love. Everyone has some sort of emotional connection to it. If I have my family and friend's love behind my music, I think the music will sound like that love.

We have the internet now to help us create our own culture. If we rely solely on big companies to create our culture, we will lose who we are. Our culture doesn't have to be controlled by one or two record companies anymore. We don't get discovered. We discover ourselves.

Even if you don't give to my project, patron and fund the artists in your life. Follow them and support them the way you do an artist from a major label. I bet you they will recognize that support as more than just a number.

story:
GOOD PEOPLEZ strives to create a universal brand that ignites the capacity for change and positivity. It is this artistic process of self-exploration, healing, and acceptance that GOOD PEOPLEZ  roots itself in as we step onto the world stage.

We are inviting you to join our community and help us create our Untitled debut album! Help us facilitate equipment, advertising, and distribution costs, as well as mixing and music video funding.  Anything helps. We believe everyone is or has the capacity to be GOOD PEOPLEZ.

Where We've Been:
Our first music project was released in August 2015 titled GOOD INTENTIONZ pt. 1.

We went on to perform at venues such as The House Of Blues, The Viper Room, The Observatory Orange County, The Complex,  and many other venues in the Los Angels Area. We've traveled to Miami to participate in the international Art Basel festival. We've had the honor to network with artists like Pharrell, P Diddy, Asap Rocky, Mos Def, and more.

We are currently sponsored by a clothing company called The Squad; an international high fashion boutique clothing company all locally operated and produced in Los Angeles, who we are now working along side with to bring you our With Luv line of merchandise. We've produced and thrown our own events in the city giving performance opportunities to artists and cultivating positive social environments for people to connect and network. We've shot multiple music videos and to top it all off we just played our first music festival.

We have been blessed to have had support from our various communities, friends, families, and strangers alike. With only our first project we were able to establish relationships and open doors for ourselves in unbelievable ways.

We truly believe the sky is the limit with this album and can imagine what its completion will bring for all of us. You included.


Here's How YOU can become GOOD PEOPLEZ:

HELP US BUILD OUR IN HOME STUDIO:
We will be building an in home studio. In doing so we will create the space for not only ourselves, but other artists in the community to come record in a stress free and artistically liberating environment. Gifting us with self sufficiency will allow us to produce more content and truly explore and expand our sound.

U87 Neumann microphone $3,600
Avalon mic-preamp $2,500
Software 700$
Headphones $300
Cords $150
Mic stand $40
Pro tools $100-700

HELP US PRODUCE OUR ALBUM POST PRODUCTION:
Post production on an album can make or break the entire project. Mixing the vocals and adding various herbs and spices really brings a song together. We have access to industry professionals who will be helping us to make sure this project is top quality and ready for all of the various streaming platforms. Once the album is complete we need to make sure it gets as much exposure as possible. Blogs, Radio, Magazines; we will be pushing it on all mediums nationally and internationally.

Mixing/mastering $2,000
Marketing $3,000

HELP US CREATE OUR MUSIC VIDEOS:
Connecting visual to audio always allows the audience to experience the music in a new way. Weather it be a crazy party scene or a poetic narrative, music videos allow a deeper journey into the world of the artist while feeding the imagination of the viewer.  We have an extremely diverse artistic community and want to be able to provide opportunities for work and collaboration. This funding allows us to properly compensate all the wonderful artist that help make these videos a reality.

Music Video Funding $2,000



And of course, GOOD PEOPLEZ always say 'THANK YOU'!  

THA PERKZ!!!!!
$1 - Sending Good Vibez
$10 – A personal GOOD PEOPLEZ Thank You message.
$15 - A personal GOOD PEOPLEZ Thank You and Sticker
$25- Album Pre-Sale
$50- Album Pre-Sale & VIP ticket to Album Release
(Non-California Residents will receive a specialized gift)
$100 – Album Pre-Sale,  Sticker & 2 VIP Tickets to Album Release  
(Non-California Residents will receive a specialized gift)
$200- Album Pre-Sale, GOOD PEOPLEZ Ball-cap, Stickers & VIP Tickets to Album Release Party
$500- THE GOODIE BAG:  GOOD PEOPLEZ Long Sleeve, GPZ Ball-cap, Handwritten Letter, Stickers,  & VIP Tickets to Album Release.
$1000- THE GOODIE BAG and A Producer Credit on the Album


We thank you! By helping us reach this goal you are sharing with us- helping us build our community. We are all GOOD PEOPLEZ. Show Luv. Show Luv. Show Luv.

Connect. Affirm. Expand.
