story:
Short Summary


Innuendo  is a band composed by two young Italian street artists based in London. We play every day throughout the city to bring good vibes to the busy Londoners and.. they enjoy it!!! 

With harmonica, beatbox and cajon we compose original music that we happily share with our crowd everyday. We love authentic ideas and we would like to promote "on the road" all around Europe our new Album. We are ready to go!! 

For us the most important thing is to share the Street Art all over the world and to produce an authentic and an alternative style of music.

With your help we can see our dreams coming true and we can bring a bit of freshness in your speakers!! I hope you'll trust in us as much as we do! Enjoy the music!!!

What We Need & What You Get

We think we need at least £10.000 to realise our project.

     With these money we can cover part of the expenses for a big tour all over Europe and produce our first Album in a professional way and with all the structure needed. We have been auto producing our band for several months and we think that now we are ready for an upgrade in the quality of the recordings. We would like to offer you a real product and to experiment all the professional tools of a REAL recording studio! In exchange we will give you some treats such as:

Well, firstly our CD, of course! 

A DVD with our busking experiences in London, a pure fresh street Art documentary about living busking from our point of view!!

The possibility to arrange private home gigs at your place (London, Amsterdam and Paris residents only);

Our cool shirts and gadgets with logo, deigned by us with all our crazy ideas;

All the founds will be used EXCLUSIVELY on Artistic purposes;

We will invest:

         -      Hi quality Recording of the New Album                           £ 2500;

This cost include 150£ per day for the 

sound engineer for all the duration 

of the tracking plus the studio time

        -      Mixing and mastering                                                          £ 1000;

A professional rendering for each one

of the 12 tracks

        -      Manufacturing of CD&DVD and online shopping        £ 2500; 

Comprending to pay the copyright 

of our album and as well to built:

4000 CDs, 600 DVDs and digital

copy for Online Market such as 

Itunes and Spotify

       -       Merchandising (do you fancy some gadgets?)             £1000;

We need to print our special 100 

shirts with artworks made personally

by Innuendo

       -       European Tour 2016 (part of the expenses)                  £3000;

For the full tour travel we will need £10000, 

but in our campaign we ask £3000 

to be sure to cover at least a good

part of expenses as transports and 

accommodations.  

We strongly believe will be enough

as we are going to sell our Album

on the road during the tour and in the 

months before. 

We planned 60 dates for 3 months tour

starting by May 2016:

15 dates in London (1st May to 20th May);

15 dates in Amsterdam (22nd May to 10th June);         

15 dates in Paris ( 14th June to 2nd July);

15 dates in Berlin  (6th July to 28th July).

We hope we will reach our goal but if not, we will use the money firstly to record and second for manufacturing of Album. We will not run away in Thailand with your money! Trust us! We do this for the Art! 

As well we would love to invest some money to give to Edoardo a great present gift: An English course!!

The Impact

We think that our project is important because is independent, original and "underground". We describes our lifes through our music and we love sharing our vibes with you. Our goal is related in expanding the street art globally and be part of the most important street artistic movements existing nowadays. 

We have already a good amount of followers and we are able to stop The busy citizens of London while they rush to work! This is a kind of miracle for such a fast city! 

We love our crowd, we love to perform in the streets and we will never change our feelings because of the success!

We strongly believe that art is deep inside every individual and the real talent is the ability to keep going and be motivated everyday!

We just would like to express ourselves all over the world and...make all of you jump and dance!! Do you think you will not? Just listen our Promo:

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=XfzABdYHpRQ


So if you are interested to watch the entire video please check the video below:



Risks & Challenges

  As we are planning several street performances, one of our main risk could be the weather not matching with some dates. We are not expecting too many risks as we are feel very positive regarding the success of our First Big Project! 
We are not interested in earning money but experience. To earn this experience, with need money. We also would like to give you a different experience in a world in which the music seems limited in schemes.
 The reason why we think we will make it is because we do it with Love and Passion. As you do. But this is us, this is our project and we need your help to make it real. We already made London dance. Please let us shock the world!! 

Other Ways You Can Help

We do not ask you just to participate to our project with money! For us the most important things is to share our art to all the people close to You!! We would like you to be involved in our music with your soul! 
Please follow us in our Street Events and Gigs around Europe and share our videos online! We will keep you updated with our Facebook Page (please find it below) as we would love to have ANY KIND of support, even a simply opinion will be warmly welcome! PLEASE SHARE THE GOOD VIBES!!

https://www.facebook.com/INNUENDO-114458868912283/
_____________________________________________________________________________

story:
Do you like music? Do you like metal? If you have answered yes to any of these questions, then you should continue reading this!! And if you didnt, then read anyways!!

Why donate to us?

We have been here in Denver for two years now, and we still don't have a good recording of us!!! :'( We need your help in order to get only the highest of quality music to reach out to your ear holes. 

We have some amazing perks (as you can see off to your right) for all levels of donations. Even $1.00 gets some love from us to you. 

Who are we?

We are a very diverse group of musicians that just happened to run into one another one day and decided to start a band. If you would like more information on who we are, visit our Reverbnation page at http://www.reverbnation.com/talos4 

Summary

Everything is set, the producer is ready, strings and skins are freaky fresh, and the vocalist is warming up right now. All we need is a little help from you, the fans, to help launch this EP from a dream to a reality. You will be helping make dreams come true. That feels good now doesn't it?

story:
THIS CAMPAIGN ENDS 12/15/16 11:50PM PST.  IF WE MAKE OUR $5000 GOAL, WE MEET A CHALLENGE GRANT OF $1000 FROM KEN ROBY OF THE VILLAGE BLACKSMITH.
Like our Facebook Page:  https://www.facebook.com/LakeErieFolkFest

The Lake Erie Folk Fest

We're planning a folk festival to warm up the frigid month of February, but we need your help.

Let’s gather against the cold for the very first Lake Erie Folk Fest, an afternoon of engaging workshops plus an inspiring evening concert on Saturday, February 27, 2016, presenting artists and performers from Northeast Ohio and beyond. This is a collaborative project by two nonprofit organizations: the Northeast Ohio Musical Heritage Association (the people who bring you the Blue Sky Folk Festival in Kirtland) and the Shore Cultural Centre (a former high school turned innovative arts center in downtown Euclid).


We Need to Raise $5000

To make The Lake Erie Folk Fest happen, we need to raise $5000 through crowdsourcing. That's just 200 people donating $25; or 500 people donating just $10 each.  Or heck, even $5 from a whole buncha ya. Or you can be radically supportive and donate $100 or more!  We are also seeking corporate sponsors, so if you're interested in being a sponsor, or if you know of possible sponsors, please let us know.

JUST ADDED:  You can sport the first ever Lake Erie Folk Fest t-shirt for a donation of $50!  If you're already made a donation and wish to contribute again to make it $50, bring proof of your total donation to the festival to claim a t-shirt.




Why Have a Folk Festival in the WINTER?

A February folk festival will bring together new and old friends at a time when even bears are hibernating.  OK, bear are already hibernating, but that doesn't mean you should!  Break out your instruments, dance shoes, and vocal cords for a heart warming folk festival - music and dance by the people and for the people. In addition to workshops and performances, there will be lots of opportunity for jamming and visiting, plus an introduction to community visual artists.

The Shore Cultural Centre is an inviting place to gather in roomy, well-lit spaces with tall 1913 windows, creative hallway murals, and a large auditorium - marrying the comfort of the old with the energy of the new.


Other Things You Can Do to Help

  • Talk it up; the more folk who know about the festival, the better
  • Ask your friends and family to help out
  • Ask your employer to become a sponsor
    •

Contact Us

LakeErieFolkFest@gmail.com

  • Let us know who you'd like to see at the festival
  • Be a festival sponsor
  • Volunteer to help organize and run the festival

The Shore Cultural Centre is an inviting place to gather in roomy, well-lit spaces with tall 1913 windows, creative hallway murals, and a large auditorium - marrying the comfort of the old with the energy of the new.




     Other Things You Can Do to Help 

Talk it up; the more folk who know about the festival, the better
Ask your friends and family to help outAsk your employer to become a sponsor


Contact UsLakeErieFolkFest@gmail.com


Let us know who you'd like to see at the festival
Be a festival sponsor
Volunteer to help organize and run the festival

story:
Hey there, ladies and gents. Lilly speaking, and I'm here to tell you all about my first solo album that I just started working on. More importantly, I'm here to tell you all about the ways in which you can be a part of it.
I've been a lover of music for as long as I can remember. Piano lessons as a kid, taught myself to play guitar when I was 16, and I've been singing for as long as I can remember. Life has a tendency to happen, though, as you get older, and mine made me walk away from music for almost a decade. I picked it back up again last year, and looking back now, I don't know how I  ever lived without it. I started writing songs again, and before I knew it, I had more than enough material for a full CD.
So I hand-picked the best of them: my favorites, the most meaningful, the catchiest, the most intensely personal. These are what I'm taking with me into the studio. I've decided to call the album "This is Your Heart". It's a lyric from the chorus of one of those intensely personal songs, and I thought it was too perfect not to use.
I've been involved in music for a better part of my life. I've sung and recorded with several different bands over the years, but this is my first venture into something that's completely my own. I'd like nothing more than for you to join me in this new adventure.

Where the money goes...

Okay, so for those of you lovely folks who've never been in a recording studio before... That crap is expensive. I've broken it down kind of conservatively so you can have a rough idea of why I need so freaking much to get this project done:
Rehearsal room rental: 150
Actual recording studio time: 2100
Producer/Guest Musicians (they gotta eat, too): 2000
Mixing/Mastering: 1200
Art Design/Layout: 500
Production/Printing: 1600
Perks: 350
PayPal/Indiegogo Fees (10% of funds raised): 790
For a total of $8690
I've already started the process, so some of this money has come out of my own pocket. In the event that I don't reach my funding goal, the album is still going to be produced, and those of you that have donated will still get your perks. It's just going to take me longer to get it all done, as I'll have to find other ways to raise the remainder of the funds needed.
In the event that I SURPASS my funding goals, I will direct all money toward marketing, distributing, and music videos.

Why you should join me:

So many reasons.
If you connect to my songs or to my story at all...
If you want to be a part of a really awesome creative process...
If you think I have a pretty voice...
If you know me personally and want me to shut up about needing money for this...
No matter your reasons, thank you from the bottom of my heart. And if you can't donate, there's other ways you can help. Tell your friends about this campaign. Check out my various social media outlets down below. Like/share/repost ad nauseum.

https://www.youtube.com/channel/UC-oEjAaGSOMl-x-MZ5D2CEg
http://www.facebook.com/lillyodellemusic
http://www.instagram.com/lillyodelle 
http://www.soundcloud.com/lilly-odelle

story:
Independent Music for the Cause

We will locate and collaborate with charities & other organizations that are doing fantastic work to make the world a little better.  By facilitating & producing inspiring artistic campaigns, CG Music Project will help create awareness for great causes.


What we do

A.  Facilitate production of music and music multi-media presentations that will support and create awareness for social & environmental issues.

B.  Provide a platform where socially conscious artists can display original work.

C.  Build a community network of like-minded businesses, charities and non-profits who choose to actively collaborate w/ artists to share their message.


"I love music and I LOVE  to see people doing great things that make the world a better place.  Right now, we need your help to bring this non-profit organization to life so that CG Music Project is able begin producing new, purpose-driven music that will inspire a shift toward greatness and excellence in us all".

   -Peter Avelar, Executive Director @ CG Music Project.

               

 
Contributing to the fight against apathy, encouraging social awareness and supporting responsible co-existence with nature is the priority.  Likewise, the music we aim to bring you will feature the artist's perspective on these subjects.  CGMP's platform will accommodate free-thinking, creative self-expression without the constraints currently present in the mainstream media & music-industry.  


A Grassroots Effort

The Common Ground Music Project was founded with the intention of operating as a grassroots organization.  YOU steer the ship!  This initial fundraiser will demonstrate how much interest and support there is in this cause so please give whatever you can.  Also, please check out our exclusive perks!

Your contributions will help to fully launch CG Project in 2016 and it will enable the team to hit the ground running on the production of the 1st campaign (see below).  Raised funds will be distributed as follows:

  • Complete development of Impresario: CG Music Project's custom crowdfunding platform + artist database/network which caters to purpose-driven creatives and projects (20%)
  • Obtain 501(c)(3) federal nonprofit status w/ IRS (9%)
  • Legal Fees (10%)
  • Enhance marketing/promotional campaign for launch (26%)
  • Recording Costs for 1st Campaign (10%)
  • Compensation for Musicians..i.e. performers & composers (25%)



                                                   

                                                   PLANNED 2016 CAMPAIGNS


1. New Music Album dedicated to the theme of healing.  Contemporary classical music works inspired by this theme will be featured along w/compositions utilizing traditional Eastern overtone-emitting instruments. (Spring 2016)

2. Live Concert premiere of new music which reflects upon the relationship between man and nature. An evening of premieres by emerging composers in a natural space will demonstrate the artist's experience of co-existence and co-creation with Mother Nature.  (Summer 2016)

3. Music Video which explores the implications of the development and widespread use of GMO's (Genetically-modified Organisms). Utilizing original music, video and animation, this collaborative piece will offer a fresh, new perspective on this controversial subject.  (Fall-Winter 2016)

                               

We're so close!

From CGMP's inception nearly one year ago, we have been busy carefully building the foundation of this project, developing content and cultivating relationships with partners and other collaborators.  One more push from you and we'll make it!




Risks & Challenges

Obtaining adequate funding for the arts is challenging.  Likewise, securing proper funding for great causes can be very difficult due to the practical difficulties involved with marketing for non-profits.  These are all obstacles that the CG Music Project will overcome through an innovative, community-based funding model.

We believe in you and trust in your understanding that every dollar you spend or donate sends a powerful message about what kind of world you want to live in and so we make sure our Partners (the causes) are trustworthy organizations that really need to have their message heard.  We are committed to finding the most important and honorable causes which ultimately look after the best interests of humanity and the planet as a whole.

story:
Short Summary

Hello My name is Todd Pheifer from the Band's Todd and The Other's Too!!! and Off Track I.C.   We are excited to announce that we have been writing songs this last year and are ready to  go back to the studio and record a full album of Original Music.  

It was a tough decision to start a campaign and ask our friends, family and fans to  help fund this album, but with all the costs involved with studio time, material investment (Cd's, cover's copywriting) it was impossible to do on our own.  With your help we hope to achieve a great new album and move to the next level into the music business. We are offering perks for each contribution to show our thanks and appreciation for supporting our Music.  

Not everyone can give and we understand that, but if you can share the message with other's on Social media or word of mouth that would help us also.  

What We Need & What You Get

If you help us reach our goal we have set up these perks for you.
$15 You will receive a signed CD 
$50 You will receive an signed CD  and 2 tickets to the release party
$100 You will receive a signed CD and 2 tickets to the release party and a Band T-shirt.
$150 You will receive a signed CD and 2 tickets to the release party and a Band T-shirt and a song dedication at the release party.

The Impact

We hope that you can help in any way.  We love our fans and we can't wait to let you listen to the new CD.

Risks & Challenges

In today's economy we understand the challenges to make ends meet.   We wanted you to be able to have something tangible for your investment, such as the Perks  previously mentioned.  We appreciate anything you can give.

Other Ways You Can Help

Share us on Facebook or twitter or just old fashioned word of mouth.  Anything you can do with help us tremendously, Thank You.

story:
Night Watch Paradox is a talented collective of musicians and artists dedicated to bringing an imaginative vision to their stage show and recordings. The musical equivalent of reading “Treasure Island," history is turned sideways in songs like The Ballad of Henry Clemm ( Edgar Allen Poe’s cousin, who was captured by Capt. Nemo) or The Admiral Fell, where privateers (In a flying airship) defeated the British in 1812. Night Watch Paradox' music needs to be seen performed live to be fully appreciated.

This is where you come in. We need your help to cover the costs to produce a video of our live performance we will be shooting on December 20th at the Howard County Historical Society Museum in Ellicott City, Maryland.

We need your help to cover the costs to produce a video of our live performance we will be shooting on December 20th at the Howard County Historical Society Museum in Ellicott City, Maryland.

story:
G’day!

The Girls From Oz are a self-funded, Aussie (but London based), singing cabaret trio who entertain at corporate events, festivals, functions and cruise ships around the world. We started the group as an official business at the beginning of last year and since then we have gone from strength to strength and continue to grow. We are blown away by the opportunities we’ve been given over the past 12 months, which include performing at the Chartered Accountants of Australia and New Zealand event at The House Of Commons, the Australian Craft Beer Festival, The Perth Mint World Money Fair in Berlin, The London Legacy Anzac Day Gala Dinner at Australia House and the Australia-United Kingdom Chamber of Commerce Melbourne Cup Gala at Australia House to name a few. We also had a very successful run at the Edinburgh Festival Fringe last summer in order to promote our brand and develop our material further. 

We have achieved a lot in the last 12 months, but we are currently trying to branch out into areas that we hope will benefit more people than just those involved in the group. Our crowdfunding campaign has been set up to help with this aim. Your contribution will help to expand the group further, to support us in becoming an advocate for Australian culture and music in the UK and around the world, and to create more work for people in the arts. We hope to achieve these things by doing the following: Firstly, we want to hire more Australian and New Zealand musicians and singers for our group; secondly, we would like to incorporate other cultures into our cabaret shows, and thirdly, we want to return to the Edinburgh Festival Fringe this year but with a band! You can read more about these aims in detail below. 

Australian Artists in the UK

In the beginning we simply envisioned a cabaret group with a great unique selling point, however, quite by fluke, we have become a vessel for showcasing Australian talent in London and we aim to continue in this direction. The group hires Australian (and New Zealand) singers and musicians to perform as part of the group. At present we have 9 singers and 3 musical directors who swap and change depending on availability, making it a flexible money earner for performers who are over here striving to achieve their ambitions within the entertainment sector.

We also have a close working relationship with the Australia-United Kingdom Chamber of Commerce who have not only hired The Girls From Oz to perform and host numerous events, but who asked us to source and supply other Australian talent based in London to perform at their very successful Australia Day Gala at London’s Waldorf Hotel earlier this year. We have since been asked to supply a similar service with other events and so would like to expand this angle of the business even further.

Working with Other Cultures

As well as being hired to perform at events and functions, we also produce our own cabaret shows throughout the year. Our aim is to invite acts from different cultures around the world to perform as guest artists showcasing their work within our shows. Last year we incorporated the Bagpipes into our Edinburgh Fringe show which was the inspiration for the idea. 

Our most exciting potential collaboration is with an Aboriginal band called Bärra West Wind who have become well known with the help of Australian singer/songwriter Gotye in the documentary WestWind by Ben Strunin.

Bärra West Wind are hoping to travel over to London later this year and we have been in conversation with them about a collaboration when they are here, provided we can cover their basic costs. We feel it’s important to show how multicultural Australia is, but we also feel it’s very important to share the culture of Australia’s original people which is what we wish to do with the Bärra West Wind band.

To read more about the band, their influences and to listen to their music, please visit https://soundcloud.com/barra_west-wind

Check out the trailer for the West Wind documentary by Ben Strunin by clicking on the following link (IT’S AMAZING!): https://youtu.be/Nv0C72F4nlQ 

You can also have a look at an example of the bands work here: https://youtu.be/8hl7n6uhFX0 

Edinburgh Band

Thanks to the people who supported last years Indiegogo Crowdfunding Campaign we were able to raise enough money to have band charts written for our unique arrangements of Australian songs. This year we are returning to the Edinburgh Festival Fringe to try out these new arrangements with our band! This will add an extra level of excitement to our show that we are very much looking forward to experiencing. 

 

What We Need & What You Get

Our ideal financial goal for covering these costs is £6,200. We have set our campaign target at only £4,000 for 2 reasons. Firstly, £4,000 is the absolute minimum we will need to get these projects off the ground. Secondly, if we reach our £4,000 goal on this Indiegogo campaign then the campaign becomes an InDemand project, which means we can continue to raise funds and build backer community even after our campaign ends. This will mean that we can continue to raise money for the group and may even be able to start investing money towards future guest artists, intergrating more cultures into our shows and perhaps put some money towards reaching a few of our long term aims such as recording an album. 

Breaking it down in more detail:

To give a completely transparent overview of our costs, here is the list of our expenses. These are in order of what the crowdfunding money will go towards as we raise the money (ie. if we only raise £500 then it will go towards paying the Fringe Fee and a little towards the Fringe accommodation costs. If we go over our target then money will start covering the costs for a decent band wage for the Edinburgh shows as well as click tracks which we can then use for all of our future shows.) 

£400 - The Edinburgh Festival Fringe participation fee

+

£1,000 (=£1,400) - Accommodation in Edinburgh for the 3 Girls and our Music Director (this does not include accommodation for the band as we hope to use musicians who will already be in Edinburgh)

+

£500 (=£1,900) - Travel costs to and from Edinburgh for the 3 Girls, our Musical Director, props, costumes and instruments. 

+

£400 (=£2,300) - Marketing Costs for the Edinburgh Fringe, our Pre-Edinburgh previews and the Bärra West Wind band. 

+

£300 (=£2,600) - Videoing and Editing of shows for future showreels. 

+

£900 (=£3,500) - Covering our Edinburgh Bands rehearsal fee

+

£500 (=£4,000) - Money towards guest acts.

(InDemand extras)

+

£1,600 (=£5,600) - Basic Band wage for the Edinburgh Shows. As always, it is a financial risk to take a show to the Edinburgh Fringe. The three Girls From Oz members and our Music Director who will be performing in Edinburgh are prepared to take the risk of making very little or even no money from the shows in order to try out new material and gain future work for the group, however, we do not feel it’s right to ask independent musicians to do the same, therefore, we want to make sure they will be getting at least a minimal fee for their hard work. 

+

£600 (=£6,200) - Click tracks made up to pad out our band. This will give our band a Big Band sound even when we’re playing venues that aren’t big enough for a full size band such as in our Edinburgh venue.

 

We are offering some perks!

We have been very busy trying to think up perks to say thank you for your contributions. 

Please see our list of perks below and if you can think of something that you’d like as a perk but can’t see it on the list, then please do share the idea with us. I’m sure it will be possible to add it! 

  • Watch a Girls From Oz rehearsal process!
  • Have The Girls From Oz record a personalised song for your special someone. 
  • A printed and signed Girls From Oz Photograph. 
  • Free Tickets to our shows.
  • Free Singing Lessons.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, and we completely understand that, but that doesn't mean you can't help! If you’ve read this far then please take the extra couple of seconds to share this page so we can spread the word to new groups outside our usual circle! We’d love to get the word out to more people and start making some noise about our campaign. Any help you can offer will be hugely appreciated! 

Please share using the Indiegogo share tools! 

Thank you! 

 

The Girls From Oz

????????????

Firstly, £4,000 is the absolute minimum we will need to get these projects off the ground. Secondly, if we reach our £4,000 goal on this Indiegogo campaign then the campaign becomes an InDemand project, which means we can continue to raise funds and build backer community even after our campaign ends. This will mean that we can continue to raise money for the group and may even be able to start investing money towards future guest artists, intergrating more cultures into our shows and perhaps put some money towards reaching a few of our long term aims such as recording an album. 
Breaking it down in more detail:
To give a completely transparent overview of our costs, here is the list of our expenses. These are in order of what the crowdfunding money will go towards as we raise the money (ie. if we only raise £500 then it will go towards paying the Fringe Fee and a little towards the Fringe accommodation costs. If we go over our target then money will start covering the costs for a decent band wage for the Edinburgh shows as well as click tracks which we can then use for all of our future shows.) 
£400 - The Edinburgh Festival Fringe participation fee
+
£1,000 (=£1,400) - Accommodation in Edinburgh for the 3 Girls and our Music Director (this does not include accommodation for the band as we hope to use musicians who will already be in Edinburgh)
+
£500 (=£1,900) - Travel costs to and from Edinburgh for the 3 Girls, our Musical Director, props, costumes and instruments. 
+
£400 (=£2,300) - Marketing Costs for the Edinburgh Fringe, our Pre-Edinburgh previews and the Bärra West Wind band. 
+
£300 (=£2,600) - Videoing and Editing of shows for future showreels. 
+
£900 (=£3,500) - Covering our Edinburgh Bands rehearsal fee
+
£500 (=£4,000) - Money towards guest acts.
(InDemand extras)
+
£1,600 (=£5,600) - Basic Band wage for the Edinburgh Shows. As always, it is a financial risk to take a show to the Edinburgh Fringe. The three Girls From Oz members and our Music Director who will be performing in Edinburgh are prepared to take the risk of making very little or even no money from the shows in order to try out new material and gain future work for the group, however, we do not feel it’s right to ask independent musicians to do the same, therefore, we want to make sure they will be getting at least a minimal fee for their hard work. 
+
£600 (=£6,200) - Click tracks made up to pad out our band. This will give our band a Big Band sound even when we’re playing venues that aren’t big enough for a full size band such as in our Edinburgh venue.
 
We are offering some perks!
We have been very busy trying to think up perks to say thank you for your contributions. 
Please see our list of perks below and if you can think of something that you’d like as a perk but can’t see it on the list, then please do share the idea with us. I’m sure it will be possible to add it! 

Watch a Girls From Oz rehearsal process!
Have The Girls From Oz record a personalised song for your special someone. 
A printed and signed Girls From Oz Photograph. 
Free Tickets to our shows.
Free Singing Lessons.

 
Other Ways You Can Help
Some people just can't contribute, and we completely understand that, but that doesn't mean you can't help! If you’ve read this far then please take the extra couple of seconds to share this page so we can spread the word to new groups outside our usual circle! We’d love to get the word out to more people and start making some noise about our campaign. Any help you can offer will be hugely appreciated! 
Please share using the Indiegogo share tools! 
Thank you! 
 
The Girls From Oz
????????????

story:
Who's Neon Animal?

We are Neon Animal, a Rock 'n' Roll band based in London, UK.

Our debut album "Bring Back Rock 'n' Roll from the Dead" has been positively received by both fans and the press, having been featured on the "Best of 2017" CD of Classic Rock Magazine, as well as in the "High Hopes" section of the same publication in 2018.

Born in the vivid capital of England, offsprings of a long-lasting collaboration, Mark Thorn (Lead Vocals), Miguel Martins (Guitar, Vocals), Jonathan Gaglione (Bass, Vocals) & Iv K. Lizz (Drums) met in the city's underground Rock & Punk scene when their common disillusion with music's current sterilised state brought them together in a shared vision: a world where Rock 'n' Roll still ruled and carried in its sound the primordial feeling of danger & magic that once promised to change the world as we know it.  For the past 2+ years we've been working hard together, touring around Europe & the UK, developing our craft and sound whilst aiming to bring our shared vision to life: making the best, most genuine & honest Rock 'n' Roll music we possibly can.

We are now committed to creating a killer, longer & better follow up record and with your support, we will achieve this.

If you've got any doubts about the perks, delivery/release dates, or any other questions, please enquire to info@neonanimal.com

(Subtitles available in English, Spanish, Italian, French & Portuguese on our campaign video).

Our Goal

We are aiming at raising £10,000 in order to record, mix, master & promote the album and help us finance our Autumn/Winter European Tour in 2018.

In return for your support and generosity, we've prepared a lot of perks exclusive to this campaign, including Neon Animal music, goods & experiences. No matter how much you can support us with, you'll get something in return that's worth your money! For £4 only you will have access to a digital download of our new EP "God's Own Bastards" (out late September) which is also included in all other perks. For £12, you'll get a limited edition Digipak of the EP signed by the band.  From £15 you can get your hands on a copy of the album you're helping us record as well as a personalised "Thank You" card from the band and your name on the album's credits. You can even get us to play a private gig for you at a reduced price. Or access the ultimate Neon Animal offer: an exclusive, single lifetime of Neon Animal releases (all future albums in every format) & gigs for one single, generous advanced offer! Check the list out and you will find something that will suit you!

We will be updating the campaign as we go as well as uploading videos of us in the studio when recording the album in September!

 

Why Indiegogo?

With the advent of  the internet and file sharing platforms, the music industry has suffered a dramatic blow: big record labels seem to not be able to support artists as they did before, and a new solid model that enables new artists to emerge and be able to live for and off the music they make is yet to be set in place. This makes it harder for a new band to be able to make a living whilst working on their music & talent.

Producing a professionally recorded album is still an expensive deal, and transforming a musical idea into a finished product still costs bands a lot more than it seems: from the recording session itself - which involves hiring quality recording studios & engineers - to financing the mixing & mastering of the album, a properly produced LP will easily cost in the region of a few thousand pounds, not considering printing of CDs & vinyls.

As if that isn't enough, in order for new music to reach the world and for you to notice it, artists still need to invest some more money in shipping copies to radios, magazines, blogs etc... and once the record is finally out, the band will still need to be mindful of all of the costs associated with being out on the road for weeks to promote the release: buying/renting a van, gas, tolls, ferries, food & accommodation - you name it!

 

Without the financial advance of a label or their web of contacts, crowdfunding campaigns have become one of the few means of support available to musicians nowadays, one that still enables new bands to bring their vision to life and record the music they've worked so hard to create.

With your help & support, we'll be able to make the record that we've been envisioning & working so hard for in the past year - and we promise we won't disappoint!

 

What if I cannot donate?

That is absolutely fine. The fact alone that you made it all the way here is grand.  If you cannot donate at all you can still do your bit by sharing this campaign on social media (using Indiegogo's sharing tools) and getting the word out there.

Thanks,

Neon Animal ​

story:
My Story

Music lights me up!  It feeds my soul.  It’s the medicine that heals my heart and nourishes my spirit.  And it has been apart of me as long as I can remember.  Or more specifically, since I was 7 years old.  That's when I picked up the guitar for the first time.  After a few lessons I was off and running and we quickly forged a lifelong relationship with one another.  At the age of 8 I began to also play the piano and was classically trained on her for many years to follow.  It’s hard for me to find words to express how much I love this beast of an instrument (although she can be a little difficult to travel with). Nonetheless, these instruments, along with a few years of vocal training and my intuitive ability to tap into poetic self expression, provided the perfect musical foundation for the singer-songwriter I've become.  

I’ve explored a number of creative, artistic career paths in my life (food, photography, music) and there’s been a consistent theme behind my work: beautiful healing.  I’m at my best when I’m creating and then nourishing others with my creations. And the form of nourishment that I love to share and cherish most is Music. Healing Music.  Smooth, yummy sonic sounds that soothe your soul.  This is what I live for and long to share with all of you!

 

My Songs

My heartfelt music speaks of hope, healing, and my personal journey of awakening. I write to make sense out of the insensible and in service to the downtrodden. I write to heal my own wounds. I sing because I love the way the vibrations feel as they resonate throughout my entire being. I share because I’ve witnessed your tears fall in sweet release after I’ve vulnerably bared my soul in front of you.  And that’s what keeps me going.  For it says to me the magic of my musical medicine is working!  

My songs are gifts from beyond myself that I’ve been blessed to receive as oracular transmissions for the upliftment of us all.  Several songs I’ve written have been first gifted to me in the dream state, which I then write down when I wake up.  Other songs just come out of nowhere and practically write themselves.  And many of the others I spend lots of time consciously crafting.  No matter how it happens, it’s a beautiful process every time!  I’m honored to be the receiver of so many song babies.  May these enchanting incantations I sing bring healing into our beings.  And may my songs be as much a healing balm for you as they have been for me.   

 

What I Need & How You Can Help

It’s through the collective support of your kind and generous financial donations I will be able to bring my music and passion for healing through Sound into the world!  The process of making a record is a costly endeavor if you don’t have the home studio or genius engineering skills to do it yourself (neither of which I currently have).

Through the collective power of crowd-funding I have the beautiful opportunity to bring into form the funds I need to bring my new album to life. By collaborating together in this way, we can all participate in awakening our SLEEPING GIANTs within to be the change makers we seek on this planet.

Here’s how I plan to use the funds I’m raising:

  • $8,000 – Studio Time with Producer & Engineer
  • $1,500 – Additional Guest Musicians
  • $755 – Album Mastering
  • $1,500 – Album Art & Design
  • $1,500 – Promotion
  • $1,300 – Perk Fulfillment
  • $1,000 – CD printing

Total to Raise: $15,555

 

‘Sleeping Giant’ Inspiration

The name of my upcoming album is ‘Sleeping Giant’, named after one of the tracks on the album, which gives voice to both what I’ve been going through in my own life and what I’m seeing at large in the world.  It speaks to the awakening power house that lies within each one of us: 

“There’s a Sleeping Giant deep within my ancient inner knowing. The time for her slumber to cease has come upon new dawning.”

(lyric excerpt from title track)

Just as a Giant Redwood Tree stoically stands in its elegant, breath-taking fullness, so too am I rooting deep and growing taller, unafraid to awaken into my potential and use my feminine voice as an instrument for change. 

We are in the age of the great awakening.  My inner giant is beginning to rise.  I rise for all the times I’ve fallen before. I rise for those who are unable or afraid to.  I rise for ones that have had their power taken away. I rise for all who’ve fallen in ages before. And I rise in solidarity with those who too are rising.  I invite you to join me upon this journey of Awakening Giants.

 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Help can come in more forms than just money!!  Here are some other ways you can help awaken the Sleeping Giant:

  • Please consider sharing my campaign and my music with other friends and music lovers in your life who value sonic nourishment!
    • www.maryredentemusic.com  
    • https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/new-album-sleeping-giant-by-mary-redente/x/14167539#/ 
  • Join my email list to stay informed on my shows, tour dates and music releases.  Emails are infrequent as I value the sanctity of your inbox as much as I value my own. You will find a sign up form on my website at the bottom of the page:  www.maryredentemusic.com
  • Consider becoming a Patron of the Arts by becoming an ongoing contributor to my work through Patreon.  http://patreon.com/maryredentemusic 
  • Do you produce events?  Let’s collaborate on bringing good music to good people
  • Love Yourself. Eat good food. Dance. Sing. And stay hydrated.

 

Additional Perk Rewards Notes:

It is with the spirit of gratitude that I wish to give back to you, just as you have so generously given to me!  I’m anticipating the release of the album to be around the Spring of 2019, (although it will be done when it’s done).  Preordered CD’s, digital downloads and other goodies will be distributed once complete.  If you’re interested in supporting me at the house concert level, house concerts can be scheduled anytime before or after the release of the album.  *Special note for those that don’t live in the San Francisco Bay Area: I am planning a US Music Tour for July 2019, so if you’re interested in hosting a house concert, we can coordinate a date for that time frame.

story:
Short Summary

Hi! We are Wrath Upon Eden from Phoenix, Arizona. The band was formed in 2010 by brothers Bobby, David, and Jerry Bryant. Shortly thereafter, the lineup was complete with Moses Lucero and Vinnie Espinosa. After a 2 year stint in the music scene, the band split up.

On January 18, 2017, Bobby Bryant passed away unexpectedly. We all decided to throw a Memorial Show in Bobby's honor. We all felt Bobby on stage with us that night and what was supposed to be a one off show, turned into us wanting to continue pushing forward with the band and write an album for Bobby titled, The Wake Of Tragedy. 

We put our blood, sweat, and tears into writing and recording this album, but with that, plus merchandise comes expenses. Please help us achieve this goal by creating this album and getting merchandise made by contributoring to our album campaign. It means the world to us!

What We Need & What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

We need around $5000.00 to get the album and merchandise paid off.

For $65.00 (Shout-Out):

  • Shout out credit on the inside of the CD sleeve.
  • Debut Album
  • Burned DVD from the January 6th Memorial Show
  • Official Album T-Shirt
  • #ForBobby B&W T-Shirt
  • Signed 4X6 Photograph
  • Wrath Upon Eden Button
  • Wrath Upon Eden Guitar Pick
  • 2 Black Stickers
  • 2 White Stickers
  • 2 #ForBobby Wristbands

For $50: (Album T-Shirt):

  • Debut Album
  • Burned DVD from the January 6th Memorial Show
  • Official Album T-Shirt
  • #ForBobby B&W T-Shirt
  • Signed 4X6 Photograph
  • Wrath Upon Eden Button
  • Wrath Upon Eden Guitar Pick
  • 2 Black Stickers
  • 2 White Stickers
  • 2 #ForBobby Wristbands

For $35.00: (#ForBobby T-Shirt):

  • Debut Album
  • Burned DVD from the January 6th Memorial Show
  • #ForBobby B&W T-Shirt
  • Signed 4X6 Photograph
  • Wrath Upon Eden Button
  • Wrath Upon Eden Guitar Pick
  • 1 Black Sticker
  • 1 White Sticker
  • 1 #ForBobby Wristbands

For $15.00 (Debut Album + Signed Photo)

  • Debut Album
  • Signed 4X6 Photograph
  • Wrath Upon Eden Button
  • Wrath Upon Eden Guitar Pick
  • 1 Black Sticker
  • 1 White Sticker
  • 1 #ForBobby Wristbands

Every bit helps! Whatever you can donate, we appreciate it dearly!

The Impact

The impact is huge! This is the entire reason why we got back together.

Other Ways You Can Help

Share! Share! Share!

story:
For much of the past decade, I've traveled around Canada and the USA performing solo. Me and my guitar (or guitars rather...occasionally mandolin) up on stage, or in someone's living room, without a net. After touring with a band for many years, it was definitely a big change. It took some time to develop my approach to performing solo, and what kind of energy I wanted to bring to the stage. Ironically, in the end I found that approaching a solo show in the same way as a full band concert was the way to go. The thing is, I didn't have the band to help create that energy with me, so it required a commitment from myself to push that energy out into the crowd each and every night. It also required me to approach the playing of my acoustic guitar in a more aggressive, percussive fashion. Playing chunky rhythms and lead licks simultaneously.


I have learned a lot over the past decade, and the 350,000 kms I've traveled. The shows I've performed. The people I've encountered along the way. Great Beyond is a representation of those experiences, and of what I've learned as a performer, and as a person. It's not always easy getting where you are going but, in the midst of life's struggles, the seeds of art are sown.


This is truly a SOLO recording. It's me and my guitar. This is a gift to those of you who come to my shows and want to take a piece of that experience home with you. For those who haven't had an opportunity to take in one of my solo shows, this is what it sounds like. I hope you enjoy it.


Pre-order your copy today! I've set up some package deals for you to take advantage of on here.  Anyone who preorders the CD will also receive the digital album "Beyond the Great Beyond".  A collection of bonus tracks that didn't find their way onto the record. 

For Kingston & area locals, I'll be offering combo CD +  tickets for the release concert on Friday October 25th at The Mansion in Kingston.
story_txt: For much of the past decade, I've traveled around Canada and the USA performing solo. Me and my guitar (or guitars rather...occasionally mandolin) up on stage, or in someone's living room, without a net. After touring with a band for many years, it was definitely a big change. It took some time to develop my approach to performing solo, and what kind of energy I wanted to bring to the stage. Ironically, in the end I found that approaching a solo show in the same way as a full band concert was the way to go. The thing is, I didn't have the band to help create that energy with me, so it required a commitment from myself to push that energy out into the crowd each and every night. It also required me to approach the playing of my acoustic guitar in a more aggressive, percussive fashion. Playing chunky rhythms and lead licks simultaneously.I have learned a lot over the past decade, and the 350,000 kms I've traveled. The shows I've performed. The people I've encountered along the way. Great Beyond is a representation of those experiences, and of what I've learned as a performer, and as a person. It's not always easy getting where you are going but, in the midst of life's struggles, the seeds of art are sown.This is truly a SOLO recording. It's me and my guitar. This is a gift to those of you who come to my shows and want to take a piece of that experience home with you. For those who haven't had an opportunity to take in one of my solo shows, this is what it sounds like. I hope you enjoy it.Pre-order your copy today! I've set up some package deals for you to take advantage of on here.  Anyone who preorders the CD will also receive the digital album "Beyond the Great Beyond".  A collection of bonus tracks that didn't find their way onto the record. For Kingston & area locals, I'll be offering combo CD +  tickets for the release concert on Friday October 25th at The Mansion in Kingston.

story:
My name is Andrew Bundy - singer-songwriter based out of San Francisco, CA. I turned 40 this year, quit my corporate 9-to-5 job to pursue music full-time (enter freaked out Emoji here), and I'm finally releasing my first fully-produced studio album after nearly 20 years of writing and performing!

This entire album is being produced and recorded by Trent Berry (Dreamrack Studios) and mixed by Jamieson Durr (Wally’s HydeOut) at historic Hyde Street Studios in San Francisco, CA. and an amazing collection of musicians (see 'Album Contributors' below). Though I have previously released music online it's all been simple piano/vocal arrangements so I'm excited to fully realize my songs with the addition of drums, bass, strings, horns, and additional vocalists.

 

I started writing music when I was 14 because I needed an outlet to express and process my feelings about being a young, insecure, closeted gay teenager (cue Tori Amos and musical theater!). As I got older I realized I was not alone and that my music had the ability to connect with other people. I'm creating this album to get my songs and my message out to a broader audience - and to discover who I am as an artist along the way. Your contributions will help fund this vision and allow my music to reach more people.

 

Glad you asked! Great production and distribution comes at a cost. $15,000 in cost, as a matter of fact. I'm fronting the initial costs (i.e. studio time, production, marketing, etc.) in order to get the recording process started and to launch this IndieGogo project but I'm hoping to raise the balance of funds through the financial contributions of friends, family and fans so I can focus on making the best album possible.

What's included in the $15K?

  • Recording
  • Mixing + Mastering
  • Digital Distribution (to Apple Music, Spotify, etc.)
  • CDs (limited run)
  • Vinyl Records (limited run)
  • Merchandise (t-shirts, stickers, etc.)
  • Marketing (including video and photography)
  • Graphic Design (for cover art and merchandise)

 

Great question! If you're reading this then you're likely a fan of music (ideally MY music!) or a fan of me, personally, and believe in my ability to make this album happen. For this reason I've built out a series of perks that give you exclusive access to both my music and to me, personally, depending on your level of investment and interest:

  • Ever wanted to write your own song or learn to sing? There's a Perk for that!
  • Want to attend an intimate house concert - or host one at your own home? There's a Perk for that, too!
  • Or would you rather just get the new music so you can listen to it by yourself on your computer, phone or vintage turntable? Perk, Perk, Perk!

 

I've previously shied away from putting together a studio album given the amount of work and money it takes to do it well. For this reason I've decided to leave my 9-to-5 job so I can dedicate my time and energy to making this EP great and subsequent release successful. Scary? Yes. Unpredictable? Absolutely! That being said, I have 16 years of corporate retail experience, 30 years of music experience, and an amazing network of creators, collaborators and advisors to help me out along the way. 

If I'm fortunate enough to exceed my $15K target then I'll be able to invest in some killer music videos (which are critical to expand reach through YouTube, Facebook, Instagram, etc.), record a couple of additional tracks that can be released as singles, and get my music out to a broader audience through additional PR and marketing. If I fall short of my goal then I'll have to scale back on physical production, merchandise, and marketing to make sure we can complete production on any work-in-progress and possibly release these tracks as singles. 

 

These are tough times and I realize you might believe in my album but have limited means to contribute financially. Here are other ways you can help me out:

  • Micro-donations - You can donate flexibly to my campaign through $1 increment Perks. No amount is too little and I appreciate any contribution you can make! 
  • Share this campaign with others - Help me spread the word by sharing this campaign with your friends, family, colleagues, etc.
  • Join my mailing list - This is completely free and will give you access to exclusive content. In addition you'll be the first to know about upcoming shows and events. Sign up here!
  • Download or stream my music - Digital downloads and streams on Spotify, Apple Music, Amazon Music, etc. help generate royalty income for songwriters and artists. 
  • Attend my shows - I love connecting with people through a live performance so visit my website or track me on Bandsintown to check out an upcoming concert.

 

All tracks recorded at Hyde Street Studios by Trent Berry (Dreamrack Studios). The below list of contributors will be updated as tracks are completed. 

  • Production - Trent Berry (Dreamrack Studios), Andrew Bundy
  • Engineering - Trent Berry (Dreamrack Studios)
  • Additional Engineering - Giuseppe Pinto, Robert Lee
  • Mixing - Jaimeson Durr (Wally’s HydeOut)
  • Mastering - Justin Weis (Trakworx Studios)
  • Songwriting - Andrew Bundy (all songs), Clifton Jennings ('2020 Vision'), Justin James Sinclair ('Perfect Life')
  • Lead Vocals - Andrew Bundy
  • Background Vocals - Andrew Bundy, Samantha Margret, TBA
  • Drums - Chris Thalmann, Troy Berry
  • Percussion - Trent Berry
  • Bass - Robert Menacho
  • Piano - Andrew Bundy
  • Organ/Keyboard - Guiseppe Pinto, Andrew Bundy
  • Strings - Lewis Patzer, Andrew Bundy
  • Horns - TBA
  • Album Artwork - Ryann Lecklider, Mathieu Fretschel

story:
Cabanijazz Project is a performing and recording 8-piece Latin band from the San Francisco Bay Area with original compositions and arrangements led by GRAMMY Award-Winning Conga Player & Composer Javier Cabanillas.

Even though the CORONAVIRUS has currently stopped production from finishing our project, it hasn’t stopped our spirits and willingness to finish the production.

***We can finish it with your help!***

Since the launch of our first album INFRASONIC in 2018 which received 4-Star Ratings and reviews from DOWNBEAT MAGAZINE, we’ve  been featured on JETBLUE and UNITED AIRLINES, NPR, PBS radio, SeriusXM Satellite Radio, and International DJ’s playlists.

Now In 2020, Cabanijazz Project is embarking on another full-album of 9 songs that features Artists such as Francisco Torres, trombonist that is most recognized as the Musical Director for Poncho Sanchez and collaborates with Disney music productions,, Scott Martin Saxophonist who is currently on tour with the Band WAR will also be on the album.  Orestes Vilato, legendary percussionist who came to fame during the Fania All Star era performing with Celia Cruz, Ray Barretto, and Carlos Santana to name a few.

However, despite Cabanijazz Project’s growing successes, there has  been a sudden temporary stop to their music production HELLASONIC, the third album by Cabanijazz Project  which is due to the unfortunate CoronaVirus that  has restricted us to finish the production.

We need your help.  All of Cabanijazz Project’s musicians are professionals and dedicated to the artistic discipline of music.  We perform, teach in educational systems, and most of our work has been restricted to social distancing, or “Shelter-In-Place” statewide ordinance and many planned gigs (income) has been either postponed or canceled all together.

You Can Help!

We want to offer you a number of options that can get us to complete our goals.

A few examples would be to buy our merchandise such as our first CD entitled INFRASONIC, our second production RETROSONIC Vinyl 7” 45RPM  (limited production for collectors), and as well as offering our 3rd album HELLASONIC in 10” Vinyl Album.  Digital Downloads of all our music.

Private Conga Class via Zoom or online streaming.

Your name printed on the “Thank You to ________”  in the album.

As well as your name as a ”special contributor _________,” printed on the album.

The funds collected will go directly to music professionals in the mixing, mastering, and post production fields such as publishing materials.  In addition, it will help with promotion once the album is out planned for July 2020.

A brief timeline would be that in March we finish tracking all musicians remotely.

April would be sent off to mixing, then mastering.

Manufacturing takes 45 days from the time that all artwork design is completed so we plan to have it by July 2020 .

The Impact you contribute, will help professional musicians continue their goals of recording and finishing this project, build a sense of encouragement, so that ultimatel , our music can help fulfill the experiences of everyone’s lives.

 

Remember that if there isn’t anything that we’re are offering in your budget, you can always help by sharing this link and video to your friends and loved ones.

Or you can also seek to help other local bands or musician in your tow that most likely is going through a similar experience. 

Thank You and share the music, not the virus!

story:
THE SONGS

Good songs are universal. My songs are personal, yet their themes relate to us all. Take my story song “Travel On Down The Line,” which portrays how we make friends in unexpected places. In this tune, wanderlust was stirred and the railroad man who made it all happen became a beloved comrade. The frustrating search for the perfect romance finds its outlet in another song, the comic “Commitment.” Then there’s the beautiful but haunting piece about “Timothy.” “The Road Without A Star” (which originally appeared in an off-Broadway musical) expresses our most despairing moments when we lack confidence, yet somehow trust that we will find the guidance we’ve been seeking. “Follow Your Heart” shows that the answer has been inside us all along. Then there’s the call for humanity to “Wake Up.” These are just several of the tunes, including the signature title, “This Song Is Meant For You.” I indeed wrote this song for you—for all of you. Listen to it in my “pitch” video.

These eclectic songs are written in many different styles: pop, theatrical, folk, light rock, even jazz, which will all be represented on my upcoming album. The melodies are memorable. The chords and arrangements are complex and rich. And the lyrics are meaningful, sometimes humorous, and always thought-provoking. The songs comfort, amuse, entertain, express deep feelings, and elicit deep feelings. Uniting the songs are the themes of love, connection, and the resiliency and hope of the human spirit. You will be moved, inspired and uplifted. Music has the power to do all these things. For decades, audiences have told me that my music is especially powerful.

These songs—five of which earned awards—deserve a voice. I realize that now is the time to present them to the world.

 

ABOUT ME

Music has always been essential in my life. I sang before I talked, began piano lessons at the age of four, and picked up the guitar when the instrument was still far too big for me. My most important musical influences were the baroque master J.S. Bach with his many chord changes and running bass lines, the musical theater genius of Rogers and Hammerstein, and great songwriters such as Carole King and James Taylor. For decades in New York City I honed my singing skills for a three-octave voice, earning my living playing in coffee houses and clubs. I also wrote the music and lyrics for two off-off-Broadway shows. During my free-lance jobs for Hospital Audiences Inc.—an organization that provided performers for institutionalized audiences—I saw how music could touch souls, whether they were elderly in nursing homes, bedridden patients in hospitals, or children with serious illnesses who lay quietly in isolated wards. Whenever and wherever I performed, my audiences and I always connected deeply with each other.

After I encountered some serious health challenges—including an agonizing period when I even lost my singing voice—I began a career in the healing arts and electromedicine, partly to help myself reestablish what I had lost. For a long time I earned my living as a counselor, and then as an internationally published writer in the fields of psychology and holistic health. I have never regretted those choices, but now my heart is urging me to complete a promise I made long ago to myself and to the many people in my audiences who loved my music: to professionally record my original songs. Now I am ready. I don’t want to see any more time pass before I realize my goal.  

 

WHAT YOU WILL BE FUNDING

Your generous contributions will help produce this first debut album of twelve songs, called “This Song Is Meant For You” (after one of the song titles). Although I’ll play either piano or guitar on all songs, additional guitar and keyboard tracks from some very gifted musicians will give the album an even more versatile feeling, along with a fuller sound. The songs will also be enhanced with bass, drums/percussion, and other instruments. My own harmony vocals will be augmented by additional backup singers. Here’s what you’ll be paying for. It does not include the 5-8% rate I pay to Indiegogo.

            Projected costs     TOTAL $12,410.00

Recording studio time, editing, mixing, and mastering:                        $  5,760.00

Supporting musicians (bass, additional guitar, additional keyboard, drums/percussion, flute, sax, backup singers):                                                                             $  3,800.00

CDs (includes cases, liner notes, color cover, and graphic design): $  2,850.00

All funding I receive will go into the album’s production. I have every reason to believe that I will reach my goal, as fundraising events for previous projects (including a 1000+ page book on holistic medicine) have always been successful. Any funds in excess of what I need will be allocated toward my next two albums.

 

A UNIQUE APPROACH TO RESONANCE

This album will be available in two formats: as MP3 downloads, or a special 2-CD set. Both the 2-CD Set and Digital Deluxe packages will contain two sets of recordings. Why two sets? The first CD (or first set of MP3 files) will be tuned, like most commercially available music, according to the modern concert pitch of A=440 Hz. The alternate CD (and MP3 files) will be sonically adjusted to 8 Hz lower in pitch—the A=432 Hz tuning—which was commonly used as a worldwide standard before the year 1910. Eight hertz (cycles per second) may not seem like much, but to some people the effects of even that small increment feel profound. Those who prefer the A=432 Hz tuning profess that it is more compatible with the biological and energetic frequencies of the human body. I wanted to give my listeners a choice, hence the two CDs. The 440-Hz CD will allow musicians to more easily play their (fixed-tuned) instruments with the recorded tracks, while the 432-Hz tuning may literally resonate better with some people and be more pleasing for them to listen to.

 

TIME FRAME

Despite the difficulty in finding recording studios able to work with me in this current lockdown climate, I did manage to find a talented recording engineer, as well as a group of dedicated professional musicians, who strongly believe in my music and are eager to participate in this album project. The album should be ready to ship by or before December 2021.

 

WHAT YOU CAN DO EVEN IF YOU CAN’T CONTRIBUTE FINANCIALLY

If you cannot contribute, that’s okay—you can still help me by spreading the word! Indiegogo has a special “share” function that will allow you to do this easily. For those on social media (Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, Mewe, etc.), share my gift of music with your family, friends, colleagues, and acquaintances.

 

THANK YOU

Thank you sincerely for your encouragement and support in helping me fulfill a lifelong dream. My life’s purpose has remained consistent throughout my many career paths: to help others heal, whether that healing is through touch, talking, the written word, or music. I trust that in the music you hear, you will receive what I intended—and hopefully much, much more.

Blessings to all, Nenah Sylver

The first CD (or first set of MP3 files) will be tuned, like most commercially available music, according to the modern concert pitch of A=440 Hz. The alternate CD (and MP3 files) will be sonically adjusted to 8 Hz lower in pitch—the A=432 Hz tuning—which was commonly used as a worldwide standard before the year 1910. Eight hertz (cycles per second) may not seem like much, but to some people the effects of even that small increment feel profound. Those who prefer the A=432 Hz tuning profess that it is more compatible with the biological and energetic frequencies of the human body. I wanted to give my listeners a choice, hence the two CDs. The 440-Hz CD will allow musicians to more easily play their (fixed-tuned) instruments with the recorded tracks, while the 432-Hz tuning may literally resonate better with some people and be more pleasing for them to listen to.
 
TIME FRAME
Despite the difficulty in finding recording studios able to work with me in this current lockdown climate, I did manage to find a talented recording engineer, as well as a group of dedicated professional musicians, who strongly believe in my music and are eager to participate in this album project. The album should be ready to ship by or before December 2021.
 
WHAT YOU CAN DO EVEN IF YOU CAN’T CONTRIBUTE FINANCIALLY
If you cannot contribute, that’s okay—you can still help me by spreading the word! Indiegogo has a special “share” function that will allow you to do this easily. For those on social media (Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, Mewe, etc.), share my gift of music with your family, friends, colleagues, and acquaintances.
 
THANK YOU
Thank you sincerely for your encouragement and support in helping me fulfill a lifelong dream. My life’s purpose has remained consistent throughout my many career paths: to help others heal, whether that healing is through touch, talking, the written word, or music. I trust that in the music you hear, you will receive what I intended—and hopefully much, much more.
Blessings to all, Nenah Sylver

story:
Hey, Matt Brooker here!

For those of you who don’t know me, I am a classically trained musician that has recently set my sights on becoming a professional jazz singer. Relatively new to Atlanta, GA, I have lived here somewhere around 4 years. In 2017 I was introduced to the Piano Bar at Campagnolo (campagnoloatl.com) and began my adventures singing publicly on a regular basis and really finding my voice. Soon after, in 2018, I performed in shows at a local venue, TEN Atlanta, with Robert Ray (the Piano Bar player) and then started my own gig at Olive Bistro, singing every Sunday. 

Fast forward to March of 2020.  The pandemic seemed to take all of that momentum from me overnight. I couldn't really find my voice singing on livestream and, of course, I couldn't sing anywhere publicly, which affected me in ways I wasn’t ready for. I took it in stride, remembering that over the past year each and every person on earth has been affected by the global outbreak... and that just blows my mind. I know that this has had a personal impact on every single one of my friends, and especially the relationships between them.

As the world is coming out of lockdown, I have decided that now is the time to write my first album. I have learned so much about myself and my relationships with friends and family, and I know there are even more stories that will inspire my music. I need to reconnect with my circle of people and really find out what they went through and what their perspective is. 

I have asked friends and family to share their stories with me through a video diary, and I want people to find strength in sharing their truths. Some of these stories will be a part of a series called Pandemic Perspectives. I will then create new music and curate an album that includes the inspiration I find resonating in their stories.

People Being People. 

The reason I created this Indiegogo Campaign is simple: recording an album is expensive. Now, I have been able to make a down payment to get the ball rolling, but I have quite a ways to go. I am only asking for donations from those who feel comfortable doing so, knowing that everyone in my circle has been affected in different ways.

What We Need & What You Get

I need to raise $12,000 to complete the funding for the album. This will cover the cost of the following:

• Professional music charts to accompany the songs I will write for this album

• The musicians, piano, bass, drums, as well as a few colorful moments with sax, strings and backup vocals. This includes recording time and rehearsal time!

• Three days at an award winning recording studio (800east.com)

• Our amazing Producer for this project (Dunlop Productions)

• Sound Engineers 

• Professionally video taped portions of the recording process

• Album Cover Photography

• CDs to be made for distribution 

Donation Gift Levels:

$25 - Digital Download of the Newly Released Album

$50 - Digital Download, a CD and a Signed Copy of the album Artwork

$100 - Digital Download, a CD, a Signed Copy of the album Artwork and a Custom 

Happy Birthday Video within one year of project completion

$250 - I will come and sing Happy Birthday for your event!  Or, if you are not within a 

local travel radius, I will livestream my performance via your preference of video 

call.

$500 - A one hour Live Performance at your venue with professional Tracks (just like 

Sundays at Olive Bistro!)

$1,000 - I will come to your event and give a 3-hour performance with live music (piano)

 

*All Donations over $100 receive a VIP pass to the Album Launch Party! This includes access to the VIP Bar (shorter lines!) as well as the FREE Signature Cocktail!
