story:
A.M.E.N.

What do you do when time and time again you lose the ones you love the most? Should you give in to despair, or turn even more to the faith that was so strongly inspired by those who are gone, but who will forever live in your heart? This is the story of A.M.E.N., the debut album of Nesbeth, one of Jamaica's most prominent reggae artists, who used faith and inner strength to graciously deal with loss. and who is once again channeling through music the important social messages that he is known to convey to his audiences.

After losing his mother to cancer four years ago, and seeing his sister also pass away shortly after. He was faced with the unthinkable, he had to say goodbye to his beloved wife, Ann  Marie Elliot-Nesbeth, two years ago this February.  Nesbeth acknowledges these hurtful experiences showed him that faith is the only way to be truly alive and reunite with those we love. Nesbeth is dedicating his debut album to his wife, The albums name has a double meaning: the title is A.M.E.N. both because its an acronym of her name and because the family's trust in a higher power was a fundamental part of Ann Marie's way of life and beliefs.

No stranger to the perils of life, Nesbeth had a rough past. Born in Kingston, Jamaica, he spent the earlier years of his life living in the challenging community of Arnette Gardens, an experience that marked him and made him commit to leaving such a harsh context while promising to give back to the community that originally saw him grow as a person.These hard times led Nesbeth to find in music a way to express his thoughts, feelings and values, and to be an artistic advocate of the social change that he saw was necessary. These values were also very important to Ann Marie, Nesbeth’s cherished soul mate. Ann Marie was known as a loving mother and wife, who had enough love for everyone and in particular  with her children, She was a woman of faith who also believed that music could help reshape the world to be a fair and happier place. Ann Marie and Nesbeth were on the same journey they had a great love for life, music, family and a better tomorrow.

Since she has passed away, Nesbeth remains connected to Ann Marie through an unending love that is now on its way to being expressed in a reggae-infused music album where all the values that they both shared are addressed through powerful reggae vibes for individual growth and social change that you can dance to.

A Lesson On Moving On

 

Nesbeth has also been able to turn his tribulations into something good. As a single parent, he had to find the strength to ensure the couple's children had the love, support, and stability that they needed to move forward, honoring their mother's memory with bravery and positive steps toward their future. As hard as it was for their children to cope with losing their mother, Nesbeth has been able to help them go through such an impacting experience in a way that has ultimately been constructive. Also, Nesbeth has been providing a solid example as a socially conscious artist who didn't lose his way despite such a turbulent time and he even became an even more influential example among the many young fans who follow his work. Indeed, Nesbeth has been a living example of what moving on while keeping a loving memory forever alive should be all about, inspiring thousands of people, namely those who are younger and more vulnerable, to keep stay strong, grounded on positive values, and to never stop pursuing their dreams and aspiring  to have a happy and meaningful life. The A.M.E.N. album is definitely also the coronation of this vital life lesson that the Jamaican artist has both learned and sought to share with others.

    
 

Healing Through Music

Music has the unique power to heal where spoken words fail to offer comfort. It has the unifying, therapeutic, heart-warming and soul-feeding way of allowing people to express themselves and share profoundly healing feelings of relief that no other experience could offer. Music is the universal language that every person and culture in the world shares, understands and appreciates, and where language matters far less than sentiments. It has been mostly through music that Nesbeth has faced the disheartening reality of no longer having Ann Marie at his side, and it has also been mostly through music that the Jamaican reggae artist has connected even deeper with his fans, who have supported him as a single dad seeking to make his departed wife feel proud of him.

WHAT ARE YOUR THOUGHTS ON THIS MOCK ART WORK?  Share your thoughts and idea! this was drafted for the purpose of this campaign. If you’re a graphic design perhaps you can design the art work for this project as away of showing your support ;-)

For Nesbeth, as much as for his fans, music has also been the best remedy for personal and social healing, since it brings out an empowering force that every person has within them. It is also through music, namely through this new A.M.E.N. album, that Nesbeth wants to share his healing experience with those who, like him, have also dealt or are dealing with loss and other tribulations, with those who believe in a better tomorrow, and, ultimately, with everyone who couldn’t live without the soothing and refreshing touch of great reggae music.

From Victory to A.M.E.N.

The A.M.E.N. album is not just born out of meaningful feelings, experiences and lessons… it is also the result of an enriching musical and technical background  In the past, we released Nesbeth’s ‘Victory’ EP, which consisted of 5 songs that you can listen to here [https://itunes.apple.com/us/album/victory-ep/93...].  Fans were happy with what we did, but felt that it should become a richer album, which is precisely what we now want to create with A.M.E.N. For those who enjoy pure reggae, A.M.E.N. promises to be one of the most unforgettable reggae records that you can listen to.

The Bright Side of Social Networks

In so many ways, social networks have played a fundamental role in Nesbeth's journey. The artist has become even closer to his fans through social media, he has shared the challenges that he has faced and lessons that he has learned also through social media, and he has used these networks to inspire his fans to keep their beliefs strong and alive, and their love for meaningful music growing ever stronger. In the same way, it was through social media that Nesbeth's fans have supported him every step of the way and that they have witnessed and appreciated the great father he has been to the couple's children by seeing his example and keeping up with his personal and musical journey. Social media has also been an essential tool in Nesbeth’s work to help bring about change in so many aspects, through the engaging songs that he has sang and authored.

And now these social networks, through the world of crowdfunding, are giving us a unique chance to get Nesbeth’s fans to be deeper part his journey and history, A.M.E.N. album will be deep and meaningful  every Nesbeth fan and reggae lover would like it to be.

We’re crowdfunding  to help pay for recording, mixing, marketing, and everything else. Your support will keep us in the studio, help us continue to sample and manipulate the music we’ve recorded, will help us get additional production work done; and will help us design, package, market, and distribute the album. The whole thing. We literally cannot do it without you.

Giving the circumstances surrounding Nesbeth’s Mother,Sister and Wife tragic ending. We  also want to use this campaign to raise awareness, which is why we are to donating 10% to a person suffering from Cancer .

 

WHAT YOU GET

 As a supporter of the campaign, you will get first access to the music at least 48hrs before anyone else. Just for you, we’ve created an exciting collection of exclusive rewards to select from...

THIS IS A SPECIAL OPPORTUNITY

Have your say  about what design you would like to see  for Artwork & Merchandise

EXCLUSIVE ALBUM RELEASE

  • SIGNED CD
  • SIGNED T-SHIRT

  • VINYL ALBUM LIMITED EDITION (STRETCH GOAL)

  • TOTE BAG
  • ONE-ON-ONE SKYPE

And much more

If contributing financially isn’t for you, there are other important ways you can pitch in and be an important part of the launch of A.M.E.N.

 Use the Indiegogo share tools and let your friends on social media know what we’re up to. Especially consider telling your friends about our mission and message. The more people who know about and imagine this project coming to life, the more likely that it will happen

 

Thank you so much, and we hope to be soon sending your exclusive pre-release copy of A.M.E.N. and rewards

 

FAQs

    •    When will the album come out?

    •    We have not announced a release date as of yet but will communicate that to you at the end    of this campaign.  

         All money raised are sent out within 15 business days after campaign ends so we will need to take this in consideration for production.

    •    When will my stuff ship?

    •    Just prior to release of the album (see above). Digital copies of the album will be emailed to every contributo at least 48 hours prior to official release.    

    •    I placed an order and have a question.
If you've placed an order you can file a support ticket. If you have not placed an order please email nesbethreggae@gmail.com and we’ll do our best to respond. 

 

 

Thank you so much for your love and support !

story:
I have been working really hard on some new r&b/soul music for the last several months, and I‘m in the final stages of recording them with an engineer that I’ve dreamed of working with for years. We are really excited about the upcoming release, and I have equally exciting plans for visuals to get started on in the next few weeks. This project has been entirely self-funded so far, but realistically without the help of you guys, it will be incredibly difficult to achieve what we are hoping to in a timely fashion. This campaign, if filled, will only subsidize the cost, so anything helps!! I am so excited to share my passion project with you all and grateful for any and all support.  

 

Cost breakdown:

Studio hours: $5,000

Visuals: $5,000

Studio musicians: $1000

Album Art, Promotional Photography, Behing the Scenes, ETC: $1000

 

There are many more expenses to be accounted for as well, but these are where this 12,000 will go if received, and if only part of the goal is met, they will go towards these costs in this order.

story:
Purpose

Hey! We're The Brothers Holk and we're a band made up of three brothers from Tampa, FL now living in Nashville, TN. Scott, the oldest brother, is the drummer, John, the middle brother, sings lead vocals, and William, the youngest brother, sings vocals, plays guitar, bass, keys, and produces. We're doing this campaign in order to fund our first EP release so that we can start our journey as a band.

What We Need & What You Get

In order to record and release this album we hope to raise $10,000. The cost covers recording, mixing & mastering the five original songs, album artwork, photo shoots, the physical copies of the albums, and promotion for the album. Instead of just asking for your money, we've set up different packages that you can purchase to support us which include CDs, stickers, shirts, posters, and more.

The Impact

We don’t take lightly the blessings that God has shown us by gifting us with musical talents and abilities. Out of appreciation for the lasting hope He gives us through His son, we want to use our music as a platform to share the good news of Jesus Christ wherever we go.

Other Ways You Can Help

More than anything we need prayer for guidance as we embark on this crazy journey. We would also greatly appreciate you sharing this campaign with as many people as you think would be interested in supporting our band.  Every prayer and any kind of donation is gratefully appreciated!

More than anything we need prayer for guidance as we embark on this crazy journey. We would also greatly appreciate you sharing this campaign with as many people as you think would be interested in supporting our band.  Every prayer and any kind of donation is gratefully appreciated!

story:
This first “en pleine lumière” album represents the beginning of a new chapter in my life, and feels very much like I have found my life’s mission. 

Having trained and worked professionally in the world of classical music for a great number of years, throughout my career I have focused nearly exclusively on studying, performing, and teaching the works of male composers. This has been fairly standard practice in the classical world. Only recently have I considered looking more deeply into why this is, and whether there may in fact also have been brilliant and masterful female composers throughout music history. 

I began by researching piano music by composers born in the 19th century, and right away realized that of course there were many women who composed at least as masterfully as their male counterparts. It feels like discovering that a fabulously decorated and designed wing of a house has unbeknownst to me always existed; in the house that I have lived in my whole life!

By pre-ordering CDs or digital downloads of the album, and by contributing to this campaign, you become an important part of the production of this album. My dearest hope is that this beautiful music will be heard by many listeners, and that bit by bit these composers’ names and compositions become part of standard repertoire. 

As you may know, recording an album is a hugely expensive endeavour. In my experience, it usually works out to around $10,000 CAD. The costs include rental of the recording venue and instrument, and the fee for the recording engineer/producer/digital masterer, and these are the expenses that this funding campaign will cover.

A portion of the funds has already been raised from people who have heard the program in concert.  This is my fifth album which is being produced in partnership with my listeners, and for that  I am so grateful! And at the same time, I am so excited to share this music with you!

This album is being produced by an all female team, and will be recorded in the beautiful Immanuelskirche Cultural Centre in Wuppertal, Germany.  I am really looking forward to working with Kaling Hanke, a very experienced classical “Tonmeisterin”. The recording sessions will take place during the first week of June, and the final product will be released in early fall of this year.

I have performed this music many times already, and audiences have been very excited about these musical discoveries! 

 “I cannot stop thinking about your recital yesterday, so wonderful.”

“Thank you for shining the light on these beautiful women composers and in doing so, enabling their light to shine. I believe they would be honoured to know you are doing this.”

“Positively celestial...Can hardly wait for the CD!”

“Thank you Sandra for your beautiful performance of this exquisite music! Thank you for honouring these women by shining light on their work and artistry.”

Ten composers born in the mid-19th century are each represented by two pieces on this album. Backer-Grøndahl, Beach, Bonis, Boulanger, Chaminade, Hopekirk, LeBeau, Lærum-Liebig, Menter, and Netzel. (By the way, I have a second volume ready to record as well, featuring composers born in the late 19th century. I hope to get this recorded very soon...stay tuned.)

Thank you for your interest, and for sharing in this creating of this album...you are going to love it!

And one more thing...sharing this webpage on all your social media directly helps more people hear these composers who have been so undeservedly neglected (until now!).

sandramogensen.com

story:
It has taken us over 3 years to finish recording this CD!  And we really want to share the music with all of you....  

And we need your help. There are a ton of expenses, from paying our wonderful sound engineer and co-producer, JonJon Alevizakis, to studio time, mixing, mastering, graphic design, and the costs of printing the cds.   We also hired some of the most wonderful musicians to add their beauty and artistry to the music, and it is important to us that we pay them a fair wage.  Because it has become much more difficult to earn money from recorded music since the rise of streaming music and youtube, this is one way musicians are able to afford to record new music.  

If you feel drawn to this music, and if you want to support us, please consider buying a CD (or even a few to give as gifts).  

You can also receive music lessons, group singing workshops, or a house concert. 

In these days of streaming music, people don’t often listen to full albums, or have access to the lyrics that we are presenting with care.

No matter what you do, we hope you receive some sweetness from this music. 

with love,

Eliyahu & Rachel

 

This album features:

Rachel Valfer:  vocals, oud, guitar, kemanche

Eliyahu Sills: vocals, ney reed flute, upright bass, oud, handclaps, bansuri flute

Faisal Zedan:  Arabic percussion (darbukkah, dahole, riqq, daf, bendir)

Gari Hegedus: Baglama Saz, Kopuz

Bouchaib Abdelhadi: Darbukkah, vocals

Hamid Saeidi: Santoor

Mehrdad Arabifard: Tombek

Jelaleddin Takesh: Kanun

Shimshai: Guitar, wurlitzer

Surya Prakash : Drum kit  

Marlon Aldana: Shaker

 

 

Nine years ago, Rachel Valfer & Eliyahu Sills released their first album, EASTERN WIND with The Qadim Ensemble.  

The recording received rave reviews:

“Beautifully presented, the players bring superb musicianship and palpable enthusiasm to each performance. Eliyahu’s ney flute along with Rachel’s lush vocals are stars. creating a sense of human communication with the divine.”
— Banning Eyre, All Things Considered, NPR

When we received a phone call letting us know the album was on Billboard’s World Music Charts, we were overcome with joy. Two days later, we got married.

Now, nearly ten years later, they are releasing our second album that features music from influential artists that they admire. Support our work by ordering a CD or another gift -  your contribution will go directly to the artists and team behind the Qadim project.

This art can't be done without you.

story:
The ambiguous name 'Les Abbagliati', means "the enlightened ones" or "the dazzled ones"; we chose it because we are dazzled by the beauty of music and art, and hope to bring enlightenment to our audiences!

We’ve been thinking about recording for quite some time. In the end we chose a programme with three cantatas that have never been recorded before. Two of these cantatas were copied by Soetkin from a manuscript which she found in the Austrian National Library in Vienna. We’ll be combining these vocal pieces by Bononcini and d’Astorga with instrumental music by Handel.

Linking the three is Baroque librettist and poet Domenico Lalli, who was a close friend of d’Astorga, wrote one of the books on which Handel’s Radamisto was based, and wrote a libretto for an opera by Bononcini.

We chose this particular programme because not only is this music very dear to us personally, but we’ve been playing it to audiences for some years already. You could say it’s a programme that has matured over the years.

But we need help getting this wonderful project off the ground. So if you can, dear patron of the arts, please help us out by making a financial contribution to our project.

 

Budget details: 

- The biggest part goes to the CD production, editing, and mastering by Rainer Arndt from CD label Ramée.

- A smaller part goes to Felipe Pipi who makes professional publicity material.

- Rental for the recording venue, a small church with excellent acoustics located in the Ardennes.

- Accomodation for the musicians and the recording team near the recording venue.

 

Please help us make it happen!

 

If you can't make a financial contribution right now, please help us spread the word by telling your friends and spreading the word on social media.

If you want to help us, but you can pay only with Maestro, please contact us!

Thanks so much: your support means a lot to us!

Annelies, Dimos, Ronan, Sien and Soetkin | Les Abbagliati

story:
Hi everybody, My name is Jeff Coffey.  Some of you may know me from my time with the band Chicago and currently with Don Felder (formerly of the Eagles).  I’ve been super blessed to play with some of the greats in the business and I’ve met some amazing people along the way.  I love what I do! Music has enriched my life since the first time I ever picked up an instrument.

     I’m really excited to share with you this next chapter in my career.  And I want to invite YOU to go on this adventure with me.  It’s been a great ride so far, but this is only the beginning.  What’s coming up next is truly exciting.

     For the longest time, I’ve wanted to record an album of songs sung by some of the greatest artists of all time.  An album that will pay tribute to some of the most memorable tenor vocalists ever recorded.  This will be a collection of songs sung by singers who inspired me as a young man to eventually follow my dreams.  I want to think of this as a “Thank You Gift” to all the fans that I’ve met along the way.  People like Audrey Arturo, Mary Anderson, Colleen Marble, Louanne Courtright and Mark Webb and many many others.

     You see ... In the old world, record labels would sign you to a big record advance, pay for the record, videos and marketing.  Not to mention the radio campaign and tour support.  Now, much of that is on the artist’s shoulders.  This is why I want to invite you to come along with me on this venture.  This is why I need your help.  Feel free to take a look around and check out the perks and packages here on this page.

Thanks very much

Jeff

story:
YEStet is a jazz trio comprised of Kevin Scollins on guitar, Willis Edmundson on drums, and Benjamin Young on bass. As a group YEStet has been playing for over a year all across New England. During this past  year the group has developed their own sound and style. In August the group went into the studio to record their debut album. This album is set to be released in early 2019. The group plans to celebrate this release with an East Coast tour, showcasing the music of the album as well as new material. In order to make this possible we need the help from people like you!

We are looking for support to help pay for studio fees, licensing, publicity, artwork, and tour related costs.

story:
It’s been 5 years since the release of “Path of the Warrior” and the time for more Thousand Oxen Fury has come!  The full cast has returned along with some new faces!  Here’s how we are looking:

Scott Butler - Vocals, Guitars, Bass, GeoShred

Josh Tarrant - Drums, Percussion, Screams

Ben Little - Guitars

Eric Marlatt - Guest Vocals

Taylor Hahn - Production

 

This record is gonna be epic with plenty of surprises and plenty of head banging moments!  More epic, more progressive and more brutal!

story:
Hello everyone, my name is Ian Geyer, I am the creator and composer behind Jelliflow. Music has always been my first passion, beginning with picking up a guitar at six years old, guiding me all the way through my degree in Percussion Performance and Composition. This current project, Nomad, is my second album under the pseudonym Jelliflow. After composing, executing, and releasing my album Cosmic Waltz completely on my own, Jelliflow is taking a huge step up! I have assembled a wonderful team of vastly talented creators to help manifest Nomad— both the album and its film counterpart. Nomad tells the story of a man’s journey to cope with the loss of his lover in a tragic accident wherein he holds himself responsible for her death; he wrestles with the guilt, grief, and loss of her as he embarks on a quest to spread her ashes in their final resting place. I wrote this album as a way to lay my childhood to rest, to capture the reality of coping with change and growth. Sometimes it’s ugly. Sometimes it’s loud. No matter what, it’s a feeling that affects everyone. I wanted to create this world for Nomad, both visually and musically, to bring that isolating journey of growing up into a story everyone can connect to.

Jelliflow had so much support and love for Cosmic Waltz, but the magnitude of Nomad means we really need your help. Our funding goal of $16,500 will cover the cost of studio time, travel, lodging, production and equipment costs, as well as compensating our hardworking cast and crew. We want this album to be the best it can be, to be a breath of fresh air in the artistic world, and we want each and every one of you to be a part of the final product!

Everyone involved in Nomad so far has already put in so much brilliant work to bring you an epic journey on the album and on the screen. Your support means so much to us and everything we are creating.


Music and art have been my passion for as long as I can remember. I have given so much personally to this album; my goal is always to create real, genuine art, my heart and soul poured out for all to connect with. I aim to create the caliber of art I want to see from others, to ignite the best and boldest creativity, to breathe new life into the artistic community and hopefully inspire people to challenge their own boundaries. Nomad is a way to push the envelope, for myself and all who find it. I feel this is an important story to anyone who has ever dealt with loss, frustration, loneliness, depression, rebirth, even growing pains; to those who took those lessons and fearlessly move head-on into life; to those that never give up on the journey even without knowing the destination.

Annelise Smithmier is an actress, writer, producer, director, and editor; she creates the behind the scenes and promotional materials behind Jelliflow, as well as co-writing the story and characters within Nomad alongside me. She has been serving as my right-hand lady throughout the production process so far, covering everything from story to makeup to blooper reels. She has appeared in a wide range of productions over the last several years, including the New York Fringe Festival, and will be leading next in The Rain Sessions with Bottle Alley Theater Company in Austin. She says, “This is the largest and most complex piece I’ve ever worked on and I am wildly passionate about it! Nomad has demanded the most of my creative ability, making it incredibly fulfilling, both artistically and personally. Our team has driven this around the clock because we all believe in how special this project is. I can’t wait to show all of our hard work and touch lives with this story!”

Sam Lustig is our main man for Visual Effects and Compositing. He says, “I am so excited to be a part of this project. It's an ambitious one, for sure. The visual storytelling, combined with an album equal in it's ability to drive the narrative, has kept me motivated. I can't wait for the world to see what we've created.”

Mia St.Clair is an accomplished model who has worked across the country, everything from fashion to avant-garde character modeling, and acts as our lead director of marketing and public relations at Jelliflow. She helped start this process and is excited to be a literal acting part of this journey.

Our director, Larissa Garcia-Baab, is well known in the Austin artistic community as a hardworking and diligent creative. She has partaken in numerous works around the country both on and off screen as a film and theater writer as well as some shorts and commercial work. She adds, “Directing is truly what I believe I was put on this earth to do, and the beauty of this project, and, honestly, most film projects, is that is was born out a pure, communal desire to make the best possible product. I am humbled and proud to lead a group of talented, hilarious, and dedicated artists in our pursuit to tell a story that is at once familiar in its telling, but new in its execution. In short, it's rad to do what you love, especially with some of the best in the game”

Our director of photography, Jasper Heins, owns his own company JJ Cinematography, is well accomplished in the Montana advertisement community and for working with a wide range of musicians. He adds, “This project pushes me creatively and technically as a DP, which is the best thing to come out of any project. I thank Ian and my crew for making me a better creative and I can't wait to for everyone to see what we have in store”

Aaron Martin captures all of our aerial footage courtesy of his company, Vivid Northwest as our First AC/ Drone Operator. He adds, “This project is the PERFECT environment for me. As First AC, creating a technical efficiency (on and off camera) brings me pure bliss. When the weather permits, I'm the Drone Operator. Supplying emotion-driven aerial cinematography is my favorite way to showcase the beautiful earth we live on.

A new perspective at the right time can open many doors to happiness”

Ian is an accomplished model, actor, and musician, signed with multiple agencies nationwide. After releasing Cosmic Waltz in 2016, he has been an icon in the Austin fashion circuit.

Jelliflow is armed with an apt and intelligent crew, each a master of their own craft. We have already conquered challenges along the way—everything from long hours to nasty weather to flesh wounds—but we have overcome them all as a team. Moving forward challenges will be more frequent, but even the exhaustion of making this world as vivid as it can be is worth it to each individual involved. Our purpose is to create great art, no matter the cost.

Money isn’t the only form of support you can give! If you love what we’re doing and want to keep up, feel free to follow us on social media!
Twitter: @jelliflow
Facebook: fb.com/jelliflow
Instagram: @jelliflow
Youtube: Jelli Geyer
You can also show support for Jelliflow’s album Cosmic Waltz via jelliflow.bandcamp.com

She helped start this process and is excited to be a literal acting part of this journey.Our director, Larissa Garcia-Baab, is well known in the Austin artistic community as a hardworking and diligent creative. She has partaken in numerous works around the country both on and off screen as a film and theater writer as well as some shorts and commercial work. She adds, “Directing is truly what I believe I was put on this earth to do, and the beauty of this project, and, honestly, most film projects, is that is was born out a pure, communal desire to make the best possible product. I am humbled and proud to lead a group of talented, hilarious, and dedicated artists in our pursuit to tell a story that is at once familiar in its telling, but new in its execution. In short, it's rad to do what you love, especially with some of the best in the game”Our director of photography, Jasper Heins, owns his own company JJ Cinematography, is well accomplished in the Montana advertisement community and for working with a wide range of musicians. He adds, “This project pushes me creatively and technically as a DP, which is the best thing to come out of any project. I thank Ian and my crew for making me a better creative and I can't wait to for everyone to see what we have in store”Aaron Martin captures all of our aerial footage courtesy of his company, Vivid Northwest as our First AC/ Drone Operator. He adds, “This project is the PERFECT environment for me. As First AC, creating a technical efficiency (on and off camera) brings me pure bliss. When the weather permits, I'm the Drone Operator. Supplying emotion-driven aerial cinematography is my favorite way to showcase the beautiful earth we live on.A new perspective at the right time can open many doors to happiness”Ian is an accomplished model, actor, and musician, signed with multiple agencies nationwide. After releasing Cosmic Waltz in 2016, he has been an icon in the Austin fashion circuit.Jelliflow is armed with an apt and intelligent crew, each a master of their own craft. We have already conquered challenges along the way—everything from long hours to nasty weather to flesh wounds—but we have overcome them all as a team. Moving forward challenges will be more frequent, but even the exhaustion of making this world as vivid as it can be is worth it to each individual involved. Our purpose is to create great art, no matter the cost.Money isn’t the only form of support you can give! If you love what we’re doing and want to keep up, feel free to follow us on social media!Twitter: @jelliflowFacebook: fb.com/jelliflowInstagram: @jelliflowYoutube: Jelli GeyerYou can also show support for Jelliflow’s album Cosmic Waltz via jelliflow.bandcamp.com

story:
Who is "Blake"?
Hi, I am Blake Reynolds and I am a Christian Music artist, song writer, worship director, multi-instrumentalist! Currently residing in Cedar Springs, MI! Oh and I love dogs, so I bet we already have something in common. 

Thank you for your support by listening to my current music. No Other Name (Studio and Acoustic Version) and my other cover songs.

THE PROJECT
This project is more than just "another song", it is apart of the next chapter and a new step in my life. I have done music "seriously" for 12 years but have not been professionally pursuing it to make it my full-time gig until about 1 year ago. My heart is to write music that will reach people wherever they are at in life and that they would be changed by the power of Jesus,  whether they are just down after a stressful day or they are at the end of their rope, I want my music to reach them. I have had my own struggles in life, depression, hopelessness, and I know how much the right words, right person, the right music, the right message (God), etc can help a person with their struggles. I want to give that message to people through my music.

Being that I am an independent artist, I rely on my job and fundings from people like yourself to make projects like this happen. Ordinarily, I would save money or use "credit" but I am taking a new and huge step in life and want to keep my focus on the "writing/production" of the project, which is why I need people like you.

Why You SHOULD Fund My Project
This project is just the beginning but will make a huge difference in the lives of so many people across the world. Not all of us can be musicians, lyricists, actors, etc but everyone can make a difference. You being apart of my project will allow you that chance to make a difference in someone's life (lives) with the message that you are helping me to give. 

How YOU Can Help
As I had mentioned before,  this project is a huge deal and my goal is to reach thousands to millions of people with the music I produce/write, which you are taking apart of by giving towards this project. If you can't donate, you can help by sharing my campaign on Facebook or Instagram and asking your friends and family to donate. Use the social tools here on Indiegogo :)!! Make some noise about this project.

BUDGET: 

$2500- Littlebird Big Sound (production/recording/distribution)
$1000-Music Video+Travel+General expenses

Perks: 
There are perks varying from a handwritten thank you note, t-shirts, a cover song (of your choosing), oh and BEING in my music video!

OTHER PROJECTS I HAVE DONE
No Other Name (Original) 
No Other Name (acoustic cover of original)
Have Yourself A Merry Little Christmas
Reckless Love (not yet released)
He Is Yahweh (not yet released)

I am so excited that you are apart of this project/journey and I want thank you for donating and sharing.

Best Regards,
Blake Reynolds

story:
What's Up, Y'all!

For those of you I haven't had the pleasure of meeting, my name is Elijah Mann (but you can call me Eli). I'm a Boston-Grown/Austin-Based singer/songwriter. I graduated from Berklee College of Music two years ago, and since then have been making music in/around venues, living rooms, and busy street corners in cities across the country. I've been releasing daily covers on Instagram for about a year now, garnering praise from artists such as Luke Wade, Lakes of Canada, and Carly Rae Jepsen.

 

I'm about to embark on my next big project: My new EP, "The Flooding Season" and it's supporting tour!

The Details

This June, I will be going into the studio with producer/songwriter/all-around rock star Phlip Coggins to record a bunch of new songs for y'all. This album is centered on the feeling of change and transition, needing to belong somewhere, not just anywhere.

In support of this albums release in October, I will be teaming up with Bay Area folkster and fellow beanie enthusiast Hailie Hay to mount a month-long tour of the East Coast and Texas! We'll be hitting the road with a band full of my closest friends and favorite musicians, hitting up a city near you! Who knows, we may just be playing with your favorite band!

Like most things in this currency-based world of ours, it takes a bit of money to mount such a production. We're looking at somewhere around $12,000. That would pay for:

  • Booking The Studio
  • Hiring Musicians/Engineers
  • Distribution
  • The Tour Van
  • Gas
  • Food
  • Merchandise
 

And That, My Dear Friends, Is Where You Come In

For the next 30 days, I will be asking for your donations to fund this album and this tour. We'll be offering up CDs, buttons, posters, handwritten notes/lyrics, exclusive videos, invites to hang with all of us before or after gigs, and multiple opportunities to be personally serenaded by me in the living room/office/coffee shop/street corner/public restroom of your choice! If there's something you want that you don't see offered, hit me up! I'm ready to hook you up with great merch and incredible experiences.

Thank you all so much in advance for helping fund this project that is so near and dear to my heart. I cannot do this without you, and I cannot wait to get started. Let's have some FUN!

Elijah Mann

elijah-mann.com

story:
BEHIND THE CURTAIN....

   Guns. Drugs. Booze. Broads. Cheaters. Liars. Broken bones. Broken dreams. Dead thugs in black Caddy car trunks.  Fistfights on the corner. Prejudice. Bigotry. Misogyny.

   Oh, just a typical day in my hometown - Providence, RI - where working-class heroes STILL hi-five to Mob rule, the Catholic church and a good Italian meatball. 

      Who rescued me from the fate many friends met at the end of a bullet, a bottle, a pill?  Aretha, Sly, Tina, Teddy, Barbra, Stevie, Frank, Ray, Isaac, Bassey, The Isleys, Cream, Led Zeppelin, Rod Stewart, Neil Young, Hendrix, Joplin, Sarah,  Ella, James, Tower of Power, Earth Wind & Fire - their lives, their songs - my own personal Life Soundtrack! My secret I.V. tube, dripping  knowledge no adult could provide, pearls of wisdom that guided & calmed me, fired my imagination, & helped me rise above and get the hell out in one piece. 

   Out, from the fire to the frying pan. Pounding the gritty NYC streets, I fought TOOTH & NAIL for every gig, crumb and credit, while singing songs - theirs and mine - on sidewalks and in dark clubs. One VOICE of thousands, in the shadows, searching for meaning, truth, my sound, MY unique version of love & redemption.

   Then, a life flipper: a job slinging cocktails at NYC's Blue Note Jazz Club - an education no money could buy. Face to face with living legends - jazz icons who rose up through decades of social injustice to create JAZZ. More creative marination, incubation, trials by fire.

   Onwards from NYC to Canada. England. L.A.  I persevered. I pursued.  I forged 'The Dream' ...which led me to:

   NOW.  HERE.  WITH YOU.

   And about NOW??

   Well, birds fly. Presidents LIE. Bells RING, & SINGERS SING. 

   No one hears life the way I do.  That 's the way I sing it.

   I wake up with songs in my head. I am a human compilation disk, an amalgam of all styles of music I soaked up as a kid - pop/jazz/funk/soul - plus years of survival on Mother Earth. I NEED TO RECORD the MUSIC.

   SONGS & MUSIC saved ME. Maybe I can do the same for some lost someone?  

   In the here & now, I tilt forward, through the deluge, the onslaught, the competition, and in doing so, create MY OWN UNIQUE NICHE in an ever changing world! 

   Flanked by an amazing ensemble of stellar soldier musicians who vibe with my equal parts DRIVE, EMOTION, OBSESSION & PASSION, I stand on the shoulders of giants, ready to take it to the next level. 

I JUST NEED TO RECORD THE MUSIC.  ONCE FINISHED, WE TOUR JAPAN!!!

http://www.dyankanemusic.com

Here's a snippet of my latest high dive , the first single off THIS project:  

http://itunes.apple.com/us/album/i-cant-make-you-love-me-single/1442045325

HERE's WHERE YOU COME IN: 

What We Need & What You Get

  • I need $5000 (minimum) to complete this project.  Interplay Records handles the post production, packaging, and distribution.  That means I get to spend ALL of it on RECORDING & MUSICIAN fees, licensing and mixing SOUND. 
  • WHAT YOU GET:  Besides ETERNAL GRATITUDE and the PRIDE & THRILL of helping us PRODUCE a timeless wonder and a hard copy of the finished CD in your HAND and EARS, and other great PERKS: A HOT CANDLELIGHT BATH WITH ME!! Mp3 downloads! Candles!  Chocolate & Truffles!  Morning Coffee, Tea & ME!! An Italian Candlelight Dinner! Autographed photos and personalized sheet music!   A chance to meet the band and me at Capitol Records when we record (contingent on the success of this campaign)!  And of course, YOUR NAME inside the CD Cover! 
  • Bragging Rights!  You get to say "I helped make this CD, I helped her get to Japan!"
  •  

  • THE IMPACT

  • A CD of stories set to MUSIC that will live on long after you and I are gone.
  • TIMELESS: having NO BEGINNING and NO END. 
  • UNIQUE: having no LIKE or EQUAL. One of a kind. As in NO ONE sounds like me. 
  • SOUL CANDY: Raw, emotional vocals, and rhythmic, melodic SOUND, music for the WORLD's EARs and YOURS. I will pull you close, lean you in, groove you, flow through you, make love to your senses, HEAL YOU. THAT IS THE IMPACT I intend to HAVE on hearts & souls.  Covers, yes, but also ORIGINALS which reveal the secret, raw ME,  EXPOSED in BROAD DAYLIGHT.  I'm petrified to be so vulnerable.  I am exhilarated and ready to go there.
  •  

  • And just so you know...I have a lil experience at this..so you're in good hands...

  • My first CD, 'DYATRIBE', (Itunes, Amazon, Soundcloud) was totally self-produced. I did not have a management or PR team behind me, yet, we gained much traction on the national and international Pop/Jazz music & radio scene. DYATRIBE was picked up by Interplay Records (USA, Japan, EurAsia) & also distributed by Whole Foods Markets USA.  Featured on the CD was Grammy bassist Ryan Cross (Beyonce's 'Lemonade'), grammy drummer Lyndon Rochelle (Esperanza Spalding), as well as the genius of one of thee most gifted pianists on the scene today, ROBERT TURNER (Stevie Wonder, Alicia Keys).  (www.robertturnerpiano.com).  We covered an eclectic blend of songs including Radiohead's 'Pyramid Song', the Beatles 'Eleanor Rigby' & 'Come Together', Jobim's 'How Insensitive' & Miles Davis's 'All Blues' - all RE-arranged by myself & Robert Turner.  Aside, from selling many CD's at LIVE SHOWS in LA, I also saw incremental income from online streaming downloads.
  • Scott Yanow of the L.A. Jazz Scene Newspaper said of Dyatribe: " Continually intriguing ...with a top notch rhythm section...atmospheric modern jazz...inventive scatting..."  And James Janisse, the "Gentleman of Jazz" wrote "The musicianship is right in the pocket...and Dyan's phrasing is impeccable." 
  • Here's some buzz from fans: https://www.dyankanemusic.com/buzz
  • Yes, we have a few covers on the 2nd CD.  The newly completed first single "I Can't Make You Love Me" (Bonnie Raitt) which features a lush & velvety pop/jazz arrangement by yours truly, with Robert Turner's on the Motif, programming keys, guitar, bass, strings & drums;  flute by Louis Van Taylor (Ray Charles, Kool & the Gang), and percussion by Victor Orlando ('Outstanding' - Gap Band).  A FUNK'D UP arrangement of the classic 'CARAVAN'.  A soulful rendition of 'SOPHISTICATED LADY' (so sad). 
  • AND!!!  We will also record a few of my ORIGINALS: "Dial Rio for Me", is a sexy, wistful ballad where I beckon an old 'friend' who's between lovers to come by and knock da boots in that special way we used to do.  In another hip-hop flavored jazz tune "U Got Nothin' on Me", I tell my hit-man/lover to drop the action for one night, cut the lights, and 'show ya right'.  And with the lilting, waltzy, Monkish "Poppy's Back in Town", a young woman is enamored with an O.G. who stashes & crashes in the back of her crib after a bowl of his favorite 'black-eyed bean soup'!  I'm also so excited to record my latin-flavored treat that asks the Lord to make that man 'Please Stay', one that will have you up on the dance flo fo sho! The modal jazz underpinnings I like to use never alienate the listener, but instead, yield to a soulful pop-ness that appeals to all ears of all ages, without losing the connection to jazz music.
  • During the 8 weeks this campaign is up and running, we'll be busy rehearsing, so we'll be ready to roll into the studio on Day 1.  JOIN ME!  You don't want to miss this exciting adventure - to be in on this CD from the ground up.

Risks & Challenges

  • I cannot wait to finish this project & I will set a release date, but I warn you, I will be taking my time to get it RIGHT.  So if there's any delay in getting product to you, it will be for that reason only.  The devil is always in the details.  SOUND. THE MIX.  SOUND.  THE MIX.  SOUND. THE MIX...
  • If you make your donation, but we come up short of our $5000 goal. NO WORRIES.    There's many ways to record on a budget.  I know how to stretch a dollar to produce a quality project.  We may have to forfeit recording at Capitol, hire non-grammy  musicians, switch sound engineers, use my iphone instead of a LIVE videographer & photographer.  No sweat.  I WILL GET IT DONE. And you will receive all perks relative to your donation.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some peeps just can't contribute actual DOLLARS but want to be part of the moment.  Here's some other ways to help:

  • SPREAD THE LOVE.  Make some noise. SHARE THE NEWS!  Ask folks to get the word out about my campaign. SHARE IT ON SOCIAL MEDIA.
  • JOIN MY TEAM and fundraise WITH ME, FOR ME.
  • BECOME a MATCHING DONOR!  OR SUGGEST ONE!  Approach a CEO  or company, a local business, a store owner, a neighbor.  Ask if they'd like to MATCH whatever we raise to DOUBLE it!
  • FIND or BECOME a SECRET SPONSOR towards a portion of the goal!
  • Buy my CD DYATRIBE, and/or DOWNLOAD MY MUSIC - all at ITUNES!!
  • Don't trust fundraiser sites?  Paypal is always a good option.  Or a check in the mail is doable.  Venmo is another way to go.  Got a piggy-bank full of coins?  Works for me!  Good ole fashioned CASH in HAND will do, too. 
  • AND check out all the Indiegogo share tools! 
  • Your prayers, positivity, support, kind words: PRICELESS!

I cannot wait to finish this project & I will set a release date, but I warn you, I will be taking my time to get it RIGHT.  So if there's any delay in getting product to you, it will be for that reason only.  The devil is always in the details.  SOUND. THE MIX.  SOUND.  THE MIX.  SOUND. THE MIX...
If you make your donation, but we come up short of our $5000 goal. NO WORRIES.    There's many ways to record on a budget.  I know how to stretch a dollar to produce a quality project.  We may have to forfeit recording at Capitol, hire non-grammy  musicians, switch sound engineers, use my iphone instead of a LIVE videographer & photographer.  No sweat.  I WILL GET IT DONE. And you will receive all perks relative to your donation.


Other Ways You Can Help
Some peeps just can't contribute actual DOLLARS but want to be part of the moment.  Here's some other ways to help:

SPREAD THE LOVE.  Make some noise. SHARE THE NEWS!  Ask folks to get the word out about my campaign. SHARE IT ON SOCIAL MEDIA.
JOIN MY TEAM and fundraise WITH ME, FOR ME.
BECOME a MATCHING DONOR!  OR SUGGEST ONE!  Approach a CEO  or company, a local business, a store owner, a neighbor.  Ask if they'd like to MATCH whatever we raise to DOUBLE it!
FIND or BECOME a SECRET SPONSOR towards a portion of the goal!
Buy my CD DYATRIBE, and/or DOWNLOAD MY MUSIC - all at ITUNES!!
Don't trust fundraiser sites?  Paypal is always a good option.  Or a check in the mail is doable.  Venmo is another way to go.  Got a piggy-bank full of coins?  Works for me!  Good ole fashioned CASH in HAND will do, too. 
AND check out all the Indiegogo share tools! 
Your prayers, positivity, support, kind words: PRICELESS!

story:
I’m Jean-Paul De Roover, a solo musician based out of Thunder Bay. I’ve become known as a live-looping solo musician that frequently genre hops but over the last 6 years I’ve grown a lot, musically and personally. If you’d like to know more about what I’ve done in the past, visit jeanpaulderoover.com, otherwise I’m here to tell you about what it is I’m doing now.

Since my last full-length album “Complexity in Simplicity” (2013), I’ve been in a creative hibernation experimenting and exploring different aspects of my musical persona. Whereas in my earlier work I combined opposing themes in one album, my latest projects LOVE and LOSS, take the opportunity to really focus in on each theme in depth, exploring each side of a duality fully.

 

For the past 6 years I’ve been working on LOVE and LOSS, two sister albums that reflect the experiences I’ve had during that time period. Each album is a collection of songs exploring the title theme, complementing one another as they explore the hills and valleys of a shared human experience.

 

Lots has changed in my personal life over the past few years. We bought a house in 2014, got married two weeks later and then had our son in 2017. I started writing very positive songs as a personal challenge to myself because my music has often had a darker, melancholic lyrical style that just wasn’t matching up with what I was celebrating in my life. I got to work and wrote about 20 songs that touched on the theme of love in it’s many shapes and forms, focusing that down to the final 10 songs. Whether it’s a song based on our wedding vows (“My Heart and My Head”), or a proclamation that I’ll do anything for my son (“I’d Do Anything”), there’s a lot of family and friendship that comes together on the album. My wife Shannon Lepere sings a duet with me on “I Can’t Sleep”, and I have super talented friends sprinkled throughout the album. Musically it’s a singer/songwriter folk album with a tasteful blend of pop and rock.

    

Unfortunately, not everything is sunshine and rainbows. While I’ve been fortunate to not have had any devastating hardships over the past few years, many of you, my friends and my family have. Lyrically, the songs are about different types of losses that I’ve either experienced or have been very close to me. These include the loss of a close friendship (“Clench”), the closing of a friends’ recording studio (“Holes”), loss of sanity (“Wreck”), the divorce of my parents (“I Need”), and the tragic passing of some extended family (“There’s Been An Accident”). Musically this album falls somewhere between alternative/rock/progressive featuring some of your typical instruments (electric guitars, bass, drums) and vocals (everything from distorted metal screams to pristine choirs), but with additional instrumentation including harp, organ, electronics and orchestral arrangements for string and horn sections over the span of 12 tracks.

LOVE and LOSS were recorded and mixed at my studio Blueprints, and will be mastered by Jon Tornblom at Transparent Mastering.

 

LOVE and LOSS will be released separately both on CD and digital/streaming platforms throughout 2019, but they truly do belong together which is why I’ll also be releasing LOVE // LOSS – a limited run of double 12” vinyl records in a gatefold jacket. While vinyl is making a comeback, it still is incredibly expense to produce. Not only that, but I’m doing literally twice as much as most artists would do.

The purpose of this campaign is two-fold:

  1. To serve as a platform for preorders for both new records, as well as other fun perks.
  2. To help cover some of the costs of manufacturing the vinyl records. 

 

The album costs are just over $30,000. More invoices are coming in as I finish each phase of the project, going through the recording, mixing, mastering and manufacturing stages - some higher, some lower than the original budget. I'm very thankful to have received $14,000 from the Ontario Arts Council to put towards the project, but that still leaves me with more than half still to pay.

Here's a breakdown of the budget:

  • Artistic Fees (musicians): $3357
  • Creative Fees (photography, graphic design): $1,017
  • Technical Personnel (Producers, Engineers, Mixers, Assistants, Mastering): $22,852
  • Manufacturing (1000 CD’s Love, 1000 CD’s Loss): $3,000
  • Rental Fees (venues, equipment): $450

TOTAL = $30,676

 

Not included in that $30k price tag is the additional $6,000 needed in order to make 300 double vinyl records with a gatefold jacket. What I’m looking for is for your help to make the double vinyl release possible.

“So why isn’t your goal $6,000?”

Because again, the fact that I have to spend money to make things for my career (which is a business) shouldn’t be a burden placed on you, the listener. I’m looking to raise half ($3,000) in order to help offset some of the costs involved in manufacturing vinyl. The project goal is set to $3500 because of the taxes and fees that come with these types of projects and platforms. 

If we fall short: Not to worry! Your contributions will still go through and you’ll still collect your perks. It may just take a little longer.

If we exceed our goal: Wonderful! If we exceed the goal those extra dollars will go towards customizing the gatefold jacket, improving the fidelity and aesthetics of the vinyl itself.

 

There are a number of different items you can preorder to help be a part of this project. 

Pre-orders include Digital Downloads, CD's, Double Vinyl, T-Shirts and various combinations of those.

I've also added some non-tangible experiences like an outdoor BBQ at my home followed by a listening party in the studio, a private/house concert as well as other musical offerings such as being a guest on your next recording project, or giving you the full production treatment at my studio Blueprints.

For more details and pricing please check out the full list in the column to the right. 

There are also some items you won't find available for purchase, because I'm giving them to you:

  • All CD's and Vinyl will be signed unless otherwise specified. 
  • All contributors will be listed in the vinyl album liner notes, as well as given shoutouts on social media.
  • Contribute over $50 and you will then have a chance to be a part of the gang vocals to be featured on LOSS. This is open worldwide to contributors worldwide, as recordings of your voice can be done on even a cell phone. Instructions will follow after the campaign closes.
  • Contributions over $150 include a free copy of the double vinyl LOVE // LOSS.

 

LOVE will be released in May of 2019, while LOSS will be released later in the Fall. The delayed release is to give each record a chance to breathe on their own, followed by the double 12” vinyl release LOVE // LOSS in time for Christmas.

This campaign will close on May 15th, 2019, so that we have enough time to fulfill all of the perks and make sure that all of your names get included in the liner notes for the vinyl release. Some of the items may still be available to order past that deadline, but may have fewer perks (social media shoutouts, name in liner notes, etc). 

 

Getting these types of campaigns in front of eyeballs is always a challenge. If you can spare the time, please share this Indiegogo link on your social network(s) of choice.

Regardless, I want you to know that I truly love you all. Thanks for all of your patient support!

story:
John Zito Band consists of John Zito on lead guitar, harmonica and vocals, Barry Barnes on bass and vocals and Paul DiSibio on drums. Zito's slide and dobro guitars give the band its unique sound, with the virtuosity of Jimi Hendrix, the soul of Johnny Winter and the raw energy of the Sex Pistols. Pauly D's unique style brings a high energy persona to the band. Barnes funky, soulful bass playing holds down the foundation of the band. This killer combination seals the solid backbone of the trio and gives them a nostalgic 70’s vibe. They have a strong arsenal of John Zito originals and obscure 70’s cover songs.

The band has played locally and internationally, and has hosted local Blues and Rock nights. Currently they have a residence at Count’s Vamp’d called John Zito Electric Jam every Wednesday. The band has performed several times at the House of Blues, Hard Rock Hotel, Southpoint Hotel, Las Vegas Bikefest, charity events and festivals. You can expect over 100 hardcore fans at their shows. Their new cd Lonely, Broke and Wasted was recorded at Desert Moon Productions in Las Vegas, and is available at Zia Records and shows. John Zito has several prior cd’s in which his song "Rain" has been featured in the 9/11 documentary "Ride on Brother". John Zito, Barry Barnes and Paul DiSibio are also members of Shrapnel Records Count's 77 along with Danny "The Count" Koker, Stoney Curtis and Tommy Paris.

Joe Brown, of the Las Vegas Sun, refers to Zito as "A Las Vegas blues and rock hero". John Zito Band is also featured in a 3 page article in Guitar Club Magazine from Milan, Italy written by Maurizio DePaola: "The blues as their philosophy of life, Jimi Hendrix as a source of inspiration and the guitar as a means to express the soul: this is John Zito Band“.

story:
"Singles" 

"Singles" is my new full length album, a collection of songs previously released to the world as 'singles'. The album also contains three brand new songs, which I am totally stoked about! I've been very fortunate on this musical journey to have met some great people, all the fans, friends and mentors that I've encountered along the way that have been so encouraging and supportive, even in the times that were challenging. Throughout that inspired support,  somehow all these songs have either charted on Billboard both in Canada and the US, have been the recipients of music industry awards, or featured in films and television shows. This has all happened while I remain an independent artist, something I'm very proud of! And as my journey continues with this new album "Singles", I'd love to have your continued support to help me reach my goal with this cool Indiegogo campaign!  

Exclusive Content and Unique Items

I wanted to be able to provide my fans and supporters with the exclusive content and unique items that go hand-in-hand with a crowdfunding campaign backing an album. All Perks include a Digital Download of the album.

This is a way to preorder my latest CD and exclusive items you can only get through this campaign.

"Singles" is the compilation of songs I have been told by friends and fans have inspired them or touched their hearts. In addition to the songs I have selected from past albums, there are new songs that have sprung from recent collaborations with friends whose work inspires me.

"Freaks Me Out" is a co-write with my dear friend Dale Effren. We had a lot of fun creating this dynamic, catchy tune and the accompanying music video. "Freaks Me Out" will be the lead single from this new album and the music video will premiere on the album release date, June 22, 2018.

"Desert Moon" is a co-write with songwriter, producer, and multi-instrumentalist Rob Bonfiglio. Rob is the lead guitarist in my band and a great friend.

"Eternal Life" is the product of a new project called Immortelle with the lovely and talented Suzie Jagger-Richards. This is a cool rock track with a dark ethereal feel, very cinematic. 

A complete remake and remix of one of the first songs I have ever written, "One More Chance" is also included, a collaboration with my good friend and super talented producer/musician Chris Iannetti.

Perks

So much cool stuff is available through this campaign. Of course, you can get the CD (signed or still in the wrapper) and everyone gets the download, but you can also get:

  • Jon Mullane CD Bundle - All 4 of my solo CDs: The Source (2006), Shift (2010), SHINE (2016) and Singles (2018) - What is it with me and the letter "S"?
  • Jon Mullane Poster
  • Jon Mullane Fan Pack - All 4 of my solo CDs, Jon Mullane poster, Jon Mullane "Shift" poster, SHINE Download Card, and a Very Rare "My New American Girl" Radio Single CD. Only 3 of these packs are available due to the limited quantities of the radio single CD.
  • Your name on the CD jacket for "Singles" - this item must be ordered by June 8 to allow for fulfillment of CD orders
  • Special Offer!  Suzie Jagger Richards Mirror Tour limited edition 12x12 full color 2019 Calender
  • Signed Handwritten Lyric Sheet - You pick the song from "Singles" or any of my previous projects. I will write out and sign a lyric sheet on high-quality paper, suitable for framing.
  • Songwriting Consultation - I am often asked for my opinion or advice on lyrics and melodies of songs. Here is an opportunity to chat with me over Skype about your song and the songwriting process.
  • Q & A and 2 song performances - A private concert just for you over Skype, with an opportunity to chat with me and ask those burning questions...
  • Teisco DM-1 Microphone on Stand - Used in the filming of my award-winning video for "Born Beautiful", this vintage 60s-era rockabilly microphone is a unique collector's item. If "Born Beautiful" is your fave Jon Mullane tune, this is the perk for you!
  • House Concerts featuring Jon Mullane with Suzie Jagger-Richards - This all comes down to where your house is located. If you live within 250 miles of New Orleans (my current home town), we will drive to your home and provide a 1 hour house concert and another hour of meet and greet with your guests. If you live outside that radius, but within the continental US or Canada, we will negotiate some travel expenses with you and fly to your home. You still get the 1 hour concert and another hour of meet and greet, but we will also need somewhere to stay the night (You will cover flight expenses and provide us with a room in your home or a local hotel, as well as dinner that evening and breakfast the next day). Either way, we will come to you and fill your house with music for your friends, from whom you can collect donations to cover your expenses.

Track Listing

  • Freaks Me Out (new)
  • Desert Moon (new)
  • Make You Move (Shift)
  • The One That Got Away (Shift)
  • Born Beautiful (SHINE)
  • My New American Girl (SHINE)
  • Any Other Way (SHINE)
  • Change Your Life (Shift)
  • Go The Distance (The Source)
  • Got It Goin' On (Shift)
  • Body Rock (SHINE)
  • One More Chance (Remix and Remastered track from The Source)
  • Bonus Track: Eternal Life by Immortelle

Key Tracks

Track 1 - Freaks Me Out - The first release from the album, a super catchy and fun three-minute blast of pure pop and rock, with hooks to match. Co-written with noted South African songwriter Dale Effren, this lead single, and its accompanying music video, are ripe for the airwaves for Spring/Summer 2018. Producers: Creighton Doane & Jon Mullane. 

Track 2 - Desert Moon - With its rootsy edge and smooth blend of pop and rock, Desert Moon was co-written with Los Angeles songwriter/producer Rob Bonfiglio, guitarist and musical director for Wilson Phillips, and features a mega chorus that you can't get out of your head. Producer: Rob Bonfiglio 

Track 3 - Make You Move - With its infectious and edgy rock groove, Make You Move charted on the Rock Hot AC, Top 40 Billboard charts in Canada, while being featured on NBC Olympic Promo commercials, NHL Hockey Games and other major sporting events. Producer: Creighton Doane 

Track 4 - The One That Got Away - Combining a killer melodic hook, heartfelt lyrics and a timeless theme, The One That Got Away is a charted Top 40 AC Billboard hit in Canada and continues to play extensively on stations throughout North America. The song has been featured in numerous television shows airing on CBS, ABC, MTV, and Global among others. Producer: Creighton Doane 

Track 5 - Born Beautiful - This powerful epic song has made a big emotional connection with listeners, with its anti-suicide message of self-empowerment and hope. In addition to extensive radio airplay both on commercial radio stations and Sirius XM and charting on the Mediabase AC Chart in Canada, the music video has won four awards including a Hollywood Music in Media Award. Producer: Creighton Doane 

Track 6 – My New American Girl - A fun, playful, super-catchy pop song that broke into the top 40 at #32 on the Billboard Hot AC Indicator chart in the US. The song was also featured on The Young & The Restless on CBS. Producer: Creighton Doane 

Track 12 – One More Chance - One of the first songs I had ever written, One More Chance was his very first radio single that was spun at numerous stations coast-to-coast across Canada. Back now with a remake and new remix, this timeless emotional ballad is a fan favorite. Producer: Chris Iannetti

Desert Moon (new)
Make You Move (Shift)
The One That Got Away (Shift)
Born Beautiful (SHINE)
My New American Girl (SHINE)
Any Other Way (SHINE)
Change Your Life (Shift)
Go The Distance (The Source)
Got It Goin' On (Shift)
Body Rock (SHINE)
One More Chance (Remix and Remastered track from The Source)

Bonus Track: Eternal Life by Immortelle


Key Tracks
Track 1 - Freaks Me Out - The first release from the album, a super catchy and fun three-minute blast of pure pop and rock, with hooks to match. Co-written with noted South African songwriter Dale Effren, this lead single, and its accompanying music video, are ripe for the airwaves for Spring/Summer 2018. Producers: Creighton Doane & Jon Mullane. 
Track 2 - Desert Moon - With its rootsy edge and smooth blend of pop and rock, Desert Moon was co-written with Los Angeles songwriter/producer Rob Bonfiglio, guitarist and musical director for Wilson Phillips, and features a mega chorus that you can't get out of your head. Producer: Rob Bonfiglio 
Track 3 - Make You Move - With its infectious and edgy rock groove, Make You Move charted on the Rock Hot AC, Top 40 Billboard charts in Canada, while being featured on NBC Olympic Promo commercials, NHL Hockey Games and other major sporting events. Producer: Creighton Doane 
Track 4 - The One That Got Away - Combining a killer melodic hook, heartfelt lyrics and a timeless theme, The One That Got Away is a charted Top 40 AC Billboard hit in Canada and continues to play extensively on stations throughout North America. The song has been featured in numerous television shows airing on CBS, ABC, MTV, and Global among others. Producer: Creighton Doane 
Track 5 - Born Beautiful - This powerful epic song has made a big emotional connection with listeners, with its anti-suicide message of self-empowerment and hope. In addition to extensive radio airplay both on commercial radio stations and Sirius XM and charting on the Mediabase AC Chart in Canada, the music video has won four awards including a Hollywood Music in Media Award. Producer: Creighton Doane 
Track 6 – My New American Girl - A fun, playful, super-catchy pop song that broke into the top 40 at #32 on the Billboard Hot AC Indicator chart in the US. The song was also featured on The Young & The Restless on CBS. Producer: Creighton Doane 
Track 12 – One More Chance - One of the first songs I had ever written, One More Chance was his very first radio single that was spun at numerous stations coast-to-coast across Canada. Back now with a remake and new remix, this timeless emotional ballad is a fan favorite. Producer: Chris Iannetti

story:
Bonjour, je m’appelle Christine et je représente le groupe musical sherbrookois, Fragile Fantôme.

Fragile Fantôme c’est un groupe qui a débuté à l’été 2016 à partir d’une association entre l’auteure, Mélanie Noël, le musicien, Charles-Emmanuel L’Espérance et moi-même.  Par la suite, nous avons intégré le claviériste, Andy Bourgeois et le batteur, Antoine Pomerleau Anctil pour nous accompagner lors de nos spectacles.  Depuis, ils font partie à part entière de ce projet. 

Fragile Fantôme c’est un groupe de musique originale où nous mélangeons différentes sonorités empruntées à la musique pop, électronique et rock.  Depuis l’été 2016, nous avons donné de nombreux spectacles dans lesquels nous avons ouvert  pour plusieurs groupes et artistes émergeants. Aussi, nous avons eu la chance d’assurer la première partie de l’artiste, Yann Perreau lors de son dernier passage au théâtre Granada au mois d’octobre 2016.  Au printemps dernier, nous avons gagné une bourse de 60h de studio.  Nous avons alors  entamé le processus d’enregistrement d’un mini album aussi appelé, EP, chez Replix Studio.  Présentement,  nous en sommes aux derniers moments d’enregistrement avant d’envoyer notre travail au mixage.

C’est à ce moment que nous faisons appel à votre soutien financier pour nous aider à terminer la production de ce mini album de 6 chansons.  Les sous amassés serviront à payer le temps et l’ingénieur pour le mixage et le matriçage, l’impression de la pochette, ainsi que la distribution sur toutes les plateformes web telles que Spotify, Google Play, itunes et apple music.  Aussi, votre aide soutiendra tout ce qui concerne la promotion de ce mini album.

La production d’un mini album c’est une étape importante dans la vie d’un groupe émergent.  Elle lui permet de créer de nouveaux contacts dans l’industrie musicale et le milieu artistique.  Ce EP va être envoyé dans les stations de radios à des fins de diffusion.  Il va aussi nous servir de carte de visite pour soumettre notre musique à d’autres groupes et artistes afin de créer de nouvelles collaborations.  De plus, il nous permettra de postuler à différents comités de sélection de festivals et de concours afin de faire partie de leur prochaine programmation.

Chaque personne ayant offert un don de 10$ ou plus, revevra un album qui lui sera remis le soir du lancement ou envoyé par la poste les jours suivant sa sortie.

Nous comptons réellement sur votre appui pour nous permettre de terminer la production de ce mini album et d’assurer la continuité de notre groupe qui est Fragile Fantôme.

story:
This October we will be celebrating 10 years of Mama's Black Sheep!!! To commemorate this special anniversary we want to release an all new Holiday CD just in time for the Season. We plan to go back into studio at the end of August and we are hoping for your support to help make this new album possible.

This Holiday themed CD (title yet unknown) will feature some traditional Holiday favorites with a "Sheep" spin as well as a few new original songs. We'll be joined in the studio by some of our favorite musical collaborators including Christine Havrilla, Helen Hausmann and more!

Creating any new release is always an expensive and time consuming venture. We are hoping to raise enough funds in advance to cover our recording and production costs, and every dollar helps. Please become a contributor today and help us turn our vision into reality!

story:
Short Summary
My name is Liam Rogers. I'm 19 years old from Lake Orion, Michigan.

I'm not the greatest at talking about myself. But my work speaks for me.

I make music that I believe to be universally healing to all. It's unique and yet strangely familiar. It speaks truth. I've released several projects already on platforms such as iTunes, Spotify and Google Play, but I am a full time student and have no time apart from the hours I currently work.

I am not one to ask for handouts, it takes a lot for me to request any financial assistance. But my work is something I know truly helps people, and I want to continue doing so.

What We Need & What You Get
I need approximately $10,000.

This not only covers studio time, but equipment I would need to keep creating music away from the studio for future projects.

Over the last year, I have been converting a short bus into a totally self sustainable home for myself. It is equipped with 2 beds, sink, toilet, eating space and electricity powered by solar panels. Thus why this third album will be appropriately titled "From a Bus". I plan on dedicating that space as a traveling studio. I am a free spirited individual, I am attending film school to pursue my love for motion pictures, and I currently have 2 EPs and 2 Singles available on all streaming platforms.

PERKS FOR DONATING INCLUDE:

Donations of $25 or more will receive a signed "Spectrums, Vol. 1" CD completely free via postal service.

Donations of $50 or more will receive a signed "Spectrums, Vol. 1" & "Spectrums, Vol. 2" CD via postal service, completely free with a limited edition album sticker.

Donations of $100 or more will receive a signed "Spectrums, Vol. 1", "Spectrums, Vol. 2", & "From a Bus" CD via postal service, and 2 limited edition album stickers (if goal for funding has been met)

Donations of $500 or more will receive all that has been offered below, plus I will personally write and create a song about anything, or anybody of your choosing and send it to you once I have raised the money for equipment. It will be good, it will be carefully thought out and well done, or your money back. 

Donations of $1000 or more will receive everything below, plus I will create another song about anything or anyone of your choosing (once funding goal is met)

Donations of $5000 or more will receive all of what has been offered below, plus I will personally call you and arrange a bus trip for myself and a surprise guest to come to your area (within the continental United States) and have you on a video talk show inside the bus for YouTube. We'll make music, talk about life, get some good food. Whatever you'd like!

The Impact
Again, my music speaks for itself. I promise if you listen to my projects in order, at least one song will seriously move you in ways no other current music ever could, you have my word. I believe in good, I believe in universal love, and following not only what you love doing in this world with your heart, but planning it out thoroughly with your mind. As much as I'd love to say its a dreamer's game, you need to know how to properly nurture your future in something once you start it. That is music for me. I love connecting to others in ways I could never otherwise, it provides a purpose for me when others feel heard and understood through my songs. I only desire to continue that and having the ability to support myself and my people while doing so.

Risks & Challenges

We've all had monumental darkness in our lives. My story is no different. I simply wish to convert that darkness into light for others. Music is my outlet. Instead of explaining it all here, my email is LCR55.Mail@gmail.com. If you feel you need to know more about me and my objectives, we can setup a phone call within the same week or so you email me. 

Other Ways You Can Help
If you can't donate that is totally ok! I'm a man of hard work. Just because I am asking for help does not mean I am sitting somewhere lounging. I go to school full time, and all other time is spent working for funding towards my goals. 

Spread my music if you can!

Located on iTunes, Spotify, Google Play & all other streaming platforms:

Liam Rogers

- "Spectrums, Vol. 1" (6 track EP)

- "Spectrums, Vol. 2" (6 track EP)

- "Blossom (feat. Tavione)" - Single

- "Feel Again (feat. Tavione & Dunn)" - Single
