story:
Short Summary

Melodic rock band, Stage 11 blends Singer/Songwriter sensibilities with dynamic alternative rock energy. The band was formed in LA as an acoustic trio in 2009 by Diego Garcia (singer/guitarist), Dusty Arth (guitarist), and Evan Michael Hart (drummer/percussionist/singer). Joined by Billy Ray Dyer on bass in 2011 and by Matthew Fennelly on lead guitar in 2013. 

This campaign is designed to help us finish our first professionally produced record with our full, 5 piece, line-up. The EP "Moments Like These" which we've been tirelessly working on over the last few months. Never before have we been able to achieve the high production value that we are already hearing from this time around in the studio. This is due to the high caliber producer and engineer that we have been fortunate enough to be working with.

This is huge for us because it gives us the chance to share with the world music that we're proud of. It gives you the opportunity to be part of our story by pre-ordering your own copy of "Moments Like These" along with receiving some other unique perks.​

Follow this link to listen to the singles "Broken" and "Open Water" and get an idea of what we're so excited about. https://soundcloud.com/stage11/sets/brokenopen-water/s-tHSJl

If you're interested, here's a look all the way back to 2011 and one of our first radio interviews:

 

What We Need & What You Get

We have already spent thousands of dollars of our own money earned from gigging around town and working overtime at our respective jobs to pay for this record but, when you work with such an awesome production team (who are worth every penny), sometimes it takes a village.

To give you an idea of where your money will be going, here is a list of everything it takes to undertake a project like this:

  • Producer Fee - $1,500
  • Mixing & Engineering - $3,500
  • Mastering - $700
  • Studio Time - $720
  • Artwork - $1,000
  • Manufacturing - $2,200
  • Merchandise - $1,500

Perks included in this campaign start at the $5 mark with a social media shoutout where we will thank you by name on our weekly Facebook live video series "Back of the Bus" and list your name on our website. Each level above that will include the previous level's perks with few exceptions.*

  • $10 - Digital download of the completed EP
  • $25 - Signed physical copy of the completed EP
  • $50 - Handwritten lyrics to one of the 6 songs on the album
  • $60 - 11"x17" Limited Edition signed and numbered block prints of the album cover art. Letter press printed by Angelina LaPointe.  [10 available]*
  • $75 - Diego records the outgoing message on your voicemail
  • $100 - Diego & Dusty perform a song over the phone + early access to the EP and T-shirt
  • $200 - Skype guitar or drum lesson
  • $400 - Personal online 30 minute concert
  • $1.000 - Special thanks by name on the album
  • $5,000 - Acoustic living room session (within 250 miles of Los Angeles)
  • $11,111 - Full Band Backyard Concert

In the event we don't reach our goal, any funds raised will go to paying our producer, engineer, and graphic artist who have already put in a ton of work on this project.

The Impact

Music is a big part of the human experience. With so many permutations you could say it is the world's most accessible art form. As long as people are around music will be there and new music will continue to be created. We are one of many indie acts who just want to make our brand of music part of the tapestry. As a contributor to our project you will help further the progress of music and take ownership in its history. If you have been with us from the beginning we thank you for the support and we are excited to give you the album you've been waiting for. 

Risks & Challenges

As an artist, there are never any guarantees of fame and fortune, no matter how much you put into your work. But if you're proud of the result, that makes it worth the effort.

There is always the possibility of unexpected production costs but we are bound and determined to get this record finished.

Other Ways You Can Help

Want to help but can't contribute financially? Share this campaign with as many people as you can. Indiegogo has some pretty convenient share tools for just that reason. Beyond that, you can even call radio stations and request our music. Any way you can spread the word is greatly appreciated.

story:
JAZZ FOLK

I have long had a keen interest in folk music because of the raw emotion in it. I love listening to field recordings from around the world. Jazz is also a music I love because of the freedom of expression through improvisation that it gives me. I create music that mixes elements of both genres. 

One of my tunes is called, “Sea Shanty” in which I utilize the melody of the traditional sea shanty, “What Shall We Do with the Drunken Sailor?” while adding my own melodic and harmonic content. I take inspiration from composer Aaron Copland, who quoted cowboy songs in his work, “Billy the Kid” and the old Shaker song, “Simple Gifts” in his work, “Appalachian Spring.” I employ a similar method as Copland, but in a Jazz rather than Orchestral setting. Another of my original compositions is titled, “Baby Babble.” The song developed out of actual nonsense syllables that I heard a baby utter. You can listen to a sextet arrangement of it at the link below. It begins around 26:48.

 http://www.wbgo.org/blog/wbgo-jam-2016-juilliard-jazz-ensemble-a

You can also hear a big band version of my tune, "Sea Shanty" at the following link:

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=IZikd6zcLkY

 

 

How Funds May Be Used

Your donation could contribute to any of the following areas:

  • Recording, mixing, mastering, manufacturing multiple copies, distributing, and promoting the album .
  • Paying the musicians for their time of rehearsing and recording for the album and for the YouTube videos, if applicable. There will likely be a guest appearance on the album by a very well known musician on the Jazz scene. Funds may also be used to pay him.
  • Album artwork
  • Registering copyrights of original music and/or arrangements
  • Food for the musicians at the recording session
  • Paying licensing fees for any arrangements (i.e. I have an arrangement of Billy Strayhorn's, "A Flower is a Lovesome Thing" that I plan to put on the album)
  • Radio and/or press promotion (i.e. mailing CDs to radio stations)

I plan to spend close to $5,000 to complete this project, but I am seeking other sources of funding in addition to this campaign. Any amount you give can help me to make this project better.

This campaign is scheduled to end on December 11, 2016. Thank you for your support!

Paying licensing fees for any arrangements (i.e. I have an arrangement of Billy Strayhorn's, "A Flower is a Lovesome Thing" that I plan to put on the album)
Radio and/or press promotion (i.e. mailing CDs to radio stations)

I plan to spend close to $5,000 to complete this project, but I am seeking other sources of funding in addition to this campaign. Any amount you give can help me to make this project better.
This campaign is scheduled to end on December 11, 2016. Thank you for your support!

story:
¿Quiénes somos?

Juliana Reinat Piano Studio inició en el año 2009, aunque se creó oficialmente en el 2014 por Juliana Reina Téllez, egresada de Composición de la Pontificia Universidad Javeriana. Nuestro propósito es llevar a un nivel superior la pedagogía del piano y acercar la música clásica a niños y jóvenes. Más de 70 niños han iniciado su trayectoria musical en nuestro estudio y actualmente 50 niños (desde los 3 hasta los 17 años de edad) hacen parte de éste.

¿Qué es el Concierto de Piano y Orquesta 2016?

Desde hace cuatro años tomamos la decisión de crear un proyecto en donde los niños tuvieran la oportunidad de tocar con una orquesta profesional. Aunque al principio parecía una locura, a la fecha hemos realizado tres conciertos en distintos auditorios de Bogotá. El crecimiento personal y musical ha sido maravilloso. Incluso, varios pedagogos y compositores internacionales se han asombrado con el proyecto, a tal punto que en Junio de 2015 tuvimos la fortuna y el honor de estrenar mundialmente dos conciertos de piano y orquesta, compuestos por el compositor y pianista ruso-ucraniano Alexander Peskanov.

 

Pedagogas como Irina Gorin, creadora del método de piano “Tales of a Musical Journey” y directora de Gorin Piano Studio en Indianápolis, Estados Unidos e Irina Mints, directora y fundadora de la Klavier Musikschule Minz en Friedberg, Alemania quedaron maravilladas con el proyecto. Estos son algunos de los comentarios que recibimos durante el concierto pasado:

“Quiero expresar mis mejores deseos a todos los estudiantes que se presentarán hoy. Estoy muy feliz y emocionada al saber que algunos interpretarán “Cuentos de un Viaje Musical” con orquesta - ¡es una gran oportunidad! Son muy afortunados al tener una profesora como Juliana Reina. Espero muy pronto poder ver el concierto en persona. Mi mejor energía para este importante acontecimiento”.

Irina Gorin - Pianista y pedagoga rusa, creadora del método “Cuentos de un Viaje Musical”

“¡Me siento honrado y conmovido por el hecho de que mi música sea estrenada en la maravillosa ciudad de Bogotá, Colombia! Aprecio inmensamente el trabajo de Juliana Reina Téllez, de sus estupendos estudiantes, del Maestro Camilo Rojas Vallejo y de los miembros de la orquesta. Mis composiciones son las reflexiones de mi vida. Quise ser compositor, luego de que mi primera profesora de piano, Rosalia Molodietzkaya me dijera que los grandes compositores son inmortales y que cada vez que interpreto su música los traigo de vuelta a este mundo. Así pues, ¡estoy seguro de que estaré presente en espíritu cuando mi música sea interpretada en Bogotá!”

Alexander Peskanov - Pianista y compositor ruso-ucraniano

 

Por esta razón, este año quisiéramos ampliar el panorama y realizar un concierto más ambicioso y con mayores retos musicales, artísticos y logísticos. Queremos realizar el concierto en el Auditorio Fabio Lozano, uno de los auditorios más importantes de Bogotá. El cual, con un aforo de casi 600 personas y una acústica ideal, se convierte en un escenario de ensueño para todo nuestro equipo. 

¿Cómo nos puedes ayudar?

Lograr llevar a cabo un proyecto tan ambicioso, requiere de muchos elementos, los cuales llevan a distintos gastos: auditorio, orquesta, programas de mano, publicidad, orquestación de las obras, edición e impresión de partituras, entre otros.

Nuestra meta es recaudar $4,500 dólares los cuales utilizaríamos para:

  • Pago de los músicos de la orquesta
  • Alquiler de percusión sinfónica para el concierto
  • Grabación y edición del video del concierto

Tu apoyo es fundamental para lograr emprender esta gran travesía. Queremos seguir soñando en grande y demostrar que sí es posible hacer música profesional con niños y jóvenes, los cuales son el futuro y la identidad de nuestro país. 

 

También puedes unirte compartiendo esta campaña a través de redes sociales y con todas las personas que conozcas y creas que se puedan interesar en apoyar esta iniciativa.

¡Muchas gracias!

 

---

 

About us

Juliana Reinat Piano Studio began in 2009, although it was officially created in 2014 by Juliana Reina Tellez, a  Composition graduate from Javeriana University. Our purpose is to bring piano pedagogy to a higher level and bring classical music to children and youth. More than 70 children have started their musical career in our studio and currently 50 children (from 3 to 17 years old) are part of it.

What is the Piano and Orchestra Concert 2016?

Four years ago we decided to create a project where children would have the opportunity to play with a professional orchestra. Although at first it seemed lunacy, to date we have had three concerts in different auditoriums in Bogota. The personal and musical growth has been wonderful. Even several educationists and international composers have been impressed with the project, to the point that in June 2015 we had the fortune and honor to premiere in the world, two concerts of piano and orchestra, composed by the Russian-Ukrainian composer and pianist, Alexander Peskanov.

Pedagogues as Irina Gorin, creator of the piano method "Tales of a Musical Journey" and director of Gorin Piano Studio in Indianapolis, United States and Irina Mints, director and founder of the Klavier Musikschule Minz in Friedberg, Germany were amazed with the project. These are some of the comments we received during the last concert:

"I would like to express my best wishes to all students who will perform today. I am very happy and excited to learn that some of them will perform "Tales of a Musical Journey" with orchestra - it's a great opportunity! They are very fortunate to have a teacher like Juliana Reina. I hope to see the concert in person soon. My best energy for this important event. "

Irina Gorin - Russian pianist and pedagogue, creator of the "Tales of a Musical Journey" method

"I am honored and touched by the fact that my music is premiered in the wonderful city of Bogota, Colombia! I greatly appreciate the work of Juliana Reina Tellez, her great students, Master Camilo Rojas Vallejo and members of the orchestra. My compositions are reflections of my life.  I wanted to be a composer, after my first piano teacher, Rosalia Molodietzkaya told me that the great composers are immortal and that every time I play their music I bring them back to this world. So, I'm sure I will be present in spirit when my music is performed in Bogota! "

Alexander Peskanov - Russian-Ukrainian pianist and composer

For this reason, this year we would like to expand the landscape and undertake a more ambitious concert with greater musical, artistic and logistical challenges. We want to hold the concert in the Fabio Lozano Auditorium, one of the largest auditoriums in Bogota. With a capacity of almost 600 people and ideal acoustics, it becomes a dream scenario for all our team. 

 

How can you help us?

Achieving such an ambitious project requires many elements which lead to different costs: auditorium, orchestra, handbills, advertising, orchestration of works, editing and printing of scores, among others.

Our goal is to raise US$4,500 which we would use to:

  • Payment of orchestra musicians
  • Symphony percussion rentals for the concert
  • Recording and editing video of the concert

 

Your support is critical to undertake this great journey. We want to keep dreaming big and prove  that it is possible to make professional music with children and young people, who are the future and identity of our country. 

You can also support us by sharing this campaign through social networks and with everyone you know and think may be interested in supporting this initiative.

Thank you very much!

story:
About this project

Hello everybody! My name is Jake (a.k.a. Zer0 Gravity) and I'm a rapper. I've been rapping for quite a long time now, and I put out my first album in the summer of 2016. As proud as I was of my album, there was something that seemed off about it; the beats weren't high-quality and it was poorly mixed and mastered (by me).

I'm currently in the process of making my sophomore (second) album, titled "707", named after the dorm room I live in at college. My goal here is to make an album that truly sounds good; something that actually fits in with the music that I hear on the radio.

Here is the potential album art for my album "707"

This album will be free! It will be on streaming services like Spotify and Apple Music, but will also be free on platforms like Soundcloud and Bandcamp.

Phase 1

This is a project that will be done in phases. The first phase will go towards buying instrumentals. Phase 2 will be focused on the mixing/mastering aspect of my album. Because mixing/mastering is further down the line, I decided to split my project up into two phases. If I can get past the first phase, I will actually be able to get to work on my album, and when the time comes I will start phase 2.

Why Me?

Great question. Why would you throw your hard-earned dollars at some internet rapper that sounds like everybody else? Well, the answer to that is simple.

I don't sound like everybody else. 

This song below is about how I am who I am except for the part where I say "R.I.P Zer0 Gravity". I was gonna change my rap name but I was convinced not to, so just ignore that.

https://soundcloud.com/zer0gravityrap/i-am

When I started making music, it was my goal to stick out. I have never wanted to conform to the industry standards of rap, with content covering money, women, and drugs. In fact, I have barely talked about any of those topics. On my last album, I talked about my own anxiety, global issues, my life in general, and other things. I plan to continue this trend on my next album. In fact, I've already written many of the lyrics for it and I can say with confidence that I have not strayed from my original tone. However, the way the album sounds will be completely different.

What's Special About My Album?

So many great questions.

Rap is a very saturated industry comprised of dark songs. It's filled with explicit references towards loads of bad things that I'm not a huge fan of talking about. The beats all sound the same too! So many standard trap beats (lots of hi-hats, heavy bass, 808's, synthesizers, etc.) dominate the airwaves nowadays, and I've gotten a little bit weary of all of it. My favorite kind of rap is something that I'm cheesily going to call "Happy Rap". This is a kind of rap music that makes you smile, that makes you feel good. I want to make this music. 

I've been inspired by people like Chance the Rapper and the younger Kanye West to use beats that often utilize samples (usually soul samples) from other songs to create songs that not only sound unique but also make the listener feel good. All I've ever wanted to do was help people in some way or another. Fun fact, if rap doesn't work out, chances are I'll become a therapist so I can do just that.

Why Do I Need Funding?

I don't have much money. I'm a college kid and I spent my summer working at a summer camp. I did what I could, but I'll be honest, I would not suggest working at a summer camp if you're trying to make a lot of money. In order to make an album that actually sounds good, I need two things; beats and mixing/mastering. The mixing/mastering will be taken care of at a later date during a phase 2 campaign. Phase 1 (This phase) will be focused on attaining beats.

I will be purchasing beats from multiple sources. I have found many beats that have piqued my interest, but these beats cost money. When buying beats, the producer gives the buyer (me) multiple options for what level I want to purchase.

This is an example of the options

The first and the cheapest would be to get mp3 files of the beats. These files are not of the highest quality and are not good enough for a high-end album. The next option is the wav file, which is what I will end up actually using. Wav files themselves are not too expensive, but the story doesn't end there. I will also need to purchase the trackouts of each beat.

What is a Trackout?

Let's say you made a song. Your song would have different instruments, maybe a piano, a violin, some drums, and of course, your voice. Each of these instruments will have its own track. 

Example of multiple tracks

These tracks can be individually manipulated in order to make the final mix of your song sound perfect. For example, if your voice sounds too bassy, then it could be possible to chop out some of the bass aspects of your voice. If your violin has really high pitched squealing sounds when the bow moves across the strings, you can cut out the "high-end" to get rid of these sounds. How does this relate to trackouts?

If all that I had from a beat that I purchased was the beat itself, I would not be able to individually alter the instruments. I would not be able to send the song to a company to get it properly mixed. With trackouts, the mixing company will be able to incorporate my voice within the beat as opposed to having to layer my voice over the beat. This may sound kinda weird, but trust me it makes a difference. So, in order to make an album with the quality I want, I need to get trackouts.

Funding Pt. 2

I do not plan on getting the exclusive rights to the beats because, honestly, I would love to hear what other people make over the beats that I use. Also, exclusive rights for beats ranges from low-end prices to way too high (like, in the thousands). The price of unlimited distribution beats with trackouts really varies, so I gave myself $1500 to fund the beats. I would estimate that, on average, the price of the beats I would be getting would be around $75 each. I will not even be getting the full $1500 because of Indiegogo fees. If there is money left over, I will use it to begin funding for Phase 2.

Logo

Zer0 Gravity Logo

For those of you who gave enough to get some Zer0 Gravity merch, here's the logo!

Thank You!!

You have no idea how much this means to me. It's been my dream to make a rap album that I can truly be proud of, and with your help, I think that I may be able to accomplish that. I really want to make an album that stands out from the rest of rap, and with the funding I attain I really think that it's a possibility. The music industry has become a very strange place, and it has also become oversaturated with artists trying to break through and get noticed. The issue is, many of these rappers have the same sound and use the same types of beats. With the unique sound I'll have, there is a chance that I may actually be able to break through. If that happens, I will always remember the people that helped make that happen. And maybe I'll get you some VIP passes if I ever tour :)

Thanks again!

Jake (a.k.a. Zer0 Gravity)

My Past Work

Here are some of the songs/projects I have done prior to this album. I hope you enjoy!

GONE

This is my freshman album. It's free to download and I have included some of the tracks below. Click on the link below to be taken to my Bandcamp page with my full album on it. Take a listen!

https://zer0gravityrap.bandcamp.com/releases

Baseball Money

This was a song that my brother and I wrote and recorded a long time ago. Just an example of having fun with music!

 

Summertime

This was the last song on my first album "GONE". It's a song I wrote to commemorate my youth as well as the friends that I had made throughout my childhood. It was so much fun to write.

 

Plight

This is one of the more intense songs on my freshman album. It's about my own insecurities and worries that I have. I think it's an interesting take on a love song, and I think that you'll think so too.

 

Scopin' 2 Music Video (Viewer Discretion Is Advised)

This is a music video I made a few years ago for my song "Scopin' 2". It's a part of a storyline I concocted about being an assassin. This is another example of me just having fun with rap, but I promise you that my new album will be much much better :). I'm showing you this so you can see that I love making music videos as well as rapping. So, in the event that I have extra funding after both phases are paid for, I will use the money to make music videos!

 

Baseline Performed Live

Here's a video of my friends and I performing our song "Baseline" live. I love performing live.

 

Risks and challenges

Music is not easy. There are times when I write something one day and think it's amazing and then read it a few days later and realize that it's garbage. For some of the rewards, I said that I would have them to you by May, implying my album will be done around May. This is my goal. Depending on how busy I am with school or if anything comes up, I may have to delay my album. Or maybe I'll get lucky and release it early! Sometimes we just have to wait and see. 
I will be posting updates about my album both on this Inidiegogo page and on my Twitter, so if you would like to see updates on your Twitter feed feel free to follow me @zer0gravityrap !

The price of unlimited distribution beats with trackouts really varies, so I gave myself $1500 to fund the beats. I would estimate that, on average, the price of the beats I would be getting would be around $75 each. I will not even be getting the full $1500 because of Indiegogo fees. If there is money left over, I will use it to begin funding for Phase 2.LogoZer0 Gravity LogoFor those of you who gave enough to get some Zer0 Gravity merch, here's the logo!Thank You!!You have no idea how much this means to me. It's been my dream to make a rap album that I can truly be proud of, and with your help, I think that I may be able to accomplish that. I really want to make an album that stands out from the rest of rap, and with the funding I attain I really think that it's a possibility. The music industry has become a very strange place, and it has also become oversaturated with artists trying to break through and get noticed. The issue is, many of these rappers have the same sound and use the same types of beats. With the unique sound I'll have, there is a chance that I may actually be able to break through. If that happens, I will always remember the people that helped make that happen. And maybe I'll get you some VIP passes if I ever tour :)Thanks again!Jake (a.k.a. Zer0 Gravity)My Past WorkHere are some of the songs/projects I have done prior to this album. I hope you enjoy!GONEThis is my freshman album. It's free to download and I have included some of the tracks below. Click on the link below to be taken to my Bandcamp page with my full album on it. Take a listen!https://zer0gravityrap.bandcamp.com/releasesBaseball MoneyThis was a song that my brother and I wrote and recorded a long time ago. Just an example of having fun with music!

 
SummertimeThis was the last song on my first album "GONE". It's a song I wrote to commemorate my youth as well as the friends that I had made throughout my childhood. It was so much fun to write.

 
PlightThis is one of the more intense songs on my freshman album. It's about my own insecurities and worries that I have. I think it's an interesting take on a love song, and I think that you'll think so too.

 
Scopin' 2 Music Video (Viewer Discretion Is Advised)This is a music video I made a few years ago for my song "Scopin' 2". It's a part of a storyline I concocted about being an assassin. This is another example of me just having fun with rap, but I promise you that my new album will be much much better :). I'm showing you this so you can see that I love making music videos as well as rapping. So, in the event that I have extra funding after both phases are paid for, I will use the money to make music videos!

 
Baseline Performed LiveHere's a video of my friends and I performing our song "Baseline" live. I love performing live.

 
Risks and challengesMusic is not easy. There are times when I write something one day and think it's amazing and then read it a few days later and realize that it's garbage. For some of the rewards, I said that I would have them to you by May, implying my album will be done around May. This is my goal. Depending on how busy I am with school or if anything comes up, I may have to delay my album. Or maybe I'll get lucky and release it early! Sometimes we just have to wait and see. I will be posting updates about my album both on this Inidiegogo page and on my Twitter, so if you would like to see updates on your Twitter feed feel free to follow me @zer0gravityrap !

story:
This Campaign is for the Fire & the Knife Debut Album

You all know how music can work in powerful ways. For some it is essential, and for others something that brings joy and nostalgia and comfort. Music is our life. It is our passion. We share it with our children, family and friends on a daily basis and that's why we've decided to start this campaign. We need your help in order to share this in a bigger way. With your generosity, you will be contributing to a culmination of many years spent honing our skills and cultivating original songs that will finally be recorded and etched in history.

What We Need 

  • As you know, the music industry has changed. It is left to the artist to promote, produce, and procure their own success. That means we have had to wear a lot of hats in order to get to where we are today, yet in order for us to move forward, we need to turn to our fellow music lovers for support.  Realistically we are going to need around $20,000 to achieve all aspects involved. This amount will cover studio time, producer fees, hired musicians, mixing, mastering, printing, artwork & shipping etc. (And maybe a pizza.)

Remember, EVERY little bit helps. When we all give a little, we accumulate a lot!

If you are not able to contribute with your moolah, we understand, but you can spread the word  about this campaign by sharing and telling your fellow music aficionados.

When you share this, please be sure to use Indiegogo share tools! 

You have been waiting a long time for us to get an album out and now is your chance to help push us in that direction!  We want to personally thank you all for your interest and look forward to making this plan a success!

story:
Who are we?

Bhakta Project was born in Cali-Colombia in a very special place called Shyam Ashram. Here our band leader and composer Camilo invited a group of friends and musicians to collaborate on the songs that he had been writing for many years. His compositions combine a modern musical language with the ancient vibration of mantras. Add all the different musical styles that each member brings and that is Bhakta Project.

Early in our short history we recorded our first album that has opened up doors and opportunities for us to play around Colombia. But we have been working really hard on our new music, reaching into our ancestral native rhythms and exploring harmonies and melodies to express our deepest consciousness of peace, love and union.  

That is why we are so excited to be asking for your help to take this music into the studio and out to your lives. So we can share all the love we have put into this project. We are planning on visiting the best studio in Colombia, "Audiovision" and recording with some great engineers and producers so we can give you all the best music that we can deliver. Real music, recorded live, so you can feel what it is like to be in one of our concerts.

    If you could come to one of our concerts you could experience a very ancient practice called "Kirtan". Because we are not interested in just hearing ourselves sing. Our music is composed to share the singing experience with the audience. In our concerts you are as important to the music as we are, and if we can make this new album a reality we hope to be touring next year through the US, South America and Europe to bring Bhakta Project to all of you.

    Funding

    This is the first stage of creating this album. For this moment we are asking our friends and fans around the world to help us get into the Studio on June 22nd to June 25th. Because recording the music is the most important stage of producing a record we want to do it right. We want to really make the music in the studio and not in the editing room after that. For that we are hoping to raise $3.000 USD.

    What will this investment cover:

    • Travel Costs to Bogotá-Colombia (Where the studio is)
    • Studio Time (3 days) AudioVision Studio http://estudiosaudiovision.com/
    • Studio Engineer
    • Producer

    Any funds that reach over our goal we will spend on post production for the record :)

    Purpose

    Bhakta is a collective endeavour, where all of those involved hope to experience and help others experience compassion, love and peace. In times when the whole world is within our reach but somehow we push each other further and further away, music like this can help heal our wounds and see those around us with kinder eyes.

    More Info

    You can find more about our band members and history at www.bhaktapoject.com

    Other Ways You Can Help

    If you can't buy one of our perks then give us a shout out on your social media, share our video with friends you think might support us. Thank you for taking the time to read this and we hope to hear from you.

story:
About the Barons

The L.A. Swing Barons were launched in 2015 to bring authentic 1930s style Kansas City jazz to Los Angeles area and beyond.  The great swing dancers of the golden age of swing all knew that the best band to dance to was the great Count Basie Orchestra, and the L.A. Swing Barons were created to capture that spirit.  Founded by musicians who also know how to swing dance, our music will always be sure to capture that essential element that made the swing era bands so dance-able. 

About the recording

After two years of playing together, it is time to take the music to the next level and put down a recording.  Your contributions will secure you a copy of the recording and a number of interesting perks.

  • All together we are looking to get about $10,000 to completely finish the recording.
  • These fees will go towards:
    • Paying the musicians for their rehearsal and studio time
    • Paying for said studio and engineering time
    • Royalty rights for the tracks that we're recording
    • Legal fees and requirements
    • Physical production of CDs including liner notes and artwork
    • Digital distribution architecture
  • As the Swing Barons are at their core a historical preservation organization, some of our interesting and unique perks are related to preserving and sharing the amazing history of these great Kansas City bands and musicians, the dance that was done to their music, and 
  • We need about $5000 dollars to begin the recording process, some of which has already been secured by bandmember contributions and other funding from the band itself, but once we get to that point the recording is on, and the rest will go into producing a bigger and better product.

Goals

Our initial goal is to produce an 11 track CD, but if we can get the funding that we can stretch that goal out to produce some bonus tracks.  For each $1000 we get past $5000, we'll add an extra track to the CD up to 16 tracks at $10,000! As we approach those goals we'll ask for some input as to which tracks you might want to hear so stay tuned!

story:
"The Fellas" is my tribute to several of the great men singers who rocked my world and informed my soul. Sinatra, Tony Bennett, Nat King Cole, that crowd ... "

 

It's me again - Melissa Manchester.  I had such a great time partnering with you Fanchesters on my 20th studio album, You Gotta Love the Life, I decided to do it once more!  (Besides, you've been begging me to let you help by crowd funding another CD, whenever I see you at my concert venues!)


This time, I'm going to make an album that's been waiting to be born for a long time - The Fellas.  In 1989, I released my Tribute album to honor the great women singers who meant so much to me as a young artist - singers like Ella Fitzgerald, Rosie Clooney, Judy Garland, Sarah Vaughan, Eydie Gorme ... that rarified bunch.  Ever since, I've been wanting to record another album to pay homage to the great male singers who, likewise, set the platinum standard for the rest of us - Frank Sinatra, Nat King Cole, Mel Torme, Johnny Mathis, Dean Martin ... the greats.


I had the good fortune of recording my last CD in the state-of-the-art studios at Citrus College, a community college in Glendora, CA (about 25 miles Northeast of Los Angeles), where I am the Honorary Artist in Residence.  There, I got to see and hear the college's splendid big band, the Blue Note Orchestra, and to work with their masterful director, Dean of Visual and Performing Arts, Robert Slack.  A collaboration was formed.  The Blue Note Orchestra is my band for this new project.  It seems fitting that I help pass the torch to these dedicated young musicians as I'm paying tribute to the artists who inspired me.  An album is born!

 

 

So we have the girl singer (me - Melissa Manchester) and a big bunch of musicians (the Blue Note Orchestra), and even a talented lineup of arrangers, orchestrators and copyists, but it takes more to launch this baby.  Here are just a few of the things we have yet to do:

  • Cover photo shoot, wardrobe, hair/make-up artists, editing/retouching
  • Cover graphic design for album to be released in September - digital and CD versions
  • Re-design of melissamanchester.com and social media, poster/postcard design
  • Cover graphic design for the first single to be released in July
  • Photographers/videographers for the recording sessions
  • Audio mastering with the master, Bernie Grundman
  • Music video editing
  • Radio promotion to Smooth Jazz stations nationwide and in Canada
  • Copy writing for new artist bio and other support materials
  • PR firm and press release expense
  • Manufacture and mailing of advance/promo CDs to media outlets
  • Catering for studio musicians at recording/mixing sessions
  • Worldwide online advertising campaign
  • TV promotional appearances
  • Printing of posters and postcards
  • Licensing of songs on the CD
  • Copyrights and attorney fees
  • Indiegogo campaign administrator
  • Chart preparation for new repertoire in live shows
  • Video and track prep for new The Fellas live shows
  • Manufacturing/shipping of initial order of 3000 CDs
  • Production of Manchie Pack items
  • Postage for campaign perks
  • Indiegogo fees (yes, they get 8% of what we raise - for providing their terrific service)

Didn’t know there were so many components to an album release? 


 

You can be a part of the serious fun - AND help us launch this album in a big way.

 

  • For a $5000 contribution, you'll see your name on the CD cover as Co-Executive Producer, you can come visit the studio when we're recording on May 8, 9 or 10 and, perhaps, you can feel good to know that your donation helped to cover the cost of photographing and video recording the studio sessions.
  • For a $2500 contribution, you'll be listed on the CD packaging as Co-Associate Producer, you can stop by the recording studio while we're working on May 8, 9 or 10 and, maybe, you’ll like knowing that you helped the legendary writers of the eight classic songs on the album to receive their proper song licensing fees.
  • For a $500 contribution, you get to attend a recording session at the Citrus College Studios, you'll be thanked on the CD packaging and, perhaps, you'll know that you helped to defray the cost of mastering the album with the legendary audio mastering engineer, Bernie Grundman.
  • For a $250 donation, you'll see a personalized thank-you on the CD packaging, you'll receive a signed copy of the CD, and you'll be assured that you helped to cover the cost of pressing our first 3000 CDs.
  • For a $100 contribution, you'll get a limited edition "Manchie Pack" full of Fanchester swag and other goodies, a signed copy of the CD, and the knowledge that you helped to fund the all-important radio promotion team that gets Melissa's music out to Smooth Jazz radio stations nationwide.
  • For a $35 gift, you'll receive a signed copy of the CD, an advance digital download of the album, and the certainty that your contribution will help cover the cost of our PR firm's press release to magazines, newspapers, TV news, arts blogs and radio/TV talk shows throughout the U.S. and Canada.
  • For only $10, you get a pre-release digital download of the album and you get to provide dinner at the studio for a hungry student musician who is getting his/her first chance to record with a Grammy Award-winning artist.
     

​

 

I've been blessed to enjoy a forty-five year career as an artist and performer.  There is much I can pass on to these students - these baby artists who can't yet imagine what the next 45 days will look like, much less 45 years. 


I can promise them that the discipline they learn studying music in a rigorous program like the one at Citrus College will serve them well, wherever they go in life.  I can show them how to stay healthy and grounded on the road.  I can introduce them to the legendary singers and songwriters who led the way, and teach them some of the timeless classics.  Through the making of this album, I can remind them to experience the joy of the creative life - and, maybe, ignite a new dream.

 

 

Some would think it's risky to entrust a recording project to a group of students.  I had the occasion to perform with the Blue Note Orchestra in Honolulu over two different summers.  What I found was that, under the expert tutelage of Bob Slack and Alan Waddington (and the rest of the Citrus faculty), these young musicians rose to the challenge every time, every song.  This is a community college, open to all who want to learn, and these students truly appreciate the opportunity to bloom.  I'm delighted to be of service.

 

 

Of course, it's no surprise to me that my old pal, Barry Manilow, shares that same urge to encourage young musicians.  His Manilow Music Project has provided much-needed instruments to children for years.  I'm proud to support the MMP with a portion of the proceeds from this Indiegogo campaign, as I did with You Gotta Love the Life.

 

Oh - did I mention that Barry is singing a duet with me on this album?  It seems he, too, wanted to hear the Citrus student musicians bring it!

 

Each one of you can make a difference!  Whether or not you’re able to contribute monetarily to this crowd funding campaign, you can help – by watching the progress of the campaign throughout our 50 days together, by sharing our news and updates with your family and friends, by showing your support on my Facebook page and Twitter feed.  We’ll give you the stories behind the songs, an inside peek at the recording sessions, a look at some of the remarkable arrangers and student musicians, a taste of the Citrus College experience, an understanding of the audio mixing and mastering process, tips for what makes a good album cover design and more.

Thank you!  I’m so glad to have you along for this adventure – and grateful for your support.

 

Melissa

story:
Hi, we're Good Quiver.

A relatively new band based out of Seattle, though the four musicians have a long and winding history playing music together.  Ehssan Karimi on drums, Katelyn Berreth on vocals, Martin Celt on bass, Elliot Gray on keys.  The music of Good Quiver is harmonically complex, groovecentric and highly original.  The lyrical motion lends voice to complex corners while maintaining the kind of melody that gets stuck in your head.  Look, we're really jazzed about the music here.

We recently finished writing a truly awesome album called You're the Tiger.  There are eleven tracks we intend to record.  This record skirts the fine line between neosoul and rock and roll without skipping a beat.  We believe that when you hear it you'll agree, this selection of songs is especially special.

We are asking for support by way of funds.  Making a record is expensive.  Fortunately we're a really tight band so we're going to be able to pull this off for way cheaper than the industry standard.  We need a minimum of $5,000.  The proceeds will go toward recording, pressing, and releasing You're the Tiger LP.  Any amount we make above our goal will be put into a band fund and used to support our efforts in getting this music out to the world.  We appreciate any contribution you can make.  Whether that's a few dollars or a few hundred dollars, every bit counts.  Sharing this campaign with others via social media, and telling your friends about our project also helps spread the love, music, and good quivers.  If you have any questions please feel free to e-mail us at goodquiver@gmail.com.

All contributors will receive recognition and our utmost gratitude.  We are happy to be offering a few "Perks" to our supporters through this campaign!  We encourage you to check those out as you consider making a donation to support Good Quiver recording You're the Tiger LP.

Thank you so much for your interest in and support of our music.

Love & Quivers, Good Quiver    ______________________________________________________

story:
My name is Dan Olivo of The Dan Olivo Jazz Band.  We are a Jazz Standards, group that harken back to the golden age of jazz and American popular song. We perform songs from The Great American song book that were made popular by artist like Frank Sinatra, Ella Fitzgerald, Louis Armstrong, Nat “King” Cole and Dean Martin. These are artist and songs from The Great American songbook does not get a lot of radio play. But, fortunately thanks to a handful of today’s contemporaries like Harry Connick Jr., Diana Krall and Michael Buble’ who continue to perform live, these timeless songs continue to reach a large audience and keep the Great American Songbook alive.

We want to be a part of that effort to keep The Great American Songbook alive and continue to introduce these songs to new fans. My band and I over the past few years have been fortunate enough to perform these songs all over southern California at bars, clubs, restaurants, private events and various music festivals. I can tell you that having performed these songs to many an audience, these are songs that people of all ages respond to with reverence and love. We want to continue to introduce this music to new audience who may have never heard of Frank Sinatra or Billie Holiday.

    It's been long over due but we are excited to finally record our debut album this year. A few years back I started phase 1 of this campaign to raise contributions to fund writing arrangements of over 12 songs that will be recorded on our album. We have arrangements and put our own spin to standards like “Day by Day”, “It’s Only a Paper Moon”, “Moonlight in Vermont”, “Sway”’ “Time After Time” and “More”. We even cover tunes like Fat’s Domino’s “I’m Walkin’”, Frankie Valli’s “Can’t Take My Eyes Off of You” and Harry Connick Jr’s “Come by Me”. Thanks to your support we were able to fund these arrangements.

We are now ready to begin Phase 2 (The recording phase) of the album. This will include 3 days of recording and 2 days of mixing. Your contributions will help the funding of studio time, musicians, musical directors, recording and mixing engineers.  We have different contribution levels and some terrific perks and swag you will receive for you generous contribution. Perks include producing credits, hats, t shirts, copies of the album, digital downloads, and private concerts from me and members of my band.

So, I hope you will join us and become a part of this journey to get our debut album made. All successful campaigns rely on folk like you spreading the word. Please share our efforts to keep The Great American songbook alive with your friends on social media. Thank you for your support and we look forward to sharing our music with you.

Thank You,

The Dan Olivo Jazz Band

 
 

THE DAN OLIVO JAZZ BAND ALBUM

My name is Dan Olivo. I am an Italian/American actor and jazz singer based in Los Angeles. For the last few years I have had the amazing opportunity to perform the songs I love. I have been fortunate to be able to appear with my jazz combo at various concerts, festivals, venues and private events all over Southern California.

Some of my most recent performances have included Bar Nineteen12 at the historic Beverly Hills Hotel, the fabulous 570 KLAC Mistletoe and Martini Christmas Concert at The Universal Amphitheatre (which also included acts like Natalie Cole, Frank Sinatra Jr., Steve Tyrell and Big Bad Voodoo Daddy), and The Eagle Rock Music Festival.

MY DREAM

I love The Great American Songbook which include the songs of Frank Sinatra, Nat "King" Cole, Dean Martin, Ella Fitzgerald, Tony Bennett, Bobby Darin, Harry Connick Jr. and Michael Bublé. These songs are timeless and it has been my lifelong dream to one day record a jazz combo album. That time is now.

I have teamed together with my dear friend and fabulous musician, arranger and band leader Ian Robbins and some of LA's best musicians in hopes of creating an album of some classic standards, songs of today that could have been standards, and one or two originals. I also plan to invite a special guest or two to join me in a duet.

MY GOAL

To raise a total of $15,000 - $25,000 split up in three Phases. Phase 1 will included the cost of writing, arranging, and obtaining the rights to record twelve songs. It will also include promotional materials such as photos, videos and marketing materials.

Phase 2 (The recording phase) of the album. This will include 3 days of recording and 2 days of mixing. Your contributions will help the funding of studio time, musicians, musical directors, recording and mixing engineers.

Phase 3 will come at a later date, will include the cost of post recording, CD production, CD cover art, cases, digital downloads, and merchandising materials (hats, t-shirts, posters, and the launch of the CD release concert).

REALIZING THE DREAM

By contributing to the production of The Dan Olivo Jazz Band Album you are not only helping me fulfill a lifelong dream, but you are in effect helping to keep the Great American Songbook alive. This album will be enjoyed by all who love the great standards, and will also act as the calling card for my band and me to draw in other opportunities to play the music we love.

Those of you who are able to contribute will be entitled to some fabulous perks including an autographed CD, digital downloads, a copy of a signed photo of the entire band as a thank you card, hats, t-shirts, your name with a thank you message on the album, and the opportunity to come to a free concert such as the album release party.

For those who simply cannot make a financial contribution, you can still help make this dream a reality. There is no greater marketing tool than word of mouth. Please let your friends and family know about this campaign. Let them know that there are still many of us left who love this music and want to keep it alive for this generation and those to come.

The Great American Songbook is simply the greatest music of all time. It is my passion and my dream to share it with the world. Please help The Dan Olivo Jazz Band achieve this goal.

WHAT PEOPLE ARE SAYING

When Dan began to sing, the crowd stopped what they were doing to listen. He grasped the attention of all 300 people

This guys a great old school crooner. He's studied the greats and you can here it in his voice.

Dan Olivo was born in the wrong era. He's definitely an old soul with a crooner's heart and voice. I love listening to Dan sing and have his songs playing while I'm working all the time. Do yourself a favor and get lulled back in time.

When Dan began to sing, the crowd stopped what they were doing to listen. He grasped the attention of all 300 people.

WITH GRATITUDE AND THANKS

Thank you from the bottom of my heart.

Dan Olivo

www.danolivo.com

story:
Summary

- Thank you for checking out this page! My name is Dan Costello, but you can call me Ello. I'm a singer/songwriter from New York and I've been playing and writing music for close to 10 years now. My instruments include drums, piano, voice, bass (not well hehe) and I'm also a producer.

- This campaign is for an EP that I've been working on and recording for the last year or so (forgot how long at this point) and want to release within the next six months! This EP is the debut for this brand new project and has taken my vision from less than flattering demos and into the studio - I'm going all out! It means the world to me to record and release this music at the highest possible quality both musically and visually!

- If you want to hear a preview of two of the demos (MIDI pre-recording sessions and rough mixes) you can click this link! - https://soundcloud.com/storymusicofficial

- Anyone who contributes will essentially help me pay for the recording of this record as well as the completion/finalization of the music as well as for the artwork and merchandise for this brand new project! This record has been a blast to record and the finished product will be well worth the wait! Writing and recording this thing has broken down walls for me as a songwriter, musician and producer and I hope/know that this newfound freedom will shine forth in the music. Every single contribution, big or small will get us closer to our goal and will be much appreciated!

Funding & Perks

- The goal I have set for the funding of this album is $2,500 - this money will go towards the following:

1. Album artwork/logos - $500

2. Physical discs - $200

3. T-shirts - $200

4. Recording/completion - $1,600

- The perks for helping to fund this record will include digital and physical versions of the album, T-shirts, and even a personal song written just for you! (this will be something...)

- If I don't end up reaching the entire goal I plan on using whatever money I have made to go ahead and pay for as much of this record as possible - every dollar counts and will help to create a successful record!

The Impact

- This project means the world to me - when I was younger, progressive bands such as Yes, Genesis, Rush and others expanded my mind and helped me find a deeper sense of self. Later, artists like Tears For Fears, Ben Folds and Imogen Heap made their way into my listening and shifted everything I had previously understood about what music could be. Japanese anime and video game music also had its place in my musical mind and its role in shaping my style as a composer and songwriter. With the risk of sounding cheesy, I owe the world to this music for how much it inspired me and ultimately healed me from a young age, and ever since this musical awakening my goal has been to give what I've received - to fill the world with music that inspires and heals.

- I've been feeling for the last few years that the music has been on a steady incline - I went from an excited 14 year old writing "Dance Dance Revolution" style electronic music on GarageBand to being in and out of few bands in High School, but ultimately it all came down to writing and singing from my heart. When I was in my first year of College, I went through my first ever (and only since) writer's block and could only write poetry. Eventually after months of silence, a new expression burst through me and called itself "onevoice" - the beginning of this combination of Prog and Singer/Songwriter. onevoice went on to release a few albums that were discussed on Prog forums and ended up on a blog or two thanks to the amazing people who connected with the music enough to share and believe in it. And so, after many years of writing music, Story was born as the next stage of this expression. No more MIDI or demos! I'm taking this music to the studio and making records this way from now on! To get this music to sound and looks as good as possible is my goal.

- Any proceeds at all for this record will truly make a difference and help a broke, just-graduated College kid like me fund the music of my dreams and push forward towards Story's unfolding..... uhm..... story..... yeah.

Risks & Stuff

- Some of the challenges along the way have been working with everyone's schedules while booking rehearsals, recording dates, etc. Another has been funding - I'm the only person paying for this project so its been difficult to say the least coming up with the money to pay everyone involved, which has brought me here. I work as a piano teacher and also a producer, but I've got plenty of other things in life that require money. The way through the first challenge was just to push through and make it all work, and so far everything has been successful. The funding challenge is what brought me here to Indiegogo to ask you guys for help - every dollar is seriously so appreciated!

Other Ways to Help

- If you cannot contribute financially that's ok! I won't hate you (for long). Other ways you guys can help out include:

1. Spreading the word! Telling as many people as possible about this thing - maybe sharing the music with friends/family and seeing if others dig it enough to contribute!

2. Indiegogo share tools! They include links to share on Facebook, Twitter - sharing on social media would be awesome too and get the word out to more people.

Well, that's it! Thanks again so much to anyone who gives anything! You guys really are helping so much! I promise this record will be worth the wait and an incredible journey for you as a listener! It came from so much time, passion and daydreaming in class and holds as much me as it possibly could! I'm just so excited to share it with the world!

2. Indiegogo share tools! They include links to share on Facebook, Twitter - sharing on social media would be awesome too and get the word out to more people.

story:
Hey You, caught you looking at our page!

Stay here!! We need your help, luckily your just the person we need!

This is a huge deal for us, the music we create is literally, our journey, thoughts, feelings and experiences expressed through music = Our Songs are Our Babies! We want to give them the best possible start before they enter the world.

We are raising funds and spreading the word maybe you can help?

The cost of recording and releasing a single can sometimes feel out of reach but many hands make light work. We've already done the hard part, we've spent hours and hours and hours of our precious time passionately writing, producing and arranging these songs. 

We are so, so excited to bring our very first song, due to be released in May, titled "Merry Go Round". Most of this we have funded out of our own pockets so far but we need your help for promotion and production costs.

You have a unique opportunity to be a valuable part of our success and to be a  part of the journey.

How you can help?...

  1. Well firstly you can help by Sharing This Page and invite your Facebook friends and family to our Dust & Gold Facebook page https://www.facebook.com/dustandgoldnz/ this is incredibly valuable to us more than you may realize and it's free :)
  2. Donate Money. You can donate any amount as often as you wish without any obligation. Win, win.
  3. You can Pre Order our Single "Merry Go Round" from April 1st 2019
  4. Come to support as many live shows as possible, we'd love to see you there!

Lots of love and appreciation,
Dust & Gold 

P.s Here is is a quick summary/bio of us for those of you who don't know us but have a kind supportive heart!

"Nelson born singer/songwriter duo ‘Dust & Gold,’ blending Nikita Fountain's beautiful songbird voice and Mark McKenzie's rich baritone over a wholesome and raw acoustic accompaniment of original material. Their carefully crafted songs range from haunting Celtic influenced ballads, to foot-tapping sing-along bluegrass tunes, and their debut Single ‘Merry Go Round’ is due to be released May 2019."

story:
Hi & welcome to my campaign page! 

 

I LOVE writing and performing my own songs, which draw on a big melting pot of musical influences from soul, RnB and jazz to Classical music and folk. 

 

I am aiming this year to record and release an EP recording of 5 of my songs with my band to send out into the world... 

 

 

 

The EP project

I’ve spent a lot of this year writing and arranging new material after an amazingly inspiring trip to NASHVILLE, TENNESSEE.  I've been working with a brilliant set of musicians and I just want to  capture a bit of that magic that we have playing together.

The songs are ready and so are my band - I just need your help to make it happen!

 

HOW YOU CAN HELP & WHAT YOU GET!

 

By pledging as a supporter of this campaign, you are helping to make it possible for us to get in a professional, high-quality studio and properly record the songs. This would mean the songs can  be shared more widely including digital platforms and radio play rather than just in 'demo form'.

 

The main way you can help bring this project to life is  through this page, where you can CHOOSE & BUY A "PERK" which is my little way of giving you something back for your support and investment in me and my music. 

 

ONCE YOU SIGN UP AS A SUPPORTER YOU THEN GET EXCLUSIVE UPDATES ON THE PROJECT, SPECIAL REHEARSAL FOOTAGE AND PREVIEW OF THE SONGS AND THE PROCESS OF CREATING THE STUDIO RECORDING!

 

 

 

HOW TO BUY A PERK

 

  • CHOOSE YOUR PERK from the thumbnails on the right hand side of this page or if on a mobile page scroll up to the top to see available perks*.  

 

  • CLICK ON  "GET THIS PERK" to be redirected to the payment page for the perk you want, CLICK TO PURCHASE IT and I'll get on GETTING IT READY FOR YOU!  

 

*Some items are only available in the UK. Others will have estimated shipping costs as an extra based on UK/EU or world postage rates.

 

  • Alternatively you can pledge a contribution of your own choice and decide what you feel most comfortable covering.

 

  • You will be invited to a special EP CAMPAIGN SUPPORTERS GIG  at a London venue as soon as the EP is recorded, mixed and mastered!  If you have pledged from abroad  or can't attend for any reason, we will send you an exclusive link to view the video of the gig.

 

** ALL PERKS PURCHASED INCLUDE A CD OF THE EP &

PRE-RELEASE DIGITAL DOWNLOAD **

 

 (My band: Filippo Ferazzoli (guitars), Giazzone Reyes (bass/backing vocals), myself (piano/lead vocals) and Marco Quarantotto (drums/heckling).

 

What will your funding be supporting?

 

The campaign aims to cover costs my EP being recorded and produced for hard copy and digital distribution. As a rough estimate of the costs, see the breakdown below: 

 

  • STUDIO RECORDING - £2,500: this would cover 2 FULL DAYS in a professional studio  to record the EP tracks in their best form. A GOOD studio saves painstaking hours on redoing and editing afterwards SO THIS IS THE PRIORITY item I hope to cover.

.

  • POST-PRODUCTION MIXING/MASTERING - £1,500: this process is vital to any ensuring the music sounds great  across all different formats ranging from the hard copy CD's to digital mp3 downloads & online platforms such as iTunes, Spotify & YouTube.

 

  • CD MANUFACTURING AND ARTWORK - £1,000: this would help cover the first run of CD pressing so you all can get that all important hard copy CD in your hands as well as great album artwork!

 

UNLIKE many other crowdfunding platforms, Indiegogo will pass on any funds raised, even if I don't meet the full target and whatever the result ANY CONTRIBUTION STILL HELPS and makes a MASSIVE difference to getting these songs out there.

 

The campaign ends on Sunday November 10th!

 

 

 

Every shout-out helps! Share, share, share!

 

A little personal recommendation goes a LONG way so please do share my campaign page link below!

 

http://igg.me/at/anjaliperin


 

THANK YOU SO MUCH!

 

Anjali xx

I LOVE writing and performing my own songs, which draw on a big melting pot of musical influences from soul, RnB and jazz to Classical music and folk.  
 
I am aiming this year to record and release an EP recording of 5 of my songs with my band to send out into the world... 
 
 
 
The EP project
I’ve spent a lot of this year writing and arranging new material after an amazingly inspiring trip to NASHVILLE, TENNESSEE.  I've been working with a brilliant set of musicians and I just want to  capture a bit of that magic that we have playing together.

story:
Who Am I?

My name is CJ Cooper and I'm a 20 year old singer/songwriter from Guelph, Canada. I have been playing guitar, piano and singing for over 13 years. I have performed at the Rogers Cup, promoted my first album "Look Ahead" on the VIARail train across Canada, sang for CFL and CEBL games, been a part of Canadian Music Week and numerous festivals, weddings and charity events. 

The last few years have included some of my best and worst moments in life and my music has reflected that.  As I've grown, so have my lyrics and style and I want to express it with the world in hopes that my messages can help just one person. This album has been such a collaboration with several talented and kind individuals. My mantra through this process has been "community".

This is where you come in! During Covid-19, I saw community in a way I'd never witnessed before and people came together to support others in an unprecedented way. I released a song/video during that time to give hope and give people the opportunity to be in the video and help with the process and that's what I hope to achieve with this album. I want to include you, your family, your friends. We truly are in this life together and I want my music and my audience to reflect and show that. 

 

What I Need & What You Get

In order to create the best version of this musical vision, you will get to be a part of this journey in helping to raise $6000 for the next album. Part of those costs include:

  • to compensate producers and other musicians
  • promotional material, social media posts, cover art
  • equipment rental
  • cd manufacturing

If any amount up to this goal is raised, it will get distributed throughout these areas.

 

If you choose to donate, you will receive little "thank you" packages.

Donation over $30:

  • a signed copy of my cd upon completion

Donation over $50:

  • signed copies of my first album, along with the new album

Donations over $100:

  • both cds and an appropriate cover song of your choosing to be posted on my Facebook or Instagram with a personal shout-out

*open to Canadian residents only

**update: pins no longer available

***if you choose to keep your donation anonymous, you will not be able to receive any perks

 

Other Ways You Can Help

There are other things you can do to support this campaign and music other than donating!

  • share this campaign on your social media
  • follow my social media accounts
  • stream my music
  • subscribe to my YouTube channel

Thank you so much for taking the time to support my career, my dream, my life<3

story:
What's This About?

Welcome, everybody! I'm Alex Brubaker, and I am incredibly excited to introduce you to my latest musical endeavor, Building Harmonic Castles.

Building Harmonic Castles is an album I've worked tirelessly on over the last few years, recorded by the brilliant Alex Anderson at Tree of Life Studios. The album brings together my two musical personas: one as a fingerstyle guitarist who plays delicate music in intimate listening rooms and fancy places, and the other as a solo post-rock-esque act playing alongside grunge bands and experimental-noise acts. While these listener bases may not overlap much, I hope the album will stretch everyone beyond their sonic comfort zones to find something new and beautiful.

This is a two part album, split right down the middle to be optimized like your favorite old records.

Side A is just me and guitar; more for the purists. It's a beautiful showcase of melody and really lets the guitar breathe. The first single I released back in February, First Dance, really embodies that.

Side B explores some of my influences in post-rock and ambient music. It's still very much solo fingerstyle guitar, but combined with effects, looping, and even some audio samples.

 

What's In It For Me? What's In It For You?

Recording, mixing, and mastering has been complete for a few months, so I'm looking to partner with you to get this across the finish line! That means not only digital platforms, but also physical CDs and, for the first time ever, vinyl records!

To meet these goals, I set up some fun and exciting perks for those who contribute!

Have you ever wanted to have me play for you in your living room (even with Joe, the violinist I often play with who is not on this album)? Have you ever wanted to sit down and pick my brain about guitar, writing, recording, or anything else? Or do you want to be one of the first to hear the album?

You can not only pick up a CD or record, but you can also do any of the above!

I set the goal of the campaign at $2000 to set realistic expectations mindful of the financial challenges many are facing with the pandemic. In reality, the costs will be a good bit more and I am prepared to absorb much of those costs so you won't have to worry about the album not being released.

Cost estimates:

  • Album Art: $500-1000
  • Marketing: $500
  • Physical CDs: $1000-2000
  • Vinyl: $4000

 

Risks & Challenges:

As I mentioned, the album has already been recorded, mixed, and mastered, so the biggest hurdle is out of the way.

The biggest unknown is Covid-19. While I don't have answers for every scenario, I've tried to answer some of that in the FAQ section. The gist of all of that is that I don't anticipate that anything will prevent the record from happening, maybe just a delay in manufacturing and having to delay fulfillment of any in-person perks (e.g., house concerts, release party). I will certainly keep you all updated with any developments.

 

Other Ways You Can Help:

Given the economic challenges of the pandemic, I completely understand if you are not able to contribute monetarily at this time. But that doesn't mean that you can't play an important role in this!

Social media has a huge influence in the reach of crowdfunding campaigns. If you are not already following me on these platforms, please do so! Every like and share of this campaign will help to get me close to this goal!

Social Media: Facebook, YouTube, Instagram

Streaming: Spotify, Apple Music

And you can always find more info at my website, alexbrubakerguitar.com, or by emailing me directly at alexbrubakerguitar@gmail.com!

 

Thank You!

I've now been doing this whole music thing for over a decade. I've performed across much of the eastern half of the United States for countless individuals. I've performed alongside many of my musical heroes and have made tons of relationships with musicians and music enthusiasts alike.

And that has all been possible because of people like you. Thank you so much for your continued support!

story:
THE BOTTLE TOPS: SUN STUDIO EP

Hi. We are The Bottle Tops. And we're making something cool, and giving back!

WE are...

...a Lincoln, NE-based rock-grass-honky-tonk band who hovers a magnifying glass over the fun side of these genres. 

In order to cover the costs of mixing, mastering, and paying our amazing collaborators, we are searching for support from you lovely and kind people. And, NOW IS THE TIME WE RAISE DOLLARS FOR ARTISTS IN NEED. Any dollars raised, over the costs needed to complete mixing, mastering and printing, we are giving that money back to our community.(see below) Thanks in advance for backing us and the other creatives, and for helping us make this dream come true. We have always wanted to make a record at Sun Studio, and it's so close to being real. And, we hope it makes a huge difference in the community as well. Anything you are able to give is so appreciated!

Giving Phase I: Fund the Project

It takes a village. We are calling on musicians and engineers whom we value and respect to help us make this EP. In our opinion, they should be paid well for their time and creativity. For the session alone, I will need to pay for the following:

Labor for session musicians

Labor for our mixing/overdub engineer 

Mixing time

Overdubs (i.e. adding in bass, drums, vocals and more) 

Printing EP, 400 copies

These costs are estimated at a $1,600 minimum.

Then, we are hoping to raise an additional $2,000 for our community. This goal can be reality if we come together and do our part. Mike has already been able to raise $2,500...so we have seen it. 

Where your support will go

We wanted to release this album later in the year, 2020. But, as you have seen, so many are in need. So, we are wanting to release this EP to help others. This includes music clubs, musicians who work full time as musicians, and even a few part-timers who have been forced to quit their jobs and are completely out of work.

Once funds are raised for musicians, we will have a short application process for artists in need. They will list and prove their monetary loss in the last couple months from the covid-19 activity. From this information, we will base our give. We will be 100% transparent on how much was raised, and where the funds will go, once they are distributed to those in need. 

Music Clubs: The Zoo Bar, The Bourbon Theater, 1867, Duffy's Tavern, Gray's Keg Saloon, The Corner Bar (Fremont, NE)  (These are places The Bottle Tops plays at frequently) 

Other Ways You Can Help

Any quantity of gift is so greatly appreciated, but if you are unable to contribute, here are a few ways you can help out:

Share this campaign with others via social media, email, or good 'ole word of mouth!

Spread the word about the EP release, and encourage people to follow The Bottle Tops music at @thebottletops via Facebook or Instagram! 

Thank you for reading, giving, listening, etc. We have such a deep love and appreciation for you all! Big ups to this community for already supporting us so much. Now, it's our turn to give back and we hope you help in that fight.
