story:
What is this campaign about?

Hello friends and thank you for taking the time to look at our project.

We are offering our Debut CD Album “The Well-Tempered Guitars” as a pre-order here on Indiegogo. You'll have a chance to order it, get signed copies, and get other rewards before the CD's official release in 2021. 

We are very passionate about recording our Debut Album entirely dedicated to the Preludes and Fugues of Mario Castelnuovo-Tedesco whose music is really close to our hearts. We are honoured to release a CD with the original works for two guitars, written by this Hollywood composer who fell in love with the classical guitar.  He humbly considered himself a “ghost-writer” since he remained in the shadows of his famous students such as John Williams and Henry Mancini. During the 1930s, Castelnuovo-Tedesco was negatively affected by the Mussolini’s government’s racial laws restricting the rights of Italian Jews. In 1939 he had to leave Italy and emigrate to the U.S. This is another reason why we think the music of Castelnuovo-Tedesco deserves to be more widely known and listened to.

This Album is the result of years of practice, research and many of our sacrifices. Now is the time to give it all back to the world by recording "The Well-Tempered Guitars".

Join our CD project and help us make the world sound better!

Our story

We are MoNo Guitar Duo: Polish-Italian duo made up of guitarists Giuseppe Molino and  Anna Nowicka based in Rome, Italy. The MoNo is not only the acronym of our surnames, but along with the word Duo it encapsulates our idea of creating music together, where two musicians reach a common understanding and make one and unique interpretation of the composer's work.

In 2010 we started to play together and our main goal has always been to deepen and expand musical repertoire for 2 guitars (and 4 hands guitar) with our own arrangements and interpretations. 

Over last three years we have been multi-awarded in many international music competitions and have performed in numerous Classical Guitar and Musical Festivals in Italy and abroad. On the top of constant musical research we are very involved in musical education, by giving masterclasses and seminars focusing on the most important aspects of the musician's training and growth. 

 

What Your € Pays For

These days, streaming platforms give you access to a huge catalog of music almost for free. It's much easier and cheaper to listen to music than it had been before the streaming era, but unfortunately the costs for the production and the printing for us musicians stay the same.

We are still in favor of CDs, because you can hold them in your hands and touch them, you can have an autograph or a personal message on them.

(For those who favor the digital version, there will be the digital  download opportunity as well.)

Your contribution to our project will cover part of the costs of:

  1. recording, 
  2. mastering, 
  3. licensing, 
  4. booklet design, 
  5. distribution, 
  6. press releases, 
  7. promotions,
  8. and IndieGoGo fees. 

 

The Impact

We both believe that Classical Music enriches you and makes you feel part of something larger than yourself. 

Your contribution to our project will make a difference in the spirit of Classical Music by supporting a duo that you know and esteem. 

Supporting an artist is supporting an entire society, because music unites us, improves and sensitises each of us.

Music makes people think "out of the box". In these tough times we need so much to think differently and to see the problems of the Covid-19 crisis from new perspectives and to be able to find creative solutions. ​We are convinced that Music can help us through this crisis and become an important source of strength and healing. 

Tracklist:

Mario Castelnuovo-Tedesco : The Well-Tempered Guitars op.199 vol. 1

1. Prelude and fugue in G minor  (Très fluide - Très modéré)
2. Prelude and fugue in D major  (Très soutenu et pompeux - Tempo di Giga)
3. Prelude and fugue in  A minor  (Andante molto mosso - Modéré et tranquille)
4. Prelude and fugue in  E major  (Andante mosso - Allegretto giocoso, Tempo di Bourrée)
5. Prelude and fugue in B minor  (Piuttosto mosso e agitato - Calmo)
6. Prelude and fugue in  F sharp major  (Rapide et léger - Risoluto, Alla Marcia)
7. Prelude and fugue in  C sharp minor (Piuttosto mosso - Molto Moderato e malinconico)
8. Prelude and fugue in  A flat major  (Andantino dolce e tranquillo - Allegretto grazioso)
9. Prelude and fugue in  E flat minor  (Mesto funebre - Moderato e mesto)
10. Prelude and fugue in  B flat major  (Alla Rumba - Allegretto burlesco, Alla Marcia)
11. Prelude and fugue in  F minor  (Lento, cupo e spettrale - Molto moderato e triste)
12. Prelude and fugue in  C major  (Allegramente, quasi Fanfara - Più grazioso e meno mosso)

Risks & Challenges

There are no risks when it comes to support an artist that you know and esteem. 
The great news is that DaVinci Classics has already agreed to release "The Well-Tempered Guitars" (we are in safe hands).

Our CD is scheduled to release in 2021 and you will get it, as well as other customized benefits that we offer to our supporters.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute financially your support is still greatly appreciated! 
Sharing the news about this campaign in anyway you can is necessary for it to succeed.
Whether or not you're able to give, you can help us by:

  • Sharing this campaign on social media
  • Emailing your friends and family
  • Spreading the word via word-of-mouth

You can also:

LIKE our Facebook page here

SUBSCRIBE and SHARE our videos on YouTube

BROWSE our Website

Your encouragement and support means the world to us. We are very excited to continue this musical journey together.

 

Questions? Comments? Want to customize a perk? We’d be happy to hear from you!
Send an e-mail to monoguitarduo@gmail.com and we’ll reply within 24 hours.

                                                                       T  H  A  N  K      Y  O  U

                                                                     Sending you lots of love

                                                                -MoNo Guitar Duo & TEAM
story_txt:
What is this campaign about?
Hello friends and thank you for taking the time to look at our project.
We are offering our Debut CD Album “The Well-Tempered Guitars” as a pre-order here on Indiegogo. You'll have a chance to order it, get signed copies, and get other rewards before the CD's official release in 2021. 
We are very passionate about recording our Debut Album entirely dedicated to the Preludes and Fugues of Mario Castelnuovo-Tedesco whose music is really close to our hearts. We are honoured to release a CD with the original works for two guitars, written by this Hollywood composer who fell in love with the classical guitar.  He humbly considered himself a “ghost-writer” since he remained in the shadows of his famous students such as John Williams and Henry Mancini. During the 1930s, Castelnuovo-Tedesco was negatively affected by the Mussolini’s government’s racial laws restricting the rights of Italian Jews. In 1939 he had to leave Italy and emigrate to the U.S. This is another reason why we think the music of Castelnuovo-Tedesco deserves to be more widely known and listened to.
This Album is the result of years of practice, research and many of our sacrifices. Now is the time to give it all back to the world by recording "The Well-Tempered Guitars".
Join our CD project and help us make the world sound better!
Our story

We are MoNo Guitar Duo: Polish-Italian duo made up of guitarists Giuseppe Molino and  Anna Nowicka based in Rome, Italy. The MoNo is not only the acronym of our surnames, but along with the word Duo it encapsulates our idea of creating music together, where two musicians reach a common understanding and make one and unique interpretation of the composer's work.
In 2010 we started to play together and our main goal has always been to deepen and expand musical repertoire for 2 guitars (and 4 hands guitar) with our own arrangements and interpretations. 
Over last three years we have been multi-awarded in many international music competitions and have performed in numerous Classical Guitar and Musical Festivals in Italy and abroad. On the top of constant musical research we are very involved in musical education, by giving masterclasses and seminars focusing on the most important aspects of the musician's training and growth. 
 
What Your € Pays For
These days, streaming platforms give you access to a huge catalog of music almost for free. It's much easier and cheaper to listen to music than it had been before the streaming era, but unfortunately the costs for the production and the printing for us musicians stay the same.
We are still in favor of CDs, because you can hold them in your hands and touch them, you can have an autograph or a personal message on them.
(For those who favor the digital version, there will be the digital  download opportunity as well.)
Your contribution to our project will cover part of the costs of:

recording, 
mastering, 
licensing, 
booklet design, 
distribution, 
press releases, 
promotions,
and IndieGoGo fees. 

 

The Impact
We both believe that Classical Music enriches you and makes you feel part of something larger than yourself. 
Your contribution to our project will make a difference in the spirit of Classical Music by supporting a duo that you know and esteem. 
Supporting an artist is supporting an entire society, because music unites us, improves and sensitises each of us.
Music makes people think "out of the box". In these tough times we need so much to think differently and to see the problems of the Covid-19 crisis from new perspectives and to be able to find creative solutions. ​We are convinced that Music can help us through this crisis and become an important source of strength and healing. 
Tracklist:
Mario Castelnuovo-Tedesco : The Well-Tempered Guitars op.199 vol. 1
1. Prelude and fugue in G minor  (Très fluide - Très modéré)2. Prelude and fugue in D major  (Très soutenu et pompeux - Tempo di Giga)3. Prelude and fugue in  A minor  (Andante molto mosso - Modéré et tranquille)4. Prelude and fugue in  E major  (Andante mosso - Allegretto giocoso, Tempo di Bourrée)5. Prelude and fugue in B minor  (Piuttosto mosso e agitato - Calmo)6. Prelude and fugue in  F sharp major  (Rapide et léger - Risoluto, Alla Marcia)7. Prelude and fugue in  C sharp minor (Piuttosto mosso - Molto Moderato e malinconico)8. Prelude and fugue in  A flat major  (Andantino dolce e tranquillo - Allegretto grazioso)9. Prelude and fugue in  E flat minor  (Mesto funebre - Moderato e mesto)10. Prelude and fugue in  B flat major  (Alla Rumba - Allegretto burlesco, Alla Marcia)11. Prelude and fugue in  F minor  (Lento, cupo e spettrale - Molto moderato e triste)12. Prelude and fugue in  C major  (Allegramente, quasi Fanfara - Più grazioso e meno mosso)

Risks & Challenges
There are no risks when it comes to support an artist that you know and esteem. The great news is that DaVinci Classics has already agreed to release "The Well-Tempered Guitars" (we are in safe hands).
Our CD is scheduled to release in 2021 and you will get it, as well as other customized benefits that we offer to our supporters.

Other Ways You Can Help
If you can't contribute financially your support is still greatly appreciated! Sharing the news about this campaign in anyway you can is necessary for it to succeed.Whether or not you're able to give, you can help us by:

Sharing this campaign on social media
Emailing your friends and family
Spreading the word via word-of-mouth

You can also:
LIKE our Facebook page here
SUBSCRIBE and SHARE our videos on YouTube
BROWSE our Website
Your encouragement and support means the world to us. We are very excited to continue this musical journey together.
 Questions? Comments? Want to customize a perk? We’d be happy to hear from you!Send an e-mail to monoguitarduo@gmail.com and we’ll reply within 24 hours.                                                                       T  H  A  N  K      Y  O  U                                                                     Sending you lots of love                                                                -MoNo Guitar Duo & TEAM

story:
About: project, vision, basic details

Hi, I’m Jennifer -- thanks for stopping by my page. I’m a singer-songwriter who has spent my whole life in music. For me, music has always been about sharing passion, relating to others, creating new expression, and touching lives. 

While I’ve had experience with studio recordings in the past, this will be my very first solo project that showcases all original music. I’d like to invite you to partner with me in making this happen.

The project & vision

Over the last 6 months, I wrote a brand new batch of original tunes inspired by impacting experiences including my upbringing, love and connection, and of course heartbreak -- the usual. The sounds and melodies that fill the poetry come from recent raw inspiration and a strong melodic background in faith-based music, country, and folk rock. With the world turned upside down right now and more time than ever for self-reflection, I’ve had the pleasure of finding meaningful new expressions.

With this recent creative inspiration, I felt the message and music needed to be shared with others, which led to a few performances for a small audience, covid style. After receiving positive feedback, I’m expanding my reach by investing in a professionally produced EP featuring 3 songs so they can be heard in the homes and car radios of people everywhere. Each with their own message and unique expression, these songs deserve the opportunity to be heard and enjoyed at their highest potential.

With lyrics that speak of holding onto hope, the pain and process of finding freedom, and reminiscing about young love, I know many will find themselves in the sounds and message of this fresh music. And, I hope it will be an enjoyable daily life kind of accompaniment especially as we’ve faced the hardest of seasons globally. 

(I’ve included a few clips from live acoustic performances here - have a listen)

 

About me

Music is my home. I’m a singer at my core, and a writer with a passion to carve out relatable and beautiful descriptions that give a voice to all the different kinds of experiences life offers us. I’ve always hoped that others could find their own unique story in my music, and thankfully I’ve had the opportunity to perform in many different venues since I was a young teenager.

Basic details

  • I will be singing all the songs 
  • For production I will collaborate with a producer from Soho Sonic Studios in London. Production includes arrangement, recording, instrumentation, mixing / mastering.
  • This campaign will cover the cost of 3 songs
  • This project will result in a digitally released EP
  • The production will require me to travel to London for approximately 10 days to record in the studio 

  • Portions of the production will be conducted remotely when possible

 

What is the need & what does it cover

My campaign goal: $12,000 for the studio production and digital release of 3 songs

  • The total cost covers the following: 
    • Producer
    • Studio time
    • Accompanying musicians
    • Travel (to London and transportation)
    • Digital distribution
    • Production begins January 2021 with an anticipated EP release by the end of Summer 2021

If I don't reach my full goal...

  • I will produce as many songs as possible with the amount of money raised. If I am not able to raise the minimum amount for 1 song, I will put the money aside, and conduct a future campaign to ensure the money is used for the music.

  • No matter what, the money will go toward song production; it just may not be on the same timeline as originally projected if there are not yet sufficient funds. 

 

Risks & Challenges

The reality is I’m kicking off this campaign during a very tense time in the world due to Covid and all the related difficulties. I don’t take this lightly. This presents a unique set of challenges beyond the usual. However, there are some practical solutions to manage the risks and challenges to help secure our success. 

A few key challenges:

  • Overall financial strain during challenging economic times leading to potential difficulty raising funds
  • Travel limitations because of covid that could affect my ability to record in London according to the timeline
  • I am a mother and work full-time. Time constraints are always a challenge when working on creative projects. 

 

Methods for managing challenges:

  • I will ensure my network is broad and diverse and focused not only on social media, but also email distribution to my own contacts and the contacts of others who are close to the project. I also have the ability to produce fewer songs if the full goal is not reached, which provides flexibility if indeed.
  • As of now, it is possible to travel to London and back to Israel by complying with specific requirements. I will monitor the situation far in advance leading up to scheduled travel to make necessary changes and arrangements if needed.
  • I have a support system in place to help with my children when I travel and I will use vacation days from work for both studio time and travel.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Thank you so much for taking an interest in my project. Another super valuable way you can help is by spreading the word. Here are easy ways you can do that:

  • Share on social media (see FB and link icons - top of page next to "back it" button)
  • Forward this information to some of your contacts who would be interested in new music
  • Follow me on social media (Facebook / Instagram)

A huge part of what makes this crowdsourcing option meaningful is how it brings us together and creates new partnerships in order to bring inspiration, creativity, and innovation into the world. Thank you for being part of my community. 

With love.

Forward this information to some of your contacts who would be interested in new music

story:
Short Summary

Our goal is to revive the music of Estatic Fear, a symphonic doom metal legend, with a 2 CD tribute album made by devoted bands and one-man-bands representing 15+ world countries.

Over 75% of the tracks are already recorded by late 2019. Every track that Estatic Fear ever released will be covered

Project supported by: international Estatic Fear fan community https://www.facebook.com/pg/EstaticFear/ and http://Doom-metal.com

Project approved by: Matthias Kogler and the original Estatic Fear's lineup and CCP Records

 

What We Need & What You Get

We started this campaign to cover the expenses of

A. professional mastering of the resulting material (23 tracks) by a sound engineer well experienced in symphonic doom metal mastering, estimated 800 USD

B. professional CD arts and booklet design, estimated 200 USD

C. paid target promotion of the album among symphonic doom fans over the Internet (Facebook, YouTube, VKontakte) over 3 months, estimated 100 USD
 

What you'll get is a professionally recorded and mastered double CD tribute to Estatic Fear. Our key principle is "made by symphonic doom metal fans for symphonic doom metal fans". Maximum musical quality and in-genre diversity ensured. To be released both on the Web and as physical CD copies.

Note: the donators will not receive physical copies of the tribute CDs, we can only provide you digital tracks after the release.

 

 

The Impact

Estatic Fear's two albums, only released in Austria two decades ago, plus some limited numbers released in Russia and South Korea, started a cult among symphonic doom metal fans globally.

Our mission is to breath a second life into this music, by reaching as many Estatic Fear and symphonic doom metal fans with this tribute as the original albums did over the decades, as physical copies or licensed digital copies, mp3s from torrents, or YouTube uploads.

Musicians from the following countries are featured on the tribute:
Serbia/Italy, South Korea, Canada, Iran, Norway, France, Argentina and Chile, Israel, Russia, USA, Ukraine, Mexico, Dominicana, Vietnam, North Macedonia, Turkey, United Kingdom, Morocco, Germany

 

Risks & Challenges

We addressed possible release risks by meeting the original albums' composer and all Estatic Fear original lineup members as well as CCP Records head Claus Prellinger (Estatic Fear's producer, copyright owner) and successfully obtaining the required covers release permissions from them.

We have found 6 wonderful doom metal labels (in Russia, Canada, China, UK) who are willing to release and distribute the resulting album  to any part of the world.

We want the resulting double CD album to spread far and wide via all available channels. For the sake of this immortal music and the truly global Estatic Fear fan community.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Please help us to spread the news about this campaign and the tribute project: translate the news into your language and make posts in your countries doom metal and symphonic metal communities - on Facebook, Badoo, VKontakte, YouTube, metal forums, portals and blogs, etc.

story:
We are starting a new, non-traditional music school in Olympia Washington!

-----------------------------------

Sound Studios Olympia is a non-profit school for private music instruction and public performance in all types of music.  Our vision focuses on creating the perfect environment for instructors and in turn, by attracting the best instructors, the best opportunities for our students.

How we are doing this:

Comfortable, safe teaching spaces for students and teachers.

Inspiring concert space,  for our students and instructors as well as other members of the community and touring artists.

Community advertising for  events.

Flat rate for instructors to rent studio space

Free use of the recital hall for teachers who work with us

Scheduling and billing assistance for teachers.

Study after study does show the benefits of music for growing children, and adults. Music teachers and small studios can bring this kind of benefit, here we are creating a teaching space which will also build the community - we learn music to share it.  We want a space where an instructor is given the opportunity to thrive and make a decent living doing what they love: helping young musicians explore their art. 

Why We Are Fundraising 

  • We are raising $5000 to help get us initially started to help cover the building deposit and expenses to prepare the space for teaching. We also need pianos for our performance spaces and teaching rooms.  

  • While we hope to reach or exceed our goal, our campaign is not all or nothing - your contributions will help us move this school forward. While we are excited about the building we are presently pursuing, we plan to open the school no matter what.

    We have some lovely perks - tickets for our events as well as some great SSO swag!

The Impact

Your contribution here will give us the forward momentum we need! We are a nonprofit charitable organization with only one goal: to bring the best music education to the Olympia area and put performances on in a great recital hall.

Risks & Challenges

Right now our biggest risk is not finding enough instructors who would like to take advantage of this opportunity, and have a studio in Sound Studios Olympia. We have several on board but need more. Donations help alleviate that concern, but we will still need to show our colleagues the benefits of working with us. Once we are open we will have many open houses to bring instructors in and we will hold several events and recitals to show the entire community how incredible this space is!

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that's all there is to it.

----------------------------------------------------

Tell people about us! Use Indiegogo share tools!
Tell music teachers to get a hold of us!
Let us know you'd like to volunteer!
Keep your eye out for our public concerts and plan to attend!

Thank you, please share this, please help us reach our goal.

story:
Listen to raw audio from the recent recording sessions

Short Summary

We need your help to mix, master and release our new album "Benediction."

Good Diction has been playing rhythm-and-blues-grass music together for five years in Minneapolis. We are a six-piece group with Peter Bodurtha (vocals, guitar), Julie Bodurtha (drums), Rob Martin (mandolin), Grant Adams (bass), Stacy Griffin (violin, vocals) and John Eckhardt (keys).  

Good Diction has composed a new album of Old Testament-inspired songs with the working title "Benediction." These are some of our best songs, including live favorites Esther, Saul and Samson.  We knew we wanted to record the album but we weren't sure if we could afford it or if the timing was right.

"I was really distraught about whether to do the album.  I really believed in the music but my responsibility impulse kicked in and thought about all the household projects I could do with the time and money.  When I was at church I saw a picture of Jesus walking out a door, saying, "I go immediately -- are you coming?" So I decided to jump -- let's do this album immediately."

- Peter, lead singer, Good Diction

We started recording August 14. This is a leap of faith. We need funds to get the album mixed, mastered, produced and released. With your help, this album will be the BEST ALBUM EVER.

We have nine songs we are already recording with Small Circus Studio and Studio 65.  Russel Munson of Small Circus will be mixing and helping us figure out the mastering -- the songs are turning out amazing!  We are really taking our time -- there's going to be horns, a string trio and the vocals will be perfect -- if you have liked anything Good Diction has done, you will LOVE this album.

Good Diction has self-produced and released three albums:  The Queen's English (2012), Good[er] Diction (2014) and Victory (2016).

What We Need & What You Get

What we need:

  • $2000 for mixing
  • $1000 for mastering
  • $500 for artwork, CDs and distribution
  • $1500 for limited run vinyl

Anything left over will go toward promoting the album (maybe you'll hear us on the radio!).

What you get:

  • $10: Good Diction's last album "Victory" and a digital download of one track from the new album
  • $25: CD and a digital download 
  • $50*: T-shirt, CD, digital album download, sticker, button
  • $100*: Same as $50 level plus either:
    • An invitation to an exclusive listening party with Good Diction OR
    • A free, 45-minute Skype concert with Peter Bodurtha where you pick the songs
  • $1000*: Choice of one of the below options, plus T-shirt, CD, digital album download, sticker, button:
    • Good Diction spends 2 hours cleaning your bathroom, mopping your floors, mowing your lawn, cleaning your refrigerator, doing your dishes, etc in costume while either singing or playing on a stereo the yet to be released album tracks (must live within 1 hour of the Twin Cities area)
    • Good Diction plays a show at your house or another place of your choosing (you can charge a cover)
    • Two one-hour piano lessons with Good Diction keyboard player John Eckhardt.

*Pledges at these levels will receive the bonus reward of a vinyl LP if we reach the $5000 goal. 

The Impact

If you own any of our previous albums, you know we take recording really seriously.  Our goal is to create something that people want to listen to over and over again.  If you've heard any of the new songs live, you know that they really stand out.  

Your contribution is essential to making Benediction happen. Every investment in this project promotes art and keeps bands like Good Diction making music. This isn't just about one album -- this is about cultivating creativity in our churches, cities and communities. Be a patron.

Risks & Challenges

There's a lot that can go wrong with any project, but we have finished three records already and we know how to put out a fourth. It will be a quality product and we hope it blesses our community.

This is about the music -- if 50 people hear this and get something from it, then that is a victory.  If someone hears it and starts writing music, that's a victory too. There are so many ways that an art project can influence a community.

Other Ways You Can Help

Keep track of our progress. When we release in 2017, share our posts about it on Facebook, email your friends about it, write an iTunes review, listen to it on Spotify. Your participation in the album helps us promote it. You can do a lot beyond your contributions!
story_txt:
Listen to raw audio from the recent recording sessions

Short Summary
We need your help to mix, master and release our new album "Benediction."
Good Diction has been playing rhythm-and-blues-grass music together for five years in Minneapolis. We are a six-piece group with Peter Bodurtha (vocals, guitar), Julie Bodurtha (drums), Rob Martin (mandolin), Grant Adams (bass), Stacy Griffin (violin, vocals) and John Eckhardt (keys).  
Good Diction has composed a new album of Old Testament-inspired songs with the working title "Benediction." These are some of our best songs, including live favorites Esther, Saul and Samson.  We knew we wanted to record the album but we weren't sure if we could afford it or if the timing was right.
"I was really distraught about whether to do the album.  I really believed in the music but my responsibility impulse kicked in and thought about all the household projects I could do with the time and money.  When I was at church I saw a picture of Jesus walking out a door, saying, "I go immediately -- are you coming?" So I decided to jump -- let's do this album immediately."
- Peter, lead singer, Good Diction
We started recording August 14. This is a leap of faith. We need funds to get the album mixed, mastered, produced and released. With your help, this album will be the BEST ALBUM EVER.
We have nine songs we are already recording with Small Circus Studio and Studio 65.  Russel Munson of Small Circus will be mixing and helping us figure out the mastering -- the songs are turning out amazing!  We are really taking our time -- there's going to be horns, a string trio and the vocals will be perfect -- if you have liked anything Good Diction has done, you will LOVE this album.

story:
Toronto's Goodnight, Sunrise goes to the UK!

This October we are crossing the pond for the first time ever during our album release tour and we need your help!  Throughout September we'll be raising money to help pay for the trip, and offering some pretty sweet perks along the way.  Here's our Sept/Oct tour schedule, supporting the release of our new album Falling Awake (out Sept. 30th):

So, why are we asking for $5,000?  Touring anywhere, let alone overseas, is expensive - we've toured Canada a ton and know the tricks to do it on the cheap, but our basic expenses just to get to the UK and move from show to show will be roughly:

  • Flights: $2,400
  • Van rental: $1,500
  • Gas: $800
  • Gear rentals: $1,000
  • Hotels: $1,500
  • Visas: $300
That alone totals $7,500, and there are sure to be a lot of smaller expenses that will add up, so if we surpass our goal every dollar/pound will still be very much needed!  We'll be paying for this trip no matter what because it's a really important stepping stone in our career, and we'll sell as many t-shirts as humanly possible, but straight up - it would help a LOT if we had some financial assistance.

We've got a wide range of perks to reward our supporters at various levels:

  • Smaller contributions will receive an advance digital copy of Falling Awake, our brand new LP being released on September 30th, and signed first pressing copies on CD are also available as well as our entire discography
  • Mid-range perks are more unique and personal, such as one-on-one drum lessons from Paul, a custom painting from Vanessa, or a miniature instrument sculpted by David.
  • You can also score a night out with the band at karaoke or an escape room!
  • We'll even play a house party for any high rollers in Toronto!
Finally, we genuinely appreciate any support that you give us, so we also want to spread the love and pay it forward.  Music is such a powerful positive force in our lives and we feel so lucky to be able to connect with other people through our records and live shows.  We believe so deeply in the healing power of music so we decided to donate 10% of whatever we raise to to the Canadian Music Therapy Trust Fund which you can learn more about below.

About the band...

Goodnight, Sunrise seamlessly blends anthemic indie pop with brooding synth rock, while the frenetic energy of the band breaks down the barriers between stage and audience. Honest and soulful lyrics pour out through the voices of David Kochberg (guitar) and Vanessa Vakharia (synth/keytar), with harmonies that ebb and flow with each other over the pulsing and thunderous rhythms of Paul Weaver (drums). 

Goodnight, Sunrise has played over 150 shows across Canada since 2011, including showcases at CMW, NxNE, TD Festival of Friends, Riverfest Elora, and has opened for bands such as Big Wreck, I Mother Earth, and Die Mannequin. The band's sound has evolved into a genre-bending mix ranging from Florence & The Machine to Muse, with elements of classic rock and dance. They have released 1 LP (Create/Destroy/Create, 2013) and 2 split-singles (D/V 1: Deaf Ears, 2013, and D/V 2: Bridgeburner, 2014), with their 2nd full-length album Falling Awake and due for release on Sept. 30th 2016 through Rejection Records.

About the Canadian Music Therapy Trust Fund...

The Canadian Music Therapy Trust Fund (CMTTF) exists to create access to music therapy for Canadians who need it most.

CMTTF bring music therapy and music therapists to rural, urban and remote communities from coast-to-coast through innovative programs and research projects. These initiatives range from interventions for autism, Alzheimer’s, anxiety and depression, fine-motor skills development, pre- and post-natal care, and brain injury, to name only a few.

CMTTF accomplish this by awarding clinical and research grants, scholarships and fellowships to innovative accredited music therapists who are then empowered to use their talents and expertise to make music therapy accessible within our communities.

story:
Hello Friends!

Earlier this year I released my "Sleepy Souls" music video dedicated to the Fortunate People's Facebook page for spreading peace and love. Amazingly, in just two weeks the video shot to over HALF A MILLION VIEWS!! Thanks to everyone involved in making the video and those of you who watched and shared it. Your response has been inspiring.

 

Music with a spiritual message

I've been involved in the music industry since the age of 15 and it has been a journey of self discovery. I've done many projects in different styles, worked with artists such as Robbie Williams and Mark Owen, but until now it wasn't clear to me what I should be doing with my music.

Recent experiences and realisations have helped me find my direction. I aim to give through my music by writing songs with a deep meaning, songs with a spiritual message that will inspire, transform and help us find the love that we are all looking for.

How you can help!

I’m raising £10, 000 to shoot 2 new music videos, record a 5 track EP which will include "Sleepy Souls", officially release this on iTunes, Spotify etc and of course, promote them all like crazy!!

If you enjoyed the Sleepy Souls video and you would like to see more, please donate what you can so we can get this material out to spread more peace and love!

Your kind contribution will go towards:

1. Recording songs

  • Mixing and mastering fees
  • Artwork costs
  • Promotional costs

2. Filming videos 

  • Location costs
  • Video editing fees

If we surpass our funding goal, extra funds will be used directly in support of promoting, touring and sharing the EP more widely. If we do not meet the target amount, every little still helps to bring the project further.

Other Ways You Can Help

Spread the word about this project - whether Facebook, Twitter, or word of mouth.

Lots of Love,

Jake

xxxx

story:
I came to NYC to study Jazz in 1999 and since then I haven't left this wonderful city. I’ve had the pleasure of performing traveling and recording with great bands and dear friends such as Guy Mendilow Ensemble, Pedro Giraudo Jazz Orchestra, Cocomama, El “ Negro” Hernandez and Concha Buika, Aquiles Baez, Marta Gomez, Mariela Franganillo Tango Company, Glamour Tango and Polly Ferman, Juancho Herrera, Yuri Juarez, Pepe Vazquez, Pablo Mayor y Folklore Urbano, La Cumbiamba Eneye, among others and with my own projects such as Alma y Luna and Tangolando.

Lluvia Fue (Chamber Tango)

After the death of a dear friend of mine and wonderful Tango pianist, Octavio Brunetti, whom has taught, inspired and motivated me to sing Tango, I decided to record this album as a Tribute to him. Through out these years I’ve been known in the New York Latin scene as a versatile singer who sings with different Latin bands all type of Latin American rhythms from Cuban, to Brazilian, Folkloric music from Argentina, Colombia, Venezuela, Peru, you name it. But each time I would sing a Tango, people would have a different reaction and come to me in tears, touched by this music. Would you call this, healing souls through Tango? I guess it was time for me to record a Tango CD that would make all these fans happy. So I did! And here I am in the final stage of this long and difficult process of recording and releasing a CD.

I’ve been a very lucky woman since I’ve had the great opportunity of working together with producer, pianist and arranger, Grammy Winner Fernando Otero.Fernando did a beautiful job of arranging these classic and contemporary Tangos for string quartet, piano, bandoneon and voice.

So…with your help, I will not only be able to finish and release this CD but I will make many fans happy and also give work to other people such as the videographer, photographer, sound engineers, musicians, designer, CD makers, etc.

If you are not able to help me financially or pre-order the CD, you could help me spread the word and this would also help a lot!!!!!

Thank you , thank you and more thank youuuus!!!

Musicians on the record:

Fernando Otero - piano

Pedro Giraudo - bass

Nick Danielson- violin

Adam Fischer- cello

Yuri Juarez- guitar

Adam Tully- guitar

Omar Massa- bandoneon

 

Ahora en español.......

Vine a Nueva York en 1999 a estudiar Jazz y desde ese entonces no me he ido de esta ciudad tan alucinante. He tenido el placer de cantar, viajar y grabar con artistas y bandas como Guy Mendilow Ensemble, Pedro Giraudo Jazz Orchestra, Cocomama, El “ Negro” Hernandez, Aquiles Baez, Marta Gomez, Mariela Franganillo Tango Company, Glamour Tango and Polly Ferman, Juancho Herrera, Yuri Juarez, Pepe Vazquez, Pablo Mayor y Folklore Urbano, La Cumbiamba Eneye, entre otros y ,mis proyectos Alma y Luna y Tangolando.

Lluvia Fue ( Chamber Tango)

Luego de la muerte de un querido amigo y gran pianista, Octavio Brunetti, quien me enseñó, inspiró y motivó a que cantara Tangos, decidí grabar éste disco en tributo a él. Durante todos estos años he sido conocida como una cantante versátil que canta con muchas bandas de música latino americana desde música cubana, brasilera, folklore argentino, venezolano, colombiano, peruano, etc. Pero cada vez que cantaba un tango la gente tenia una reacción diferente, venían a agradecerme con lagrimas en los ojos y a decirme que les había tocado el corazón con esos tangos. Se podría decir que esto es curar almas a través del Tango? Supuse que era momento de grabar un disco de Tangos con el cual pudiera hacer feliz a todos estas personas. Así que finalmente lo hice. Estoy en la etapa final de este proceso largo y difícil de grabación y lanzamiento de un disco.

He sido una mujer afortunada ya que pude trabajar con el productor, pianista, arreglador, y compositor, ganador de los premios Grammy , Fernando Otero. Fernando a hecho un hermoso trabajo de arreglos de tangos clásicos y contemporáneos para cuarteto de cuerdas con bandoneon, piano y voz.

Entonces....con la ayuda de ustedes no solo podré terminar mi disco sino que también podré hacer feliz a muchos fans que tanto querian este disco y podré darle trabajo a todo el equipo que ha hecho y hará posible que este producto salga a la industria, desde el videógrafo, fotógrafo,diseñador, musicos, ingenieros de sonido, etc

Si no pueden ayudarme financieramente o pre ordenar el disco,  pueden "correr la voz" y compartir esta campaña con otras personas, lo cual me ayudara un montón!!!!

Gracias, gracias y más gracias! 

Musicos en el disco

Fernando Otero - piano

Pedro Giraudo - bass

Nick Danielson- violin

Adam Fischer- cello

Yuri Juarez- guitar

Adam Tully- guitar

Omar Massa- bandoneon

Fernando a hecho un hermoso trabajo de arreglos de tangos clásicos y contemporáneos para cuarteto de cuerdas con bandoneon, piano y voz.Entonces....con la ayuda de ustedes no solo podré terminar mi disco sino que también podré hacer feliz a muchos fans que tanto querian este disco y podré darle trabajo a todo el equipo que ha hecho y hará posible que este producto salga a la industria, desde el videógrafo, fotógrafo,diseñador, musicos, ingenieros de sonido, etcSi no pueden ayudarme financieramente o pre ordenar el disco,  pueden "correr la voz" y compartir esta campaña con otras personas, lo cual me ayudara un montón!!!!Gracias, gracias y más gracias! Musicos en el discoFernando Otero - pianoPedro Giraudo - bassNick Danielson- violinAdam Fischer- celloYuri Juarez- guitarAdam Tully- guitarOmar Massa- bandoneon

story:
Hi everyone!

Thanks for checking out my campaign! I'm really very excited to be recording an album! I've always wanted to and now I get to play all the instruments and have all the fun. :)

 I've met so many wonderful people at stage doors in the West End and at theatres all over the world and so many of you have asked me when I'll be going into the studio. Well with your help... right now! I feel incredibly lucky to have such support from everybody and together we can make this album happen.

I’m really looking forward to recording some of my favourite songs, many of which feature in shows I've been in so I'm sure you will recognise more than one or two. Theres going to be a real mixture of rock and roll, boogie woogie and some slower more romantic songs as well. 

This is where you come in!

So usually when recording an album a record label gives an artist an “advance” to pay for all the costs involved. This would include things like, studio time, paying musicians for their performances, engineers, producers, mixing, mastering, album artwork, and even pays for the cost of producing the CD or vinyl.

With this campaign, I am inviting you to be personally involved from the very start. By investing in my project you are creating the "advance" which will allow me to make an amazing album with high production values. 

Every penny you pledge will go towards the production of the album and cover all the costs involved. The more we can raise, the better the album will be!

There are some fantastic perks, I hope you agree! Signed guitars, music lessons, guitar picks,VIP tickets, personal gigs at your house... have a browse and pick your favourites! I've designed them to give you the best experience I can - the best bang for your buck. So lets have some fun!

I have everything lined up, all ready to go and I'm aiming to have the album recorded, produced and available before I go on tour with Million Dollar Quartet in September 2016.  As with everything, things may go wrong and there may be delays but I have been planning this for a very long time and I am confident you will have your album (perks and all) in your hand before I go on the road.


REMEMBER! There is a very, very simple way you can help spread the word about my campaign. Please, please, please SHARE this video! Share my website www.mattwycliffe.com, share this campaign use the Indiegogo share tools and Like, retweet and share everything I do on social media!  Its all about exposure, It only takes a second and doesn't cost a penny but your share could reach someone who can really help me make this a reality.

Thank you again for all of your support, this is one of the most exciting things I’ve ever done and with your help it WILL happen.

THANKYOU!

Matt

:)
story_txt:
Hi everyone!

Thanks for checking out my campaign! I'm really very excited to be recording an album! I've always wanted to and now I get to play all the instruments and have all the fun. :)
 I've met so many wonderful people at stage doors in the West End and at theatres all over the world and so many of you have asked me when I'll be going into the studio. Well with your help... right now! I feel incredibly lucky to have such support from everybody and together we can make this album happen.
I’m really looking forward to recording some of my favourite songs, many of which feature in shows I've been in so I'm sure you will recognise more than one or two. Theres going to be a real mixture of rock and roll, boogie woogie and some slower more romantic songs as well. 
 
This is where you come in!
So usually when recording an album a record label gives an artist an “advance” to pay for all the costs involved. This would include things like, studio time, paying musicians for their performances, engineers, producers, mixing, mastering, album artwork, and even pays for the cost of producing the CD or vinyl.With this campaign, I am inviting you to be personally involved from the very start. By investing in my project you are creating the "advance" which will allow me to make an amazing album with high production values. Every penny you pledge will go towards the production of the album and cover all the costs involved. The more we can raise, the better the album will be!There are some fantastic perks, I hope you agree! Signed guitars, music lessons, guitar picks,VIP tickets, personal gigs at your house... have a browse and pick your favourites! I've designed them to give you the best experience I can - the best bang for your buck. So lets have some fun!I have everything lined up, all ready to go and I'm aiming to have the album recorded, produced and available before I go on tour with Million Dollar Quartet in September 2016.  As with everything, things may go wrong and there may be delays but I have been planning this for a very long time and I am confident you will have your album (perks and all) in your hand before I go on the road.
    

REMEMBER! There is a very, very simple way you can help spread the word about my campaign. Please, please, please SHARE this video! Share my website www.mattwycliffe.com, share this campaign use the Indiegogo share tools and Like, retweet and share everything I do on social media!  Its all about exposure, It only takes a second and doesn't cost a penny but your share could reach someone who can really help me make this a reality.
Thank you again for all of your support, this is one of the most exciting things I’ve ever done and with your help it WILL happen.
THANKYOU!
Matt
:)

story:
About Our Project

The Songs For Scotland 2 project will be a celebration of Scotland's rich musical heritage, among the finest on the planet. It will also (post Brexit) be a reaffirmation of Scotland's drive to become an independent nation within the EU. As well, we're aiming to raise seed capital for a fund to support youth musical education, the Alasdair Gray Musical Scholarship Trust.

If we are VERY successful, we want to stage a musical event in November beneath Alasdair’s 'Weegie Sistine Chapel Ceiling', at the Oran Mor. We know we can do these things, because we’ve done them before (in 2014) — but we can't do them if you don't pitch in and help.

Songs for Scotland 2 has three components:

First, we are creating an AMAZING compilation album of Scottish songs from all over the map: genres include Folk/Trad, Hip hop, Pop, Jazz, spoken word, Reggae and Classical, it’s all there, in 20 glorious, carefully selected tracks. Languages include Scots, Gaelic, English — even Wolof (a language of Senegal). So what’s the unifying theme? Alasdair inscribed it on the central beam spanning his ceiling mural in the Oran Mor: ‘Work as if you live in the early days of a better nation.’ 

Leading Scottish artists and musicians who have contributed tracks and are supporting the project include Allan MacDonald and Neil Johnstone with Griogair Labruidh, Matt Seattle with Robert McFall and members of the Scottish Chamber Orchestra, Woodenbox, Stanley Odd and Loki, Emily Smith, Dean Owens, Karen Matheson, Shona Donaldson, Dick Gaughan, Kathleen MacInnes, Eddie Reid, Samba Sene and Diwan, and Brina and Kieran Murray.

Secondly, Alasdair is supporting us, in part because he wishes to 'give forward', by helping us to set up an Alasdair Gray Musical Scholarship Trust (to be administered by Hands up for Trad, a registered charity and music umbrella group). He has explicitly granted us permission to name this fund for him.

Thirdly, we have pencilled the Oran Mor auditorium for a day in November, and want to stage a live musical event at which a first scholarship will be awarded. But to do this, we’ll need to exceed our funding target by £1500. 

So what’s the big picture?

Throughout his storied career Alasdair has spoken for the idea of civic nationalism; the belief that a country (as Scotland is) should be democratically governed by the people who live in it, whatever language they speak, wherever they come from and whatever their background. Moreover, he has energetically advocated the idea that 'small nations can work well'; as examples, Norway, Denmark, Holland, New Zealand -- and soon, Scotland.

The album of songs we're creating will both musically express and affirm these ideas; and as well, it will demonstrate to the world our continuing determination to create a peaceable, equitable, free, democratic and independent nation here, in our Scotland.

Our Team

Our team comprises the artists who've contributed to the album, people working at Scottish record companies and agencies based in Edinburgh, Glasgow and elsewhere, and others.

Where do we hail from? We are from everywhere: mainly from Scotland, but also from England and Sweden, Jamaica and Canada, even from Galicia. What unites us is our love for Scottish music and culture, our admiration for Alasdair and his work, and our shared desire for Scottish independence.

We're working closely with Hands up for Trad, who'll be administering the youth scholarship fund; and also with The National, Scotland's only daily pro-independence newspaper. The National will be featuring some of the artists who've joined the project in a series of articles they'll be running in the coming weeks. The National, we thank you!

 

 

What We Need

We need to raise £8500, minimum. 

Once we've met the core costs of producing the album, the funds we raise beyond that up to the £8500 level will serve as seed funding for an Alasdair Gray Musical Scholarship Trust.

If we overshoot our target, we'll stage a musical event at the Oran Mor, to feature artists from the album. Contributors at £50 and up will enter for free and receive a project perk as a gift on the night.

Perks for supporting our campaign

Our perks are amazing! Support our campaign, and you'll be taking home a piece of Scotland's musical and fine art heritage.

The Digital Album

Contributors at the £10 level will receive a digital download of Native Musicians: Songs for Scotland 2, good for endless hours of inspiration and listening pleasure.

Fine art postcards and 'Possible Nation' tee shirts!

We are also offering sets of three lovingly produced postcards, full colour on two sides, featuring the three works that Alasdair has licensed to us; and also, tee shirts featuring his 'Is Scotland a Possible Nation?' image -- as far as we know the VERY FIRST EVER wearable Alasdair Gray art! Tee shirts come in whatever size suits you, in black or white, ladies, mens or kids sizes.

 

 

Mugs and Totes!

Two of Alasdair Gray's most iconic images are available as mugs or totes. Choose from a 'Possible Nation' or a 'Native Musicians' mug, or snap up a bagpiping Lion Rampant 'Scotland the Brave' tote. You won't be able to get these perks anywhere else. These are truly special images.

 

Fine Art Prints

To reward major project sponsors, we are honoured to be able to offer a group of signed, fine art silkscreened prints by Alasdair Gray.

The Star was created as an illustration to Alasdair's short story of the same name. He wrote it when he was 16, and the story with this illustration published in 1984 in 'Unlikely Stories, Mostly'.

Dimensions: 28cm x 19cm. Signed and dated 2005. One of 125.

From an Eastern Empire illustrated the story of the same name, which published in, 'Unlikely Stories, Mostly', in 1984. Silkscreen print, unframed and signed.

Dimensions 38cm x 24.5cm. Signed and dated 1984. One of 200.

Is Scotland a Possible Nation? was designed by Alasdair in 2014 for the National Collective ('Artists and Creatives for Independence'). It features his 'lucky dogs' image (also present in the Hillhead Subway Mural), which was originally designed as a logo for the Dog and Bone Press, in 1990.  Silkscreen print, unframed. 

Dimensions 69cm x 53.5cm. Signed and dated. One of 60.

... and now our new print, The White Dog.

Please pitch in! 

Our programme is ambitious.

We're aiming to create a pan Scottish — even global — collaborative cultural event to showcase the finest in Scottish music. The first Songs for Scotland album was a musical portrait of Scotland during the 2014 indyref that is still being appreciated by music lovers around the world. This sequel compilation will also be a musical portrait, of Scotland post Brexit and in the lead up to indy ref 2.

We're also raising seed funding for an Alasdair Gray Musical Scholarship Trust. Let's all give forward by helping to fund the training of a new generation of brilliant Scottish musicians. It’s worth noting that we are also applying to various charitable trusts to bulk up this funding — your small contribution can help us to leverage large sums from elsewhere.

And finally, we want to have a musical event in November beneath the murals at the Oran Mor (Scotland’s largest public artwork) to award a first scholarship and to honour Alasdair. To us it is a given that living the dictum, ‘Work as if you live in the early days of a better nation’, must also include honouring our visionaries.

If you can support us financially — brilliant! Thank you. If you can’t, you can still help by spreading the word. In this day and age, a better nation is built one tweet at a time. Join us on Facebook, on Twitter and on Instagram, and use Indiegogo's share tools to help us get our message out. 

Thank you!

'All art constantly aspires towards the condition of music.' -- Walter Pater

story:
Who we are

 Dear friends, fans and music lovers! We have been in the studio working on our new album and we are reaching out for support to help complete it. Here’s your chance to pre-order our new CD and show your support!

RagTop is the Roanoke, Virginia based signature cover acoustic duo of Jim and Renee Oliphant. We perform Folk Rock, Classic Rock, New Country, Blues and R&B and classic American Standards with earthy, acoustic styling focusing on the signature riffs and melodies that make your favorite songs memorable while keeping the arrangements organic, smooth and richly expressive!

We have been a favorite on Regional TV in SW Virginia appearing regularly on Channel 10 NBC Roanoke, VA and WSET TV Channel 13 Lynchburg, VA and has also appeared on WJHL TV channel 11 CBS Johnson City, TN and radio programs including 96.3 FM/1370 AM Austin, TX - WUVT Virginia Tech Blacksburg, VA - WVRU Radford University, Radford, VA and BlogTalk Radio and we perform nearly 200 shows a year!

Here is what people are saying about RagTop:


"RagTop is an excellent example of artists that send you back in time with their renditions of tunes we all grew up with. Always passionate with their performances and guaranteed to make you follow them."
-Art Mendoza/Accomplice Entertainment Austin, TX (partner with Grammy Award winning producer Lawrence Cohn)

 

This is a video clip of Renee working on the vocal overdubs for our arrangement of "Wicked Game". Jim has finished all of the guitar parts. We perform this song live by looping the rhythm and bass and then Jim can add more rhythm and lead riffs throughout the song.  The studio affords us the opportunity to have even more fun with Renee's vocals.  This is the raw track (no reverb, level mixing or any effects - just vocals). We can't wait for you to hear the finished song! Hope you enjoy this sample for now!

 

RagTop Route 460 CD

The concept of this CD is based on State Highway Route 460 in our home state - Virginia. We were driving Eastbound on Route 460 out of Roanoke, VA to a show one day and were talking about how many hours we have spent on this highway traveling to our performances over the last several years. It just seemed an appropriate tribute to name our new CD  "Route 460".

The songs we select for the CD  are the core of the concept - we have completed six songs for the project to date. Our goal is to complete at least 12 songs for the CD. The songs capture the distinct vibe of RagTop.

As we began to develop the cover art - keeping the concept in mind - we thought that a restored vintage 50s - early 60s gas station would be perfect. The vintage station used for our cover art is located on Williamson Rd in Roanoke, VA - with the photo shoot completed and some photo editing - the cover art was complete.

 

                                            

                                                        RagTop Route 460 CD Cover

 

How You Can Help and What Your Money Will Go Towards:

We have been working in the studio and already recorded the first six songs. We also have finished the artwork for the CD. To complete this rest of this project we need to raise $3,200.00. The process of recording and creating a finished album is expensive. The costs include recording (studio time) , mixing, mastering, artwork, pressing and packaging the CDs.

We've put together some awesome perk packages to offer you for your contributions, such as album downloads, social media shout-outs, signed CDs and posters, RagTop t-shirts, a private house concert and a day in the studio with us! Throughout the campaign, we will also be updating contributors on the recording as it unfolds.

 

                                        

                                             Check out the NEW RagTop tee shirts!        

                                                               

                                                              RagTop Vinyl stickers

 

You can select a "Perk Package" in the right-hand column or if you would rather contribute without receiving a perk, use the big pink  button at the top of the page and enter your amount!

Should we be fortunate enough to surpass our goal, we will use the additional funding for additional marketing, pressing additional CDs and promotion of the new CD.

When you give to this campaign, your funds are directly supporting the recording, mixing, mastering, CD pressing and packaging of the latest RagTop CD.

 

    

 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

We are immensely grateful for everyone willing to help us, emotionally and financially, pursue what we love. We couldn’t realistically do any of this without the love and support from all of you. Both of us are eager to see what the following months and years hold and are excited to share it will you all. In case you forget exactly why you gave RagTop any of your hard earned money, we’ll be documenting the process start to finish. From the beginning to post-production bliss, we’ll keep y’all in the loop with plenty of pictures and videos along the way.

We understand that some people can’t give financially, but that doesn’t mean you can’t contribute. If you feel so inclined, please share this page with friends and family and on social media (use the Indiegogo share tools located next to the big pink "BACK IT" button on the top right hand side of the page to share it on your favorite social media)! Thank you so much for your contributions and interest as we embark on this journey. It’s your journey too, so stay in touch.

Thank you for your help and we look forward to sharing the new record with you!

story:
Salutations cordiales!

Dès décembre, Perdrix entamera l'enregistrement de son tout premier opus Rock poutine, avec nul autre que Navet Confit à la réalisation.

*cris de joie*

Mais qu'est-ce que le rock poutine? Si on mélange de la grosse frite rock avec de la sauce aux champignons psychédéliques et qu'on nappe ça de fromage pop (juste assez, on vous promet), ça donne LE plat de résistance de 2017, un nouveau met national que même Gordon Ramsay ne pourra dédaigner.

Pour ne rien vous cacher, l'enregistrement d'un album est un processus chronophage, énergivore, périlleux, édifiant... et coûteux. Créer de la musique permet rarement de vivre sans souci financier… Mais nous sommes très enthousiastes à l'idée de lancer le fruit de notre créativité sur plein de murs (on a du visou)!

À la fin du mois d’octobre 2016, nous avons fait paraître deux chansons qui seront présentes sur l'album, soit Bye Bye Hymen et Star Laundromat. Ci-haut, on peut écouter le vidéoclip pour Star Laundromat, réalisé par Al Nadeau-Farley. C’est pour vous donner un aperçu du virage qu’on aimerait prendre avec Rock poutine.

Nous aimerions amasser autour de 6000$, une somme relativement modeste pour un tel projet.

Cet argent servira à payer l’enregistrement, le mixage, le matriçage, à couvrir les frais de promotion (location d’une salle pour le lancement, impression d’affiches, graphisme, diffusion), à produire de la merch (marchandise dérivée), à imprimer des albums CD (un vinyle pour les amoureux des beaux objets, si le montant amassé est suffisant) et à payer des musciens invités, notamment. En considérant les frais afférents qui vont avec le fait d’avoir un groupe (transport, nourriture, équipement), 6000$ s’avère être une somme très raisonnable qui nous permettra de mener notre projet à bien.

On vous invite chaudement à nous aider! À droite, il y a une liste de “perks”  (gracieuseté d’indiegogo), des petits merci tout gentils qu’on vous offre en échange d’une contribution financière. Notre poutine est excellente. Le reste le sera aussi, promis.

http://perdrix.bandcamp.com/
https://www.facebook.com/perdrixband/

P.S. 1000 merci d’avance.
P.P.S: je t’aime.
story_txt: Salutations cordiales!Dès décembre, Perdrix entamera l'enregistrement de son tout premier opus Rock poutine, avec nul autre que Navet Confit à la réalisation.*cris de joie*Mais qu'est-ce que le rock poutine? Si on mélange de la grosse frite rock avec de la sauce aux champignons psychédéliques et qu'on nappe ça de fromage pop (juste assez, on vous promet), ça donne LE plat de résistance de 2017, un nouveau met national que même Gordon Ramsay ne pourra dédaigner.Pour ne rien vous cacher, l'enregistrement d'un album est un processus chronophage, énergivore, périlleux, édifiant... et coûteux. Créer de la musique permet rarement de vivre sans souci financier… Mais nous sommes très enthousiastes à l'idée de lancer le fruit de notre créativité sur plein de murs (on a du visou)!À la fin du mois d’octobre 2016, nous avons fait paraître deux chansons qui seront présentes sur l'album, soit Bye Bye Hymen et Star Laundromat. Ci-haut, on peut écouter le vidéoclip pour Star Laundromat, réalisé par Al Nadeau-Farley. C’est pour vous donner un aperçu du virage qu’on aimerait prendre avec Rock poutine.Nous aimerions amasser autour de 6000$, une somme relativement modeste pour un tel projet.Cet argent servira à payer l’enregistrement, le mixage, le matriçage, à couvrir les frais de promotion (location d’une salle pour le lancement, impression d’affiches, graphisme, diffusion), à produire de la merch (marchandise dérivée), à imprimer des albums CD (un vinyle pour les amoureux des beaux objets, si le montant amassé est suffisant) et à payer des musciens invités, notamment. En considérant les frais afférents qui vont avec le fait d’avoir un groupe (transport, nourriture, équipement), 6000$ s’avère être une somme très raisonnable qui nous permettra de mener notre projet à bien.On vous invite chaudement à nous aider! À droite, il y a une liste de “perks”  (gracieuseté d’indiegogo), des petits merci tout gentils qu’on vous offre en échange d’une contribution financière. Notre poutine est excellente. Le reste le sera aussi, promis.http://perdrix.bandcamp.com/https://www.facebook.com/perdrixband/P.S. 1000 merci d’avance.P.P.S: je t’aime.

story:
My name is Clifton Anderson. I'm a professional independent Jazz musician - trombonist, composer, producer, arranger and recording artist. As a veteran in the music industry I have performed leading my own groups and worked with some of the greatest names in the music business. I've managed a record label, merchandise company and produced 8 CD's (5 products for other artists) for the worldwide market. I have released 3 highly acclaimed CD's,under my own name, the latest voted "One Of The Top Jazz Releases Of 2012".  I'm here to ask for your assistance in helping me release my 4th recording.

  

This new undertaking called "Been Down This Road Before" is a recording project long overdue. My last CD, "And So We Carry On" was released in 2012 and received critical acclaim for it's performances and compositions. Before that In 2007 I released "Decade" and 10 years prior, in 1997 my 1st CD "Landmarks". The long stretch between recordings occurred because I self funded. This time I decided not to only rely on my own funds, but to ask you to help me deliver a great new recording. Without your help it could take another year or two for me to save the money, but the music is ready now, and the timing is right.

I've "Been Down This Road Before", as an independent artist with great new original music just begging to be recorded, but without the finances to make it happen. I'm frequently asked, why don't you record more often?  Well, it's become increasingly more difficult for indie artists like myself to successfully finance & produce new recordings without additional financial support. That needed support comes from contributors like you & that's why it's so important for me to have your support & participation. I am constantly evolving my art and the new music for this project is in my opinion my best work yet. The music for "Been Down This Road Before" reflects an aspect of the human experience everyone can relate to. I know it will be a source of enjoyment and satisfy listeners both spiritually and intellectually for years to come. In short, this is music with substance.  In addition to those elements, I have a pool of some of the most talented and world renowned musicians that are ready to participate along with relationships with top studios, engineers, radio and publicity people. I can't wait to present "Been Down This Road Before to my fans and to the rest of the world, so please get in on the campaign by contributing whatever you can, and look at the perks available for the different levels of contributions. Those of you that simply can't donate any funds right now can still contribute immensely by spreading the word about it and sharing the campaign with your friends on social media. You can rest assured that all of your contributions will go directly to the costs of recording, mixing, mastering, packaging and promoting the music. I'm requesting $15,000.00 but hope to exceed that amount since it will require considerably more money than that to finish the project. If for any reason I don't reach the 15K goal, whatever funds have been contributed will start me along the recording process I'm committed to finishing. When all is done I'm sure you, as a contributor will be very happy and proud to have been part of this campaign effort and distinctive recording release.

Best Wishes Always,

and

Thank You In Advance For Your Contributions and Efforts!

Clifton

story:
Cher ami, chère amie, chers amis d’amis

Je viens vers vous  pour vous proposer de soutenir la création de l'activité Lunasoleil.

Création d’événements dans le domaine musical, artistique et touristique.

Qui suis-je ?

Je m’appelle Patrick Dhersin.  

J’ai plus de vingt ans d’expériences dans la vie associative et, ces quatre dernières années, j’ai organisé et contribué à plus de cinquante concerts et événements au sein d'associations diverses.

J’ai aussi animé de nombreuses ballades de découverte de la nature, dans différentes régions pour différentes associations.

Actuellement au chômage depuis sept ans, j’ai décidé de créer mon entreprise.

Vous  le savez peut-être, j’aime créer des événements qui font vibrer les cœurs dans des lieux atypiques et naturels. J’aime relier les gens à travers la musique et les excursions dans des lieux magiques.

Dans mes ballades, je fais découvrir des lieux avec un autre regard, plus intérieur et plus enfantin.

Quant à la musique, J’aime également partager mes découvertes de nouveaux talents pour le bien-être et la reliance des cœurs.

Les prestations que je propose

Organiser des concerts et spectacles dans des lieux atypiques, naturels ou conventionnels.

Organiser des concerts et spectacles privés chez des particuliers.

Organiser des concerts et spectacles pour des institutions et associations (hôpitaux, maisons de retraite, prisons, etc. ...)

Organiser et créer de nouveaux concepts culturels en lien avec différents artistes.

Organisation de ballades et de séjours touristiques, à la découverte de lieux magiques avec un « autre regard » et la connexion avec la nature, dans des lieux historiques et à la rencontre d’artisans locaux.

Mes besoins

Pour me lancer dans l’aventure de la création de la micro entreprise Lunasoleil, j’ai besoin de la somme de 6000 €.

Cette somme va me permettre :

L’achat de matériels  informatique : 600 €

L’achat d un véhicule d’occasion : 2500 €

Et un fond de trésorerie pour la création des premiers événements : imprimerie ,cachet des artiste, salle etc  : 2900 €.

merci de faire suivre a vous ami(e)
