story:
Hello Dear People!

I am raising funds to record the songs that I have written over the last 8 years, and really give them their full treatment of upright bass, cello, percussion, piano, harmonies, and more. We will be recording at home, but need your help to cover our costs.

For a sample of what we did before, listen below. I learned a lot through this process, and this time we will mix and master professionally. 

 https://galenhefferman.bandcamp.com/releases 

Thank you to Jahnavi Veronica for filming this entire video and for your relentless patience with my camera avoidance. 

Here is Jahnavi's Music:

https://jahnaviveronicamusic.bandcamp.com/releases

 

I write songs that both come from and hopefully, bring people into the dreamworld. I write songs from starry skies, from stone halls in dreams, from grief and pain, from relief, from all that is living and for all that is living. I write songs to inspire people to serve the living earth and live to their greatest and deepest purpose. I write songs because they start to pour out of me anyway if I don't. 

In the Spring of 2018, after a long bout of strange and seemingly unfortunate events, I had a totaled car and tendonitis in my left hand, which left me unable to work or play stringed instruments. This led me into a deep process of asking questions about what I really came here to do, and by the end of the summer, I had experienced a number of visions detailing to me what I was to be doing:

I was to tour down the West Coast alone, with no recognition or recorded work, playing shows at little venues in, as it turned out, places that were dear to me as I was growing up, and building altars to the living earth, to remind people that we all come from vibrant living, singing, breathing history and cultures.

With friends and family's help, I gathered enough funds to have a little place to sleep on the road, and a couple things to make videos in nature, and some extra funds to pay for gas and expenses. The entire tour sent me through a process of growing up and reflecting on how important it is to share what you have deeply inside you. It kicked off a summer of travel that lasted from April until October, and led Jahnavi Veronica (who joined me along the way) and I to share our music at venues and festivals from Washington, to Arizona, from Oregon Country Fair, to studying Persian Radif in New Mexico.  In September we had a short break between travels, and recorded two little EPs at home in three days.
 

By the time October came around, we landed back in Portland, immediately had to move to a new place, and planned a Winter Solstice Ritual Concert that involved some 20 people, all centered around a beautiful mandala of living plants, meant to focalize and call in energy for life to come. 

Here's the poster for that show by Jahnavi and I. 

https://www.facebook.com/events/429118867999985...

 

So here I am, asking for some help to record this album. I know better than ever how to create something on a shoestring budget, but I need support to get closer to the sound that I hear in my head.

 

What We Need & What You Get

We will record this album of 11-15 songs at my family's home in Portland, (the rooms sound fantastic, wood floors and high ceilings and all) so there will be no studio rental. 

Here's the Breakdown of our Costs: 

$3,000: Paying Alisdair Lee (an awesome local sound engineer) for mixing and mastering 15 songs. He charges $200 per song. (It takes him all day to mix and master one song)

$150: Coaching sessions with Alisdair on proper mic placement and recording techniques. (Some already completed, will need one more while we are recording)

$2,180-$3,350: Paying all the musicians and one engineer, (excluding myself, I am not asking to be compensated for my time) $60-$100/day for their time.

$700-$1250: New Microphone: AT4050 or Soundelux U195
I am already funded to purchase a Focusrite Clarett 4pre, an ART two channel Preamp with tube replacements, and an ART Tube Compressor with tube replacements, so I just need help with another microphone! These things are all an investment into future recordings of myself, friends and family, and others. 

$1,500: Printing Costs for 1,000 CDs and a lyric book with artwork and stories.  

$150: Album art photography and design. We are doing most of it ourselves, but may need to hire a friend to help us with some rope assisted tree climbing. (I'll leave it at that at the moment.)

$30: Costs for putting the Album on all the relevant platforms (spotify, itunes, etc) through CD Baby. 

$200: Extra Costs towards my rent while I am not able to do other work. As I said, I am not raising funds to be paid for my time, so this is the only personal cost I am including.

$800-$1000: Indiegogo Platform fees and processing fees. (about 10%) 
This is standard for all platforms like this.

$200-$450: Since this platform counts shipping costs towards my amount raised, I am adding estimated shipping costs onto my goal, $200-$500, although I am not sure how much this will cost, as it is impossible to calculate who will purchase what. If shipping costs are less than this, I will add this amount raised to paying others up to the $100/day mark, or adding more on to Alisdair's payment. 

Total Costs: 

$8,910-$11,080

 

A note on shipping outside of the U.S:

If you live outside of the United States, shipping packages to you is highly variable in cost. 

I cannot include these costs in my goal without raising the goal radically, so if you want to buy a physical item and you live outside of the USA, please contact me directly!

Also: If you live in Portland, Oregon or nearby, I would very much prefer to meet with you in person to give you your perks! This radically reduces the cost of shipping things to you, which is expensive for people without larger companies.
 

Stretch Goals 

At $13,780, $2,700 past our $11,080 maximum goal, we will be able to do a run of Vinyl! (200 Copies) I will add this as another perk for those of you that want it. 

If we are able to raise our minimum goal of $8,910, we will be able to record, mix, master, and print CDs and album artwork, and get them out to y'all, and pay those playing on the album, with no stress. 
At $11,080, we will be able to pay everyone playing $100/day, and get a higher quality mic to record with. 

 

Why I chose flexible funding (and Risks)

This album is happening no matter what. I will not risk an all or nothing format, because I know that we will be able to fulfill the perks and get CDs to you all no matter what. I am in conversation with the people I am working with about this, and whatever we are able to raise, we will work with. We are used to doing everything DIY, so that would be nothing new. 

If we don't reach our goal, here is what could happen: 

-We could have to print the CDs/books ourselves to fulfill the perks. (We've done it before)

-The release of the album could be delayed, by as much as a month. 

-We could have to pay Alisdair a lower price than his asking price (We will do our very best to keep this from happening)

-Artists could be paid at the minimum of what I am asking. (This however is first priority for me)

 

Jahnavi and I were able to record our two little eps in the living room in a week, with a budget of about two hundred dollars, so imagine what we could do if we actually had the funds available to record, mix, and master properly!

 

If we are able to get this project off the ground, we will be able to put out something that is able to stand alongside more "professional" artists that are out there, and you will have a recording of music that has literally kept me alive at points to accompany you through your life, in moments of deepest grief and in ecstatic joy as well. 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you love this music and are excited for it to get out there, but you are, like so many of us, just getting by on what you have, no worries, I understand! 

I would love it if you could:

-Share this fundraiser with your friends who might be interested by personal message, or in person! 

-Tell your friends about my music! 

-Share this campaign with your friends on social media with whatever kind words you can muster. 

Become a monthly supporter on My Patreon (It has helped me pay rent and feed myself at certain points, and it covered printing costs for the Solstice Show poster!) 
https://www.patreon.com/galenhefferman

Website: 

www.galenhefferman.com

 

I carry so much gratitude in my heart,

to those of you that asked to hear my music in the beginning of this journey, learned and played my songs, participated as fellow musician or audience member, given me tips for where to play, told people about my music, given me inroads to festivals, contributed to my Patreon or helped me start up touring last year, to all those that love and care for me, and to all of you doing your best to be a beacon of kindness in this strange world.

I know that if I were not encouraged, cared for, and loved, and if it were not for music, I may not be alive today. I owe more gratitude than I could possibly articulate to all of my teachers, human and plant and animal and inter-dimensional being alike, and to this spinning stone with magma heart and green skin where we all live.

Whatever you can do to help with this project and in my greater journeys is more than enough, and I pledge to pay forward all that I can in the form of giving my deepest gifts that I have every opportunity I am given. 

I could not thank you all enough, and if I were to try, this would be the longest section of this whole dang thing.

And maybe that would be for the best.

With love and care, 

Galen Hanly Hefferman

or

Galen Ainle O' Hifearnain.

https://jahnaviveronicamusic.bandcamp.com/releases
 
I write songs that both come from and hopefully, bring people into the dreamworld. I write songs from starry skies, from stone halls in dreams, from grief and pain, from relief, from all that is living and for all that is living. I write songs to inspire people to serve the living earth and live to their greatest and deepest purpose. I write songs because they start to pour out of me anyway if I don't. 
In the Spring of 2018, after a long bout of strange and seemingly unfortunate events, I had a totaled car and tendonitis in my left hand, which left me unable to work or play stringed instruments. This led me into a deep process of asking questions about what I really came here to do, and by the end of the summer, I had experienced a number of visions detailing to me what I was to be doing:
I was to tour down the West Coast alone, with no recognition or recorded work, playing shows at little venues in, as it turned out, places that were dear to me as I was growing up, and building altars to the living earth, to remind people that we all come from vibrant living, singing, breathing history and cultures.With friends and family's help, I gathered enough funds to have a little place to sleep on the road, and a couple things to make videos in nature, and some extra funds to pay for gas and expenses. The entire tour sent me through a process of growing up and reflecting on how important it is to share what you have deeply inside you. It kicked off a summer of travel that lasted from April until October, and led Jahnavi Veronica (who joined me along the way) and I to share our music at venues and festivals from Washington, to Arizona, from Oregon Country Fair, to studying Persian Radif in New Mexico.  In September we had a short break between travels, and recorded two little EPs at home in three days. 
By the time October came around, we landed back in Portland, immediately had to move to a new place, and planned a Winter Solstice Ritual Concert that involved some 20 people, all centered around a beautiful mandala of living plants, meant to focalize and call in energy for life to come. 
Here's the poster for that show by Jahnavi and I. 

https://www.facebook.com/events/429118867999985... 
So here I am, asking for some help to record this album. I know better than ever how to create something on a shoestring budget, but I need support to get closer to the sound that I hear in my head.
 

What We Need & What You Get
We will record this album of 11-15 songs at my family's home in Portland, (the rooms sound fantastic, wood floors and high ceilings and all) so there will be no studio rental. Here's the Breakdown of our Costs: $3,000: Paying Alisdair Lee (an awesome local sound engineer) for mixing and mastering 15 songs. He charges $200 per song. (It takes him all day to mix and master one song)
$150: Coaching sessions with Alisdair on proper mic placement and recording techniques. (Some already completed, will need one more while we are recording)
$2,180-$3,350: Paying all the musicians and one engineer, (excluding myself, I am not asking to be compensated for my time) $60-$100/day for their time.$700-$1250: New Microphone: AT4050 or Soundelux U195I am already funded to purchase a Focusrite Clarett 4pre, an ART two channel Preamp with tube replacements, and an ART Tube Compressor with tube replacements, so I just need help with another microphone! These things are all an investment into future recordings of myself, friends and family, and others. $1,500: Printing Costs for 1,000 CDs and a lyric book with artwork and stories.  
$150: Album art photography and design. We are doing most of it ourselves, but may need to hire a friend to help us with some rope assisted tree climbing. (I'll leave it at that at the moment.)
$30: Costs for putting the Album on all the relevant platforms (spotify, itunes, etc) through CD Baby. 
$200: Extra Costs towards my rent while I am not able to do other work. As I said, I am not raising funds to be paid for my time, so this is the only personal cost I am including.
$800-$1000: Indiegogo Platform fees and processing fees. (about 10%) This is standard for all platforms like this.
$200-$450: Since this platform counts shipping costs towards my amount raised, I am adding estimated shipping costs onto my goal, $200-$500, although I am not sure how much this will cost, as it is impossible to calculate who will purchase what. If shipping costs are less than this, I will add this amount raised to paying others up to the $100/day mark, or adding more on to Alisdair's payment. 
Total Costs: 
$8,910-$11,080
 
A note on shipping outside of the U.S:
If you live outside of the United States, shipping packages to you is highly variable in cost. 
I cannot include these costs in my goal without raising the goal radically, so if you want to buy a physical item and you live outside of the USA, please contact me directly!
Also: If you live in Portland, Oregon or nearby, I would very much prefer to meet with you in person to give you your perks! This radically reduces the cost of shipping things to you, which is expensive for people without larger companies. 
Stretch Goals 
At $13,780, $2,700 past our $11,080 maximum goal, we will be able to do a run of Vinyl! (200 Copies) I will add this as another perk for those of you that want it. 
If we are able to raise our minimum goal of $8,910, we will be able to record, mix, master, and print CDs and album artwork, and get them out to y'all, and pay those playing on the album, with no stress. At $11,080, we will be able to pay everyone playing $100/day, and get a higher quality mic to record with. 
 
Why I chose flexible funding (and Risks)
This album is happening no matter what. I will not risk an all or nothing format, because I know that we will be able to fulfill the perks and get CDs to you all no matter what. I am in conversation with the people I am working with about this, and whatever we are able to raise, we will work with. We are used to doing everything DIY, so that would be nothing new. 
If we don't reach our goal, here is what could happen: 
-We could have to print the CDs/books ourselves to fulfill the perks. (We've done it before)
-The release of the album could be delayed, by as much as a month. 
-We could have to pay Alisdair a lower price than his asking price (We will do our very best to keep this from happening)
-Artists could be paid at the minimum of what I am asking. (This however is first priority for me)
 

Jahnavi and I were able to record our two little eps in the living room in a week, with a budget of about two hundred dollars, so imagine what we could do if we actually had the funds available to record, mix, and master properly!
 
If we are able to get this project off the ground, we will be able to put out something that is able to stand alongside more "professional" artists that are out there, and you will have a recording of music that has literally kept me alive at points to accompany you through your life, in moments of deepest grief and in ecstatic joy as well. 
 

Other Ways You Can Help
If you love this music and are excited for it to get out there, but you are, like so many of us, just getting by on what you have, no worries, I understand! 
I would love it if you could:
-Share this fundraiser with your friends who might be interested by personal message, or in person! 
-Tell your friends about my music! 
-Share this campaign with your friends on social media with whatever kind words you can muster. 
Become a monthly supporter on My Patreon (It has helped me pay rent and feed myself at certain points, and it covered printing costs for the Solstice Show poster!) https://www.patreon.com/galenhefferman
Website: 
www.galenhefferman.com
 
I carry so much gratitude in my heart,
to those of you that asked to hear my music in the beginning of this journey, learned and played my songs, participated as fellow musician or audience member, given me tips for where to play, told people about my music, given me inroads to festivals, contributed to my Patreon or helped me start up touring last year, to all those that love and care for me, and to all of you doing your best to be a beacon of kindness in this strange world.
I know that if I were not encouraged, cared for, and loved, and if it were not for music, I may not be alive today. I owe more gratitude than I could possibly articulate to all of my teachers, human and plant and animal and inter-dimensional being alike, and to this spinning stone with magma heart and green skin where we all live.
Whatever you can do to help with this project and in my greater journeys is more than enough, and I pledge to pay forward all that I can in the form of giving my deepest gifts that I have every opportunity I am given. 
I could not thank you all enough, and if I were to try, this would be the longest section of this whole dang thing.
And maybe that would be for the best.
With love and care, 
Galen Hanly Hefferman
or 
Galen Ainle O' Hifearnain.

story:
THE EMERSON THEATER

The historic Emerson Theater was opened was back in 1928. If you have visited the room recently, you can see that this age is really starting to show, and the room is in need desperate need of new life. 

It has become a legendary room in this area, and I would like to see it restored to its former glory. If I can raise the proper funds, I can attract the right people to bring in the type of talent we used to see come through the Emerson over the years, and much more. 

I believe that if the room was much improved, it could be easily re-opened and become a very enjoyable space for a huge variety of people, both here in Indy and for many miles around. If the room was remodeled nicely, there were more guest accommodations for attendees, sound and lights were good, I could eat and maybe get a drink, I could park my car safely, and I could see a show that I am interested in for a reasonable ticket price; now THAT is an ideal situation that I would like to see in our city.  And that is exactly what I would like to make happen. 

 

WHAT WE WANT TO DO

Here are the improvements we would like to make: 

  • Restore front signage to original condition
  • Expansion of theater and into neighboring spaces. More space & increased capacity will give us the ability to get bigger talent in the room, and do more things with the facility
  • Integration of kitchen, restaurant-area, and full service food menu
  • Expansion from beer/wine only to full alcohol menu 
  • General remodel of entire interior & exterior. New walls, fresh paint, new fixtures, etc. 
  • Improved utilities; electric, plumbing, HVAC
  • Remodeled bathrooms, mens bathroom floor flattened
  • Addition of nearby parking lot, patrolled by off-duty police to increase neighborhood safety
  • General clean up and revitalization of outdoor area, sidewalks, perimeter of building and surrounding areas
  • Addition of seated areas & balcony access
  • Improved stage, sound, & lights
  • Stage area flattened and redone

 

WHERE YOU COME IN

We have the right connections to make this happen! Unfortunately, we are but two men and need some help to make this dream for our city a reality. We are asking for your financial support if you would like to see this project and become a reality, and this community cornerstone restored to its rightful place as a great and safe entertainment facility for all ages.

story:
Hi, it’s Brad from Brad Sucks! You might know me from my songs Making Me Nervous or Lonely. I’ve released three records: I Don’t Know What I’m Doing (2003), Out of It (2008) and Guess Who’s a Mess (2012). I’m working on my fourth record, my first in over eight years (whoops), and it’s called A New Low in Hi-Fi.

The songs: The Motivation, In It to Win It, All Right Now, A Little Distance, Fun Guy, How to Not Kill Yourself, Paranoid Enough, Better than Nothing, Blackout Drunk & Lonely.

I wrote these songs over the past decade and they’re about social anxiety, alcoholism, creative blocks, failure, healing, isolation, death and moving on.

As usual, I’ve done the recording on my own and I’m in post-production now mixing with Rob Cosh who mixed my previous two records. Here’s a preview: 

 
 

Why Crowdfunding

I’m doing this as a way for you to preorder the next record so I know how many to press, but I’m also hoping to raise some money to cover its production, manufacturing and release. Any cash I raise past the cost of that is gonna go directly into the marketing and promotion of it. Promo copies, publicists, music videos and other expensive things I’m otherwise paying out of pocket for. I’ve worked really hard on this record and I want as many people to hear it as possible.

 

What You Can Get

Of course I’ve got some items to hopefully entice you. Besides the A New Low in Hi-Fi CDs and vinyl, I’m offering a limited edition cassette tape (including a digital download) of ten songs that didn’t make the album, signed handwritten lyric sheets, custom cover songs and also private live shows! 

 

Timeline

The digital download will be sent on or before release day (June 10, 2021) and the record and all rewards will ship in June 2021, likely a week before release.

 

Thank you

As always, I’m so grateful for your support and encouragement. What I do wouldn't be possible without you all. I’m excited to get rolling on getting this record out to the world, thank you so much and feel free to get in touch if you have any questions!

- Brad
